Taking care of the customer is definitely not important here!  We always try to support small businesses but they have to at least try to take care of their customers.
We obviously will never be back.  There are many other good breakfast places in Vegas to spend your money on.

Went to Biscuits today after hearing how great it was..........will never return again. Starting off we got seated quickly and waitress took our drink order only to return with the wrong drinks. I ordered the cinnamon roll french toast since it sounded delightful, hubby ordered kielbasa scrambled eggs. When food was brought to the table it was only his and we were told we were waiting on mine.....10 minutes mine arrives and was barely warm, not sure what I was waiting on. Needless to say the cinnamon roll french toast was horrible also ordered over medium eggs which were hard. Waitress brought new eggs which were cold and runny and my toast had hair attached to it. The manager told us this never happens and asked that we come back and try again, highly doubtful. Upon reading other reviews obviously this happens all the time.

Horrible experience here! We were seated by a grumpy waitress, she seved our drinks by slamming them on the table... We had to wait longer for my breakfast because the cook didn't get my order right. The sausage came out when we were done eating and was dry and gross. ..my cinnamon roll came out with the to go boxes... couldn't get refills on drinks. .  Waitress forgot our check and was annoyed when we asked for it. The chicken fried steak is extremely small... and just a heads up a side of the dry cold sausage was $4.19...I will never return to this restaurant

We had been anxiously awaiting the opening of Biscuits Cafe as there are very few breakfast/lunch places that are worth going to in this area. We were not disappointed! The space is roomy and inviting and the staff is friendly and knowledgable. We started with coffee, which was hot and very tasty.  The menu is extensive and covers all of the breakfast and lunch favorites anyone could ask for. The prices are moderate averaging around $10 per person for breakfast entrees but which may seem a bit expensive but once your food arrives, you will know why! My wife ordered the chorizo omelette which was awesome and huge, served with an equally huge portion of perfectly cooked hash browns and two very large, impeccably toasted sourdough slices. I ordered the biscuits and gravy which is accompanied by two eggs and your choice of bacon, sausage or ham. I ordered my eggs over medium and the bacon. The eggs were a bsolutely perfect and the bacon was thick and tasty. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

This is my second time eating breakfast here.
The food is great. The only negative thing I can say is the food portion is huge, which is actually good. So prepare to have a doggy back on your way out. Or maybe it's just me. Because I see some big people that eat a lot!! Hahaha..
The Service is excellent... And the staff, very friendly and professional..I highly recommend this place!!!

First time here and not returning
Offering a Benedict means it should have real hollandaise sauce (not here) some alien looking slop over 1 instead of 2 eggs and not hot faux smkd brisket and soggy English muffins and the waitress is stocking the condiments while I'm eating the replacement meal that is also mediocre 
Will not be returning

Love love love Biscuits!  Always good when we go and that's usually 1-2 times a week.  Chicken fried steak is delicious and so is the almond crusted French toast! Service is great,  people are friendly and never a long wait!  Would recommend biscuits to anyone and everyone.

Went in for the first time for brunch today. The woman who took our order was really nice. She could tell I was having a hard time making a decision and recommended the avocado eggs benedict. So I got it, even though I've never had that before and I love over-medium eggs. My partner got the chicken-fried steak. By the way, you order at the walk-up counter. 

We got our drinks and sat down. The food came out really fast! The pancakes for my partner were going to take a bit they said, which was no problem. About two minutes later, a man told us they had to make the batter for the pancakes so it was just going to be a bit longer and asked if we'd like some biscuits while we waited. We said sure, and he brought out two small, hot biscuits. THEY WERE DELICIOUS! And surprisingly really filling! He also brought some strawberry jam too. I don't even LIKE jam and I thought it was so good! And seriously 5 minutes later they brought out the pancakes. Not a big deal at all to wait at most 5-7 minutes for a side when your main meal is already out. But to bring some complimentary and delicious biscuits? EXCELLENT customer service and attentiveness all the way around. 

The chicken fried steak was really good and had some great flavor. The sauce especially had some nice seasoning to it. The hash browns were browned and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I personally would have liked them a bit more done, but it was no problem and really could be the difference of being cooked 30 more seconds. So, consider that my petty personal preference. Since I've never had eggs benedict before, I have nothing to gage my judgement against. So take what I'm about to say with a grain of salt: the first few bites were good. But after awhile, everything was a bit too soft and a bit too bland, even with salt and pepper. It makes sense; you have a smooth sauce, a poached egg (also my first one), a soft avocado, soft tomato slice, and an English muffin (evenly sliced and while warm, not toasted that I could tell.)  That's a lot of soft food with mellow flavors all at once. Not my favorite, but I could see how someone else would like it. Like I said, since it was my first one, I have nothing to compare. I ate about 1/2 of it, and since I had hash browns and that biscuit, you can see how I was full! Considering the chicken fried steak was delicious, I think it's just my preference that I didn't care for the eggs benedict. The only true compliant I'd have about it was that there was a bit too much hollandaise sauce. I would ask for half the amount. 

Overall we'd go back again, and try new things. They had some yummy sounding French toast and other solid breakfast staples.
Waited 20 minutes just to be acknowledged, manager took our order, food took another 30 minutes, food was ok, not very hot... Overall the experience wasn't very good...

Really great spot to get some brunch! The staff is on point and so is the food.  Their Eggs Benedict is to die for.  I've been here numerous times, and feel like a move to this side of town is necessary just to be closer to the restaurant.  This place is medium in size, but offers patios seating which is enjoyable with lots of shade from the overhanging building. I recommend this place if you love breakfast and brunch!

You know....I can't say our breakfast was bad....cause it was good.....can't say service was bad....cause it was good the morning we were there.....can't say it wasn't clean....cause it was....The only down side to us.....it's pricey....BUT.....the amount of food delivered on the plate is HUGE....You'll probably need a go box......that's the reason for the3 stars....I'd rather pay less for lesser quantity of food....Breakfast for the 2 of us was about 25 bucks...and we didn't have a beverage...

This was not only terrible good not also came worth even worse service! Went with a friend that said "they have the best burger" in town. We shared our order. First indication was when I noticed others who had been seated and offered after us. About 30 minutes after we had ordered in a restaurant that was half empty out "burger" showed up Luke warm, wilted lettuce, tomato slice with center core stI'll in, fires not even warm, the pickle which looked like it should have been great was limp and warm lastly we had asked for some thousand island dressing to dip the fries in. It had a film on top from sitting out too long. I made an attempt to eat but this was the worst good and service I have had in the 28 years of living in Las Vegas. All this for just under $18.00. Believe it or not Ieft a 20% tip...my bad. Plenty of great food in Las Vegas. Just not at the Biscuit Cafe. Never complained before. No redeeming qualities.

We decided to try something new. It's a big space which doesn't feel cramped like many restaurants do. We ordered the eggs Benedict avocado and biscuits and gravy. The Benny was good, but not outstanding. The biscuits weren't as "homemade and fluffy" as we hoped but the gravy was great. Coffee was good quality which some restaurants struggle with. Quick, friendly service. Breakfast for 2 was $24. I'm not sure we'd choose to come back, but if someone wanted to meet us here we wouldn't protest.

First time here. Will be back next time I'm in The Valley.  Had the Smoked Brisket Benedict - excellent.  Stacey had the Corned Beef Hash - GR8.
Service was excellent.

Listen, Biscuits - I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed.

This isn't my first rodeo. I know you're slammed on Sunday mornings. I know there's going to be a line out the door. That line is almost a promise to me that says "this must be worth waiting for." 

BUT, if you're going to make me wait for 40 minutes for my food (which I'm completely willing to do, by the way) please, please, PRETTY PLEASE:

Don't serve me French toast that is burnt black on one side, and try to hide it by putting the burnt side down on the plate. I even tried to eat a corner, to see if it was edible, because I knew how busy the kitchen was, and I hate sending food back - but it wasn't happening.

Don't offer me a two-inch-thick heap of hash browns if you can't send them out fully cooked - or, wait for it - browned. I'd happily take a normal serving of hash browns if you could promise me they would be crispy on the outside, and fully cooked in the middle. You know, like hash browns. 

Don't seat me in plain view of the kitchen and expo window unless your cooks are on their best behavior. I watched them bare-hand grabbing stacks of pancakes in the expo window and moving them from plate to plate OVER and OVER again. They did it so casually that it leads me to believe that it's just a standard, everyday occurrence in Biscuitville. Touching ready-to-eat food with bare hands is not only completely disgusting, but it's a health code violation; and it's completely unnecessary. I know you've got gloves back there, just put them on. 

Don't seat me at a table without actually, attentively, and thoroughly cleaning all of the gak off of it first. Listen, I like guessing games as much as the next guy, but at a restaurant, I never want to play "Guess the Mystery Breakfast Sludge on the Edge of The Table." Not my favorite.

Don't let the guy in the neon green Nike polo wander aimlessly around the restaurant in the middle of the breakfast rush doing next to nothing anymore. I'm guessing he's supposed to be some kind of manager or supervisor, but he's really just in the way. I sat in the restaurant for nearly an hour, and watched him roam the grounds at a snail's pace, with a look on his face that fell somewhere in between total apathy and complete shell-shock. He bussed a handful of tables, kind of wiped a few, but mostly he just siphoned precious oxygen from his very hard-working, very "in-the-weeds" wait staff. If he's not actually a manager or supervisor, who is he? Why is he wearing an obnoxiously loud polo? How has he mastered the art of sleep-working, and why are you letting him do it in your restaurant?

Speaking of the wait staff, that brings me to the positive portion of the meal:

Linda, my server, gracefully salvaged my breakfast by never letting my coffee cup run low, reacting quickly and professionally to my request for un-burnt French toast, and by generally doing the best she could to make the visit tolerable. Good job, Linda.

The biscuits, as should only be expected of a restaurant called Biscuits, were phenomenal as always - fluffy, pillowy, breakfast heaven, smothered in gravy that was both flavorful and appropriate in viscosity. 

My second, un-burnt offering of French toast was delicious, and so were the eggs and sausage patties on my plate. 

Listen Biscuits, I like you. I want to love you. We really click on a physical level; you've got the flavor I need. But I feel like your heart isn't in it. I guess what I'm saying is, maybe we need some time apart. I'm going to see other breakfast places for awhile, and maybe, just maybe - when you find your passion again, we can be together. It's not "goodbye," it's "see you later," okay?

What a find! We are in town visiting family and needed a quick stop for some lunch. We found Biscuits Cafe right off the 202. Service was amazing. My mom has an allergy to onions and the server was very vigilant about making sure there weren't any at our table. Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. The portions were generous and well worth the price. Would recommend this place to anyone.

This is a great place to grab brunch if you're not an early riser. The prices are a bit high, but hey, if you want breakfast during lunch hours then that's the price I guess. The place was cozy and spacious with friendly service. 

This was my first visit to Arizona, and the French toast with berries instantly made my day. It was divine! The berries were fresh, and the French toast was soft and sweet. The syrup was just the right amount of sweetness as it is not stark raving sweet. The portion was fairly large so don't worry about them skimping out. My friend's plate was humungous. It seemed like the food was going to fall off his plate. Lol. He's a guy, and if he says it's a lot of food for him, then it's a lot of food.

I would totally recommend this place to anyone wanting a delicious brunch meal with a cozy place to sit and talk.

Well we tried to eat here today for Father's Day. We walked in and almost fainted from the stifling steamy hot atmosphere. I mean I know it's going to be 117 today but this was like a sweat lodge and I only weigh 107 lbs ! Then we were taken to the tiniest table I've ever seen in a restaurant and my husband is 6'3 and 230 lbs. at that point we decided to leave. Maybe will try again in the fall.

Had a late breakfast here today.   Was very disappointed in the quality of the food.  The red potatoes were burned and tasteless.  They were served with a veggie wrap in a flour tortilla that was gummy and mushy.  Hubby had sausage with eggs and biscuits and gravy.  They were served with hash whites instead of hash browns.   He did eat most of his except for the hash.  Coffee is very weak.  Basically we will not be returning.   The redeeming factor of the visit was the waitress and the young man who seated us.  They were both very nice and attentive.

Love the food here, have come for breakfast twice now - service is fast n friendly, cafe mocha is sooo good and includes refills!  Agreed, it is better than just going to IHOP or Denny's :). Our server yesterday was Brock, very attentive while we were there...AND, we all had leftovers - just as good the next day!!

This place was AMAZING!! Incredible service & even better food. The almond crusted french toast might change your life. They even had flavored coffee creamer which I also loved. Would highly recommend!!
Finally found our new go to breakfast place!  Delicious food and great service.  Nice variety for both healthy and indulgent.  I would definitely recommend the cinnamon roll french toast!
Tried biscuits cafe for the first time and I loved it! The food and the service were excellent!

Good food, really, really, really bad service.  So slow at being served we saw server offering free meals to other people who were fed up with  waiting.  We paid for ours as we did not complain but will not go back again.  The server also did not come back and check on us at all, not even for refills. It was busy, but they should have been prepared.

Good breakfast. Ordered the chicken fried steak and it was really good. Slightly disappointed in the sausage gravy as there is barely any sausages in the gravy and biscuit my husband ordered. A little pricy, but still a good place to go for breakfast.
Best breakfast I have had in a long time. The owners are incredible people. The French toast is unbelievable!
I haven't heard very good things about this place but when i went on my own my impressions changed! Great menu items and the food was great!
Food was cold. Biscuits were dry and gravy was salty and weirdly seasoned. Will never try again. Left feeling like it was waste of money and ruined our Sunday brunch tradition.

This was our first visit to a Biscuits restaurant. It will definitely not be our last. The food was great, pumpkin pancakes, chicken fried chicken...delicious. On one of the hardest days of our lives, our server Meagan, made us feel welcome and offered her condolences. Friendly and very helpful. Thank you Meagan. You helped our family through a very tough time.

The service here was excellent! The bus boys were refreshingly personable, friendly and helpful. Food is always good too.
Sara S.

The Biscuits Cafe on Warner and Dobson was fantastic!  This one was good...but may have a new cook?  Grill may have been too hot, so the red potatoes were a little raw.  They did rebook them without a fuss...just a little disappointed after visiting the other one.  Customer service was very good and would maybe return to give it another shot.

The food is good, but they charge $.70 extra to add cheese to anything. Ridiculous! The nickel and diming people over a sprinkle of cheese is outrageous... Could deter me from coming back at this point when I can go somewhere else for the same price and not get charges for small extras.

I met a friend and her dsughter here for breakfast at their request.  They ate open for breakfast and lunch according to their sign.  The service was great and they were very attentive to out needs.  They are a typical Americana Cafe.  I ordered the Belgium Waffle with fresh Strawberries on it, 2 eggs and sausage on the side.  I originally wanted the 5 berry topping but the waitress explained it was frozen and not fresh, praises for her honesty.  The sausage patties were dry and not really worth the effort to eat.  My guest really enjoyed their meals.  Over all experience was satisfactory.  The best part, aginan was the wait staff.  I rated as high as I did because of the staff.

I've lived on this side of town for ten years and finally made it to Biscuits Cafe. I'd heard really great things about it and was excited to try it out. When we first walked in I noticed that the lights are somewhat fluorescent and that there weren't any cute, comfy looking spots to sit; all the seats were tables and I'm a booth kinda gal. Our table was sticky, so we had to ask our server to wipe it down again. The service overall was good and the food came out pretty quickly. I ordered an a la cart meal with hash browns, biscuits, and fruit while my friend ordered waffles. The food quality was okay but I wouldn't say it was amazingly better than anywhere else. May or may not go back?
Phenomenal! The brisket eggs Benedict is the best breakfast meal I've ever had! Great service and friendly staff

We got the chicken fried chicken & that was delicious along with their gravy, red potatoes were nicely seasoned!!! We also got the 5 mix waffle combo with turkey bacon & boy is the jam good!!! Server was very sweet & let me try the gravy before we ordered, Great Place!!!!
This place is packed. I love their breakfast menu. ..large portions and affordable price. Really good deal.

Went for breakfast yesterday,  I  will never go back! We were seated at a 2 top right in the walkway, we moved to the one next to the wall. We waited and waited, the manager,  who was on his 3rd day, came by and asked if anyone had been by yet, we said no. After quite a while longer, a waitress came by and took our drink order, I got iced tea, he got sour orange juice for $4.19, and from that high point it was all downhill! We both ordered ham and cheese omelets. The omelets had tiny cubes of ham inside and a slice of american cheese melted on. Top! The red potatoes,  I  got mine well done, so they were deep fried and no seasoning like my dining partner, I only ate a few! The pancakes were large and thick but the biscuits looked like dinner rolls and the top and bottom were VERY hard! Wait and wait for a drink refill until it was time to leave. The check was brought to me soaking wet in the server's dripping wet hands.
 The table next to me asked for medium well eggs, the egg whites were still runny!!
 This is not an experience I am willing to risk repeating!  The $10.99 for 2 eggs, 2 pcs of. Bacon, potatoes and 2 biscuits was over priced for the quality! ! I will go elsewhere!

Do yourself a favor and find another place to eat. This place is awful! Our experience started out bad and got worse-I should have paid more attention to the previous reviews. 

My wife and I went there on a Sunday morning and were greeted with "2?" at the door, not "good morning", "welcome"...nothing. That would have required some interest from the two geniuses at the entry. 

After being seated at a table, which had crumbs all over the seats and table, we knew this was not going to go well. We sat for nearly 10 minutes, all the time watching the completely disinterested staff chat with each other....we left. 

The best thing that could happen to this place is fire the staff and start over. If that doesn't work..close.

First visit since moving to this side of town. Hard working staff besides one of the front hostess girls who seemed to be a little out of it. Thinking she had a long night. :) great food!! I'll be going back for sure!

Saw that this location recently opened, so went to check it out this weekend, and so glad we did.  The place looks and feels like a somewhat retro diner but its all new, modern and clean.  You order at the counter, and seat yourself, and you get your own drinks.  I liked this because you end up getting your food faster. The prices were normal, but they do have good lunch specials with soup, salad & half a sandwich for around 8 bucks or so. 

Each item we had, from the hash browns, to the eggs, to the chicken fried steak & even the pancakes were all really good, hearty, and tasted fresh. Large generous portions, and our plates came with a big ol' chocolate covered strawberry. Bring your appetite and definitely try the cinnamon bun!
Service was friendly and food is fantastic.  The preparation of food is consistent and they have the best hash browns in Summerlin.

If I could just rate this place for our waitress, I would give her 5 stars. Extremely friendly and took care of us very well. 

Unfortunately, the food was just not very good. I ended up ordering smoked brisket eggs benedict - on the recommendation of the waitress. I asked her which would be more flavorful out of the smoked pork and brisket, and she told me to get brisket. Well, the brisket was really dry, and had no taste. 

Overall the atmosphere and the staff were great, but the food was lacking.
Our first time here for lunch. I had the California club with salad and my husband had the club with yankee pot roast soup. Both were delicious

Totally love this place!! Enormous menu, which is usually a turn off, but everything looked so delicious that I actually wanted to order it all! 

Staff was friendly and attentive, our server Jocelyn was great! :) Our food came out very fast and it was so yummy! 

I had the Almond Crusted French Toasts!! OMG!!! So good!!! 

I will be back many, many more times! :)
Our first time but not our last. The biscuits are fantastic and so was the gravy. We also had the cinnamon roll French toast which was great. The place is small but the service was big.

the staff was very polite and good service. 
It he food however was terrible. I ordered chicken and waffles. The chicken was too hard to put a fork in. They politely cooked more. But 2 of 4 were not edible. 
My wife had fish and chips. It was only ok.

We came here rather than going to the Biscuits on Elliot. We had a time constraint but was there in plenty of time. The host told us it would be a 15 minute wait. We waited and all the people that were there before us were gone, and we were next on the list for 5 people.  Then they took a party of eight that came after us, then a party of 4 that came after us and multiple more. My wife went and asked and was told they were waiting on a table. We watched a couple more go in front of us. We finally had to leave due to our other arrangement.  Can't review the food, never got in.  We will not be returning to this location.  I would rather drive to Elliot.

We recently moved to this part of town and decided upon first seeing the moniker that we were absolutely going to eat at this restaurant! 

We ordered an all egg whites veggie omelette und eine Belgian waffle. We both had coffee. Overall, I really like the place. I was happy that they put cream cheese inside of the omelette because it made it taste so good!

The coffee mugs were gigantic and it was so good because I really wanted to guzzle some coffee today :-) it wasn't that busy, and I think that's why our waitress kept checking back.

My only complaint is that I really really like visiting places of business with a multicultural staff. This place might be new and they might just be working with the first staff they could find, so I hope to come back and see many different types of employees to represent the many different types of clients in this world :-)

First time here. Was highly recommended. Had the Clam Chowder which was very thick & creamy. Just the way I like it. Came with a side of cornbread which was nice & moist. Then I had the Country Benedict. If you can't decide between getting Eggs Benedict & Bisquits & sausage gravy then this is the dish for you. It was delicious. Service was also superb. The whole staff was very attentive & making sure we were taken care of.

We decided to eat here as my car was being serviced next door. I wanted to like this restaurant considering it is locally owned. Our server was prompt and courteous, and the food was bland. Unfortunately it was a disappointment, from being ignored when we waited to be seated to the extremely soiled floors. When we went to pay, the cashier had a difficult time processing a card transaction. I understand these things happen but rather than asking for help she continued to struggle for a very long time without acknowledging anyone in line. Just not a good experience whatsoever.

First time here, had to try after reading Yelp reviews.  Saf(er) part of LV.  Went on Saturday at 830 am was way not busy, was surprised, but good time to go, not busy!!
Ordered biscuit and gravy breakfast including eggs and hash browns was great, will order again. 
Good service, coffee cup never empty, Yasmin was great!!

According to Jackie and Madeline it was very slow for a Sat morn. FYI.  5 star super friendly staff.

So just moved to Las Vegas and had my 1st breakfast at Biscuit Cafe. What a great choice. The place is very simple and clean. Wait staff from walking in the door to leaving was very warm and friendly. Now to the food my
husband ordered the corn beef hash and eggs with biscuits.  The hash was home made and plentiful he said it was the best hash he ever had. The biscuits were fluffy light and delish the homemade strawberry jam on the side was a nice touch and a sweet treat. I had something called Keep it Simple which consists of picking 3 items for
$8.99.  Choices were plentiful I went with
2 eggs, sausage links(2)  and a sweet potato pancake. The links were nice and plump and had a great flavor. The pancake was huge and truly cake like-yum! I thought they accidentally gave me 2 but it was only 1.  Upon leaving I signed up for their rewards program. For every dollar you spend you get a point and with food  this good we'll definitely be coming back again and again.

Best breakfast place in Chandler!! Hands down, this place has the BEST pancakes. I took my kids here a few days ago and everyone loved it - pancakes, omelet, and French toast. Service was very friendly. They have a nice patio that will be great in the fall. We will be back!
I wish this place was still open. They made the Best Pot Roast Soup. it was hot and had alot of meat in it. They also had a great club sandwich. Will miss them alot

Nice place, great menu with lots of choices. The biscuits and gravy were great combined with a side order of sausage. The cinnamon roll french toast was great as well. The service was friendly and fast. Love this place we need a location in Phoenix.

I am really not a big breakfast person.  When I do eat breakfast, I like to get a belgian waffle and its amazing how many restaurants can't get it right.  Well, at Biscuits Cafe, they do get it right.  You can either get a plain belgian waffle, one with fruit and whip cream, or you can get a combo, a waffle, eggs and some sort of meat-bacon or sausage.

I also like that the restaurant is clean-very clean.   Waiters, waitress, waitpersons? whatever-they have all been pretty friendly as well.
Fantastic food and such fast service! My husband and I tried it for the first time last weekend and we will definitely be back! Excited to try more food! The corned beef hash was great!

This was my first and last visit.  Ordered Florentine Benedict with hash browns and sausage.  The eggs were overcooked not poached.  The muffin did not seem toasted, was mushy. The sauce was tasteless and so were the hash browns. The sausage was a tiny portion, smaller than a hockey puck and if the hockey puck had any taste, it would have been better than this dried out salty piece of meat. No adjustment was made on the bill to make things right.

I had heard pretty good reviews about this restaurant so, one day my mother and I decided to try it out. 
We ordered the biscuits and gravy to share and I had two eggs over medium well that we're cooked perfect, bacon, which was kinda too greasy but tasty. My mother had two eggs over medium, which the egg white weren't cook all the way and ham, which she said was good. We both had coffee, which was good and two glasses of water. 
Now, the only real compliant about this place was the water. The water tasted like they had gotten it right out of a pond! It was the worst tasting water I have ever had!! If they just cleaned to up and used a water filtration system or purified water system, it wouldn't be half bad. 
Are waitress was very nice and commentating but, I drink a lot of water so, I don't think I'll be back. 
Food was pretty decent though!

Absolutely loved this place! We looked up places to eat and this came up and we are very glad we went! My boyfriend got the Ham Scramble which was awesome and I got the Cinnamon French Toast combo and it was great! The service was great, the restaurant was also kept very clean, and everyone seemed to have a smile on their face and looked like they enjoyed working there! I would defiantly try it, we'll be back!

Our server Melissa was amazing. She was attentive and gave good suggestions on what to eat. The food was...mediocre and kind of flavorless. We heard some good things about this restaurant so decided to give it a try for brunch. We were disappointed to say the least. It wasn't gross, it wasn't good, it was just...meh.

Wanted to try a new place out for breakfast. I remembered this place so I decided to check it out. I have to say I looked over the reviews before hand, of course, and was a little jaded by some of the bad reviews.
I arrived and was greeted and seated right away. It looked like a very nice place. Small but not tiny and pretty busy. I saw on the chalkboard in front that the Blueberry Pancake Combo was featured today. I thought it was a special but saw it on the menu and realized it was just featured. So server came over and was very nice. Took the drink order. Those came back pretty quick. Then placed the food order. He was very helpful even with a very particular special order.
Food came out in a timely manner and piping hot. Pancakes were a good size and very good. Blueberries were fresh. Bacon was nice and thick and just right. Eggs were done just the way I had asked. Everything was very good. Even tried one of their biscuits. How can you not when that is the name of the place and they were really good too.
Pancakes really filled me up could not finish. Stuffed in a good way. Overall, I thought the food was great, service was good and fast, the prices weren't bad and the place was nice and clean. I don't understand the bad reviews unless they came on a bad day or not everyone can be pleased. Don't know but I will be back to try out some of the other stuff on the menu that looked good. It was nice to find a new place for breakfast especially after some old favorites have gone down hill recently.

Had breakfast here for the first time the other weekend due to a suggestion from my in-laws. Walking in, I knew it was going to be a great place because its straightforward and all about the food. The servers were very friendly and they remembered my in-laws who had only been there once the week before. That is always a good sign.

The menu offers variety at good prices. I ordered the coffee and thought that it was very good coffee compared to other breakfast joints in the area. I ordered the breakfast tacos with corn tortillas and they were really good and filling! I couldn't even eat the last taco and I normally finish my plate! My husband ordered a veggie breakfast burrito and when they delivered the food it looked so tasty and filling, but the veggies made it so watery and was near impossible for my husband to eat it! I tried my sister-in-laws veggie omelet and it tasted as if they cooked the veggies better in hers because the veggies did not water down the eggs. I thought the veggie omelet was very good in comparison to other Las Vegas breakfast restaurants and will probably order that next time. I also saw tables next to us order the biscuits which were huge, fluffy, and steamy. I cannot wait to try one next time and update my review!

This is got to be the worst place to eat.. I order a cup of soup. It arrived cold..  Than I order cinnamon french toast with eggs it all arrived very cold they did not have our place settings no silverware napkins on the table we had to wait 10 minutes for napkins and silverware then I went to the restroom one of the employees came out still wearing the glove I was not sure if he was a busboy or one of the cooks as I proceeded to eat my cold french toast I found a hair on my plate..   The service was super slow.

I love this place; it's my favorite breakfast place on the north side. Service speeds can fluctuate based on how busy they are, but that's what you get with a good restaurant. A breakfast will run you from about 9-12 dollars which is average, but the amount you get is more than anywhere else I've been. The reviews on here seem pretty mixed, so I'd say you have to try it for yourself, but it may very well end up being the best place you'll find.

It' s a crap shoot, depends upon the cook.  The Staff is eager to please, down to earth, and you'll feel welcome.  But, depending upon the wind direction, and day, you will notice a difference in the food that, well, lands on your plate.  Vegas, Baby!

After a few months, we came back because we were in the area. The food here is pretty good, but the service could be better. Our food was slow to come out, because they were busy, so I guess that is a good thing. After waiting a few minutes with an empty coffee cup, I had no choice but to go get myself more coffee. No one was there of course, so I went into the coffee room and poured it myself. I told our waitress I did that, and she was very attentive afterwards. Too little - too late. Mediocre food and bad service is why Biscuits went from 5 to 3 stars in my book.

Went here for a late breakfast today. The food was tasty and the portions were large. I had bacon and eggs with pancakes. I couldn't eat the 3 pancakes, they were delicious but big and there were 6 pieces of perfectly cooked bacon. My son had the cinnamon roll French toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. He is a 6ft 3inch young man and couldn't eat it all. Again 6 pieces of bacon and the French toast piece was huge. He was pleasantly stuffed!  I recommend it!  The service was good too, very pleasant and timely. A nice morning.

Went here for a late breakfast today. The food was tasty and the portions were large. I had bacon and eggs with pancakes. I couldn't eat the 3 pancakes, they were delicious but big and there were 6 pieces of perfectly cooked bacon. My son had the cinnamon roll French toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. He is a 6ft 3inch young man and couldn't eat it all. Again 6 pieces of bacon and the French toast piece was huge. He was pleasantly stuffed!  I recommend it!  The service was good too, very pleasant and timely. A nice morning.

We were seated promptly due to a very small crowd at 11:00 a.m., and we enjoyed sitting on their patio on a beautiful day.  I ordered the Veggie Head omelette and it was fine, but it could be so much better with the addition of more veggies.  It was packed with under-sauteed green peppers, onions, tomatoes, and avocado.  Adding broccoli, zucchini, and red peppers would be appropriate considering it's called "Veggie Head."  I liked that I could choose pancakes instead of toast and I enjoyed the red potatoes that came with the omelette.  My husband enjoyed his chorizo omelette with hash browns.  Prices were high.  Each entree was $13 and coffee and soda were $3 each, making this restaurant more expensive than the other great options nearby, such as Snooze, Hen House, etc.  Service was okay, but not terrific, and it seemed they were short-staffed today.

Great little neighborhood diner spot.  Decor and view are nothing to write home about, but what are you here for?  To be swept away by the ambiance or have breakfast/brunch.  Food portions are very large so be warned, you don't really need sides and add-ons, don't worry, you'll be full.  

Servers are polite and cheerful, it's sort of server by committee rather than one committed server but they do a good job of making the rounds and making sure you have all you need.  The chicken fried steak is my favorite and pretty much everything else I've tried is very good, in all fairness though I never tried any lunch items, but I feel this is more of a breakfast place anyways, it's not as crazy crowded as other places get on weekends.  There will be a wait, but not an insane one.

Only knock on the place is the coffee, it's not bad...but its not good either.  But everything else is pretty damn good for a strip mall diner.
Delicious food and great service!! Nicki was the best server, so friendly and efficient!!

Not many breakfast choices in this area, so pleasantly surprised to find this one though Yelp. Had passed this location a bunch of times, but never heard or saw anything about it. Don't think they advertise. Maybe they don't need to. We've gone four weeks in a row now on a weekend, and each time has been decently busy. Not a ridiculous long wait, but busy.

Like: the Keeping it Simple option. You choose three items for $7.99. A good amount of choices, one of which is two pancakes, which are 7-8 inches and fluffy. Had to take these home. These have been consistent. Hash browns are tasty. Omelets are large. Kids' portions are also a good size. 

Dislike: tables and chairs lack comfort. No booths. Kind of stark interior, like it is temporary. Biscuits need help. The first time, I raved about them, they were so good. The other three times, dry and tasteless. This should be their thing, no?

Overall, the food is good. I don't think the pictures posted do it justice. Almost didn't try it because some of the pictures made the food look greasy. Cleaner than Good Egg. Service is decent. Not spectacular, but no complaints there either. And they have a rewards club. That's always appreciated.

My wife and I enjoy lunch at the Surprise location frequently.  The food is great, the biscuits are awesome, and the staff is generally friendly.  The rewards program is really rewarding.  I have deducted a star, probably should deduct two,  because this location is quirky about silverware, as in they never seem to remember it.  We are on our fourth visit in a row where they delivered the meal, but we had to ask for silverware.  On the last visit, after waiting five minutes after the food came to get the utensils to eat it, my wife actually walked back to the kitchen and got it herself.  The amazing thing is no one seemed to care! For goodness sakes, there is a Walmart 500 feet away, go buy some more cheap knives and forks!  If the biscuits were not so awesome and the food good, we would drop this place.  Keep making us fight for basic utensils and we will.

Unimpressed, wanted to try somewhere new with my family but it took forever to get the food, then it wasn't hot. Pancakes were overdone and English muffin was too tough. The cinnamon roll French toast was good though.
My favorite biscuits and gravy in town. We always have great service here and the food is on point. This is the best breakfast spot in south Chandler!

I tried this place for the first time on Saturday and was very happy that I did. This is going to be one of my favorite breakfast places! The staff was top notch with fast friendly service. I had the ham and eggs with a pancake and hash browns. Everything was very flavorful and cooked perfectly.  My friend had the made from scratch corned beef hash and it looked awesome so I will want to try that myself next time. They had a sign on the door "We don't serve fast food, we serve good food as fast as we can"  The strawberry preserves were really good, I was tempted to buy a jar of them on my way out. Price was reasonable for the quality and quantity of food I received. I will definitely be a regular here!

Back at my favorite breakfest spot...There food is great..Service is always top notch..All employees are friendly and outgoing..Prices are good..portions are good..And the bonus is its close to my house..They are only open till 2pm which works well for me since I work nights and my morning starts around 11:30am.Try it out sometime...way better then them hole in the wall dinners..Foods alway freshly made and tastes great

I have eaten here three times and run into the same issues as other yelpers.  The food is good but each time I have eaten here my food comes out cold.  The service has been great as the second time I ate here I asked the waitress for a new plate and she accommodated me.  The only problem is that the second plate came out cold as well.  I let here know and she asked if I wanted another plate.  I declined and just ate the cold food.  The place is usually busy when I go so it is quite slow for orders and food delivery.  They may want to step up the kitchen slightly.

Huge menu and pretty good breakfast 
Would recommend as we stop after church and enjoy the cornbeef hash or chicken fried steak
Great portions
Can tend to be very busy on weekends

great breakfast...had joe's scramble.  very tasty and huge!!  could make 3 meals out of that.  the only thing i didn't like is the cashier took care of you but you paid up front and she printed out the receipt then and there so people were in line and could see whether you left a tip or not and how much if they had great eyes.  not my fav way to check out.

Two stars only because my sister liked her food. Ordered red potatoes with biscuits and turkey bacon. Turkey bacon was as hard as a rock, biscuits were okay! Nothing to have a restaurant named after them. Red potatoes were still hard. Then half way through there was a hair in my dish, not to mention the soggy strawberries they charge as a full side! No thanks!!

Today we arrived at 8:40 or so. Very busy - Very noisy.  Immediately tried to seat us right at the service station.  Waited 20 min or so to order. The order then took about 45 min. to arrive.  Very understaffed.  When we asked the server if they were short staffed (thinking this was the reason for the poor service) we were told  "O,  No !"  Of course not.  No auto coffee refills, or water.  Others who ordered after us were served before us.   At one point the server asked us how everything was -- didn't even look at the table to see we had no food.  Finally after complaining (and asking for a second cup of coffee)  she gave some excuse about not putting the order in the right place.  Been there a number of times, but I will not be back as there are lots of other places you can go in the area.

This is going to rival where I choose to go to for brunch with family and friends 'cause I was pretty loyal to the Egg & I on Arville and Sahara for savory moods/cravings. 
Came here to meet up with one of my best friends, who's one of the establishment's regulars. He gave me the scoops on this place... Family-owned and actually staffed by the family, and everything is freshly made and follows family recipes. 
I had the Zesty Chorizo Omelet, and that plate was a bigger portion than I expected! The biscuits were still hot out of the kitchen, the jam/preserves that's served was yummy! Could honestly tell that it wasn't store-bought. The omelet was the main star of the plate - savory and balanced/cut back with avocados. Hahaha... No salsa needed. One should also order their potatoes crispy per recommendation of our server. 
I can't forget to mention that the customer service was extremely good! I was warmly greeted right away, my friend and I were checked on by our server as soon as I took a seat. Personable conversations too! Hahaha... Not just because my friend makes it easy to chat to, but the owner and his daughter got to genuinely catch up since they last saw each other in the restaurant. 
I'll definitely be asking my friends to meet up here whenever we can get together for brunch, and I'll even try to get my family to try this place sometime soon.

I tried to give 0 stars but yelp requires at least one.  We couldn't even get it. I stood at the counter for 10 minutes trying to get my name down without any service. One woman was checking tables out and there were two employees just standing there. I got smiled at but no other acknowledgement. Then two people came in and said the exact thing I did and got their names down immediately. I asked why my name wasn't put down when asked and again, no response. Terrible experience. We left.

I had never heard of this place but am glad I found it! We came here around 8am on a Saturday and JUST beat the rush of the breakfast crowd. They have a big menu and even bigger coffee cups :) Our server was really helpful. I ended up ordering a scramble and ate every last bite. The toast was a favorite as it was a seed bread! I am a fan !

My husband went here New Year's Eve and ordered the corned beef hash. He said it could have been cooked more especially the potatoes as it was just warm and before he could finish, it was cold.  We came here this morning (January 3, 2015), and I ordered scrambled egg whites (needed to be cooked more), ham and hash browns.  I asked for the hash browns well done, and overall it was just okay.  Husband ordered the pork kielbasa and it was just lukewarm and the hash browns needed to be cooked more. Most of the reviews I read were favorable, but we probably won't be back. Too bad, we were looking for a new breakfast place. Omelet House in Summerlin is way better and very consistent!

First timers here! Waited about 15 Minutes for a table on a Sunday. Which isn't bad. Our sever Heather was quick got us waters right away and she was very friendly. Food didn't take long. My husband got the chicken fried steak I got the zesty chorizo omelette both came with pancakes! Chicken fried steak was good. My omelette was good there was a lot bell peppers and onions I mean a lot which kinda threw me off but I just picked em out. Gonna be back to try out some other things. I wanna try the avocado toast! My kids shared the kids pancake combo on the kids menu. My 7 year son made the comment that the food was heaven!!! See ya next time Biscuits!

this is my first time at this restaurant, and my server was brooke . she was very kind and made sure we had drinks by the time we even sat down.  AMAZING! because I was in need of a coffee and quick . lol . she checked on us as our food arrived and even made sure it was right . I would love to bring my friends here and family ! thank you brooke for fantastic service

Was thrilled to find a new restaurant in Surprise, Arizona.  Attempted to make a reservation for 8 and was disappointed to hear that they didn't take reservations for large parties.  Asked to speak with the manager and was told there were no exceptions.  Was also told if I had a problem with their policy to "feel free to go elsewhere".  With that being said, we decided to go elsewhere.  I didn't know how to rate it

Overpriced and not very tasty.My wife had the sweet potato pancakes and they were horrible and she loves sweet potatoes. She left them uneaten. The waitress offered to bring something else out but by the time time the offer was made I had finished my forgettable strawberry pancakes.
Really good food, and huge portions. Definitely worth the price. Decided to come here instead of the usual chain breakfast places and wasn't disappointed. I definitely will be coming back here again.

I came here to have breakfast this morning.  Sat down at 9:10 walked out at 9:35 with Not one eye contact Not a hi, No here's some water, No service at all.  I sat and watched a family in front of that had already been sitting there get there order taken then food delivered.  Another table to the left of me receive their meal and beverages refilled.  So two different servers at a couple different times and two different helpers to bring out food and whatever the tables needed.  I watched tables that walked in after Me get coffee, water, service and their food.  Very unacceptable service.  There was No Communication between the staff.  People looked at me but noone even asked if I had been helped or offered to help. I won't be trying this place again.  Poor,  poor service.

One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. Every single time I've eaten here I've been completely happy. I order the almond crusted french toast almost every time. It is so delicious! My husband is super picky and always makes his order very specific and they've never had a problem with accommodating his picky orders. Their portions are great for the price.  The servers are always in good moods and attentive. I love their rewards program too because it adds up fast.

It was a little below average for me. If the name of your restaurant is biscuits, you better serve some pretty darn good biscuits, and they were not that good. 

We chose to sit outside on a beautiful October morning and were seated right away. I had my infant with me, but they had no sling for his carrier (and apparently their high chairs do not convert to accommodate a carrier either). Therefore, my 3 month old had to sit in his carrier on the ground while I ate; I watched him like a hawk because there were ants close by. Not a good start.

My girlfriend had been here before and said the food was delicious (she doesn't have a good track record for recommending restaurants).
I ordered one biscuit and gravy off the a la carte menu. The waiter said it came with 2 sides??? What? It's a la carte; I don't want a whole meal!?!  Obliging, I picked links and red potatoes, again the red potatoes were raved about by my friend. I'm going to stop taking her suggestions. My plate came out and 3/4 of it was covered by lukewarm red potatoes. Actually, my whole plate was lukewarm; very disappointing. The biscuit had a weird spongy texture, not a good biscuit. I can make better Bisquick biscuits at home. The gravy was ok, not horrible, but nothing to brag about. And, the potatoes, I just didn't get it. I poked around at them hoping they would magically turn into something that tasted good, but I left them on my plate just as they came. 
Would I come back to give them a second chance? Absolutely not. There was not one thing on my plate that was worth the splurge. I make better biscuits and gravy at home. Why would I go out to eat mediocre food?

Today I visited again with my mom and some friends. It's been quite a while since my last visit so I was sure Biscuits had improved. This was unfortunately not the case. It was around 10 on a Sunday that we went so I was expecting a wait. We only waited about 10 minutes for a table though. "Impressive," I thought. But once we ordered, we waited over 45 minutes for our plates to come out. This time I tried the biscuits, thinking since that was the name of the restaurant, they must be great. They were basically the same quality as KFC. Not that they were bad, but they honestly didn't deserve to be the restaurant's namesake either. I also had the turkey bacon which was hard as a rock. It was tough to cut with a metal knife which was really sad. And my last item, two eggs over medium, came out already punctured. Apparently they still haven't gotten it together here sadly.

This place is amazing. The corned bee hash is the best I've had in years! The portions were very generous. My daughter raved over how good the pancakes were, and she's not easy to please. This place is definitely a must try if you're in the area. I will be adding this into my weekly breakfast rotation.
Food is delicious. Service was great. My four year old said it best, "Mommy we come here for every breakfast k mommy?"

We had lunch here for the first time Tuesday. I was dispointed there were no booths only tables. Our server took a while to come by but was very friendly. I ordered the Breakfast burrito and my bf got the meat lovers omelette. My burrito was great, kinda small. The meat lovers omelette had the cheese on top off the omelette rather than inside wich was weird and left it kinda dry. We never got our water refilled and waited a very long time to get the check. We probably won't go back.
The staff was very professional and friendly.  The food brought very quick and coffee was good!  But the food was okay and slightly pricy.  I would go back but maybe try something else
Thanks to the staff for staying open just a few minutes longer to make me breakfast!This is what Vegas is supposed to be. Great food and great customer service.
Super expensive for what you get.  Very boring and tasteless. Worst omelet I ever had if you call that an omelet! Water down coffee and a horrible pancake. Never come back here again!

Found this place by accident looking for what I thought would be an affordable alternative to Cracked Egg and Dennys, but I was wrong. The least expensive item being one biscuit with gravy and eggs and sausage with a coffee came to just over $12.00 dollars. Not my idea of a reasonable price point for breakfast. The food was ok, not great over the top and certainly not worth that kind of money to have a waitress hovering over me while I am trying to decide whether or not to tip on the bill. Sorry but I wont be back to this place.

"If you don't eat all your vegetables there won't BE an economic recovery!" said a frustrated mom to her son right as our group passed her table one recent summer afternoon for a quick lunch. Or at least that's what it sounded to ME like she was saying. The server sat us in right about the middle of the restaurant and my seat faced the window where I could see the Dobson road traffic passing by. I studied the menu looking for something to catch my eye and appetite. I settled on the BBQ Western Bacon Burger. Portions were huge and you get a lot of bang for the buck. The burger was alright but nothing that makes me want to come running back over here for another one. One of my dining companions got the Classic Club sandwich for $10.49 and holy fecal matter, batman! That sandwich was huuuuuuuge! I think that one was definitely meant for sharing. Heck, you could probably feed a family of four with that as long as nobody in that family requires two seats for air travel. But that's a secret for now apparently. The place wasn't packed when we came by. Not sure if this place that once housed the slightly overpriced Vietnamese restaurant Anise (which probably couldn't compete with the two cheaper Vietnamese joints right across the street in the Lee Lee's mall) will make it into our lunch rotation or not. I do know one thing - if I find myself starving and low on cash, the Classic Club is definitely an awesome value meal!!

This place is awesome, always greeted with a smile and very polite cashiers. This is a counter order establishment. Place your order and they give you a number to place on your table. They run food out to your table. The portion sizes are great. Have 2 TV's to keep you occupied if needed. Breakfast is available all day.

I'm a French toast fanatic. I've tried a lot French toast platters at different restaurants. This place wins tho. Best French toast I have ever had. Almond crusted for the win. If you go, by all means - get it. It's excellent. Service was good, and it has a friendly vibe. I will be going back for sure.

This place was delicious! I went on a Saturday morning, didn't have to wait to be seated because the place was huge. 
I saw huevos rancheros on Yelp so I asked if they could make them for me (because they weren't on the menu) and they were able to. They were delicious.

Waitress was nice and friendly. Touching the menu made me have to go to the bathroom and clean my hands, sticky film all over the menu and table. Silverware, cups and plates were filthy to the point of me not being able to touch the cup of coffee, I asked for a different set and the issue was identical, no one seemed to care so i washed it myself in the bathroom. Food was horrendous, the portions were huge but 10 pounds of copper is still cheaper than one gram of gold. 

I ordered the turkey reuben, i dont think anyone else ordered anything turkey since it seems like it was left over from thanksgiving. Wife had sausage and eggs with pancakes, the sausages angered the chef so the chef punished them by burning them to the ground, pancakes were raw in the middle and the eggs were runny. No one really cared, they handed a check and left.

Well... not my favorite restaurant for breakfast, but not horrible either. We've been wanting to try it for awhile. The staff is very friendly and accommodating I ordered biscuits and gravy and for a restaurant with biscuits in the name the actual biscuits are very disappointing. They are very, very tiny. The hubby enjoyed his chicken and waffles, but I can't get over my biscuit disappointment. lol So, I think we'll stick with our usual place from now on.

this place is really hit or miss. The first time I came here, we all got things like pancakes and French toast. those were yummy, but anything else we've ordered on the menu turns out pretty terrible. if you want sweet things, this place is good. otherwise, just find another place for lunch.

Nice little breakfast spot. Ample seating. Clean. Friendly staff.

I have been here a couple times and have never had to wait for a seat or long for my food. I also haven't come here on a busy weekend day when most people go out to breakfast. If you are coming by after church on Sunday, chances are there will be a wait for both.

I've had the corned beef hash and the chicken fried steak. Corned beef was okay, chicken friend steak was great. Red potatoes are delicious, biscuits are a must but nothing to write home about, and the pancakes are large and a must have as well. The coffee mugs are large and are refilled often.

Definitely recommend!

If I could leave a negative star review, I would. We waited over 45 minutes for our undercooked breakfast. The scramble that we ordered was wet with some unknown fluid. We sent it back and the one we received in return also was wet. The French toast was under cooked and the bacon was  extremely chewy. I wouldn't even recommend this place to my worst enemy.

First time here. It was okay. 

The Good: Restaurant is bright and clean. Food came fast. Service was excellent from both our server and the bus staffer.

The Not-so-Good: Coffee was weak. Food was above average but just above. Extremely expensive. Omelets are all $12 and up. Biscuits and Gravy is $11 with two biscuits and an egg and bacon. Coffee was $2.50. Orange juice was $2.50 for a small glass.

I guess I just don't expect to pay $19 (before tax and tip) for scrambled eggs with ham, hash browns, two pancakes, coffee, and a small OJ.
I went here once for lunch with some co-workers. Portion sizes are great. The server was attentive. I ordered a veggie omelet and was not overly impressed. It's was okay, not great but not horrible.

UPDATED BELOW: My wife, sister in law and I ate here Sunday april 16, 2017 @11:30am.

Pros - Nicely decorated. Food was OK, not great but not terrible tasting.

Cons - 1) expensive for what you get, $55 for 3 breakfasts, none were steaks.
2) Had the wrong cheese on sister's scrambled eggs, took forever to get it corrected, almost as we were leaving did they finally show up.
3) after we left, my wife and I both immediately had diarrhea for 2 straight days
4) restaurant had problems with their checkout terminal, they ended up charging me 3 times for the meal.
5) put the meal on my credit card, so with the overcharges, I have over $110 of credit limit tied up for several days until this finally works itself out.
6) went back to the restaurant monday april 17,2017 to try and get it resolved, told it would take an additional 3 days for the credit to appear by a manager who never offered his name or an apology for the inconvenience.

Will never go back, and will share our experience with others.

UPDATE - UPDATE
UPDATE - the credit card situation finally worked itself out, the 2 additional charges fell off my account as a function the system, not anything Biscuits did according to my credit card company;
Been going there for years with my wife always fresh food served hot at a great price and friendly servers

Went here back on Easter 2018 and just got around to reviewing but I it was great! My boyfriend and I were in the area, looked on Yelp for a place to eat and stopped in. Worried about it being packed we tried anyway. It was packed but we sat down within 10 minutes and was waited upon fast. They were pretty efficient and quick to get the food out. The food was really good and the service was too. He had a Denver omelet and he ate the whole thing and it was huge. I usually order Corned Beef and Hash at breakfast restaurants because it is not something you get at home and I love it. This place set the bar for my favorite breakfast food. This place made it from scratch, tender shredded corned beef and fresh chopped potatoes and eggs over easy, just right. I was expecting the stuff out of the can! And it was so much food I could not eat it all, took some home and ate it for lunch. My boyfriend was still full from his breakfast he skipped lunch. 
There are other locations but none nearby me but next time I'm in the area of one it definitely will be my top choice for good grub.

The worst breakfast I've had in LV in 15 yrs.I had the biscuits & gravy combo 2 eggs,ham terrible the ham was so tough and over cooked even the steak knife wouldn't cut it let alone chew it,the biscuits as well were very hard and the eggs over medium were burned at the edges the coffee was no bargin either very bitter after4 sugars,lousy the prices are way high for what you get.
Awesome food! Awesome service!! They have a really good cafe mocha and the biscuits and gravy are to die for!

Been here many times for breakfast and haven't had a bad experience! The restaurant is usually busy on the weekends so the wait is quite long but during the weekdays, it's not too packed. 

I think the food taste great! Their coffee is always served fresh & hot, which I love. The food portions are pretty huge so I'm always stuffed by the time I leave. Overall, great breakfast place! Not amazing but still recommend!

We waited over an hour to get our food, and many tables around us were threatening to leave when they finally got their food as well. The cinnamon roll was good (probably too much icing for my taste!) and the people were nice, but they must have been missing a cook for how long the wait was.

Huge portions with some inconsistencies ~

I'll say this, the amount of food you get here is insane. I can never finish anything. My favorite part of the meal are the great biscuits that come with butter & a variety of jams, best ones are the strawberry & raspberry. 

The service is always extremely friendly & I love the fresh OJ they serve. My man really likes this place & it's literally across the street from our home so it's always very convenient. 

My food isn't always cooked the way I like. For starters the potatoes tend to have softer & harder bites. Slice them up more evenly & that'll allow them to cook the right way. My bacon tends to come out on the very crispy side and I've asked them to not do so. Lastly I get my eggs over medium & always find the white parts still gooey. 

The prices here are high compared to some of the other breakfast options & I hope some of my feedback gets to the cooks. I support small businesses and maybe offer smaller portions at cheaper prices as well?
Way over priced and the food really had no flavor. $35 (with tip) for two people for breakfast is ridiculous.  Service wasn't great either and they weren't busy.  Don't waste your money.

I really wanted to like this place because it is so close to our house but I was sorely disappointed. I visited with my mom, sister and my 4 year-old daughter. I will start with the good - when we arrived at 10:15 on a Sunday morning we were told there was a 20 minute wait. We were seated within 10 minutes so that was a pleasant surprise. The sourdough toast and biscuits were good and the strawberry preserves were excellent. But none of that made up for all the bad. Our waitress was a very nice older woman, but she was spread so thin it took a long time to get our orders after we were seated. My mom ordered the turkey and veggie scramble and it arrived with NO turkey. It took so long to get our food and our waitress never came back so she just decided to eat it. The scramble looked very wet from the moisture in the veggies but my mom said it was tasty. I had chicken fried steak and thought it would be house-made and fresh. Nope. It was a smallish, dried out piece crusty "meat" that I am positive came out of the freezer. The hash browns were just ok and as I said the toast was very good. My daughter seemed to love her pancakes and my sister had a cheeseburger that was sloppy with way too much mayo. She had to wipe off the mayo just to make the burger palatable. Once she did that she said it was good. At one point my 4 year-old dropped her napkin on the ground. I did not realize it but a hostess walked by, picked the napkin OFF OF THE FLOOR and put it back on our table. I was mortified! I asked her if she could please bring us a clean napkin and she looked pretty put out by the request. When she returned with the napkin I mentioned that she should not pick something up off the floor and put it on the table where customers are eating. She rolled her eyes and spun on her heels without so much as an apology. She continued to give me icy looks every time she looked our way. I guess she thinks giving guests dirty napkins OFF THE FLOOR is perfectly acceptable and we were in the wrong for thinking otherwise. Halfway through our meal I put in an order for a salad to bring home to my husband. We did not get that to-go order until 25 minutes AFTER our meal. We sat at our table waiting without drink refills, just waiting, waiting and waiting. We didn't even get our check in a timely fashion so we could pay and head out as soon as our to-go order finally arrived, so we were forced to sit and wait getting shady looks from the hostess we "offended" the entire time. It was awkward. The to-go order finally arrived. We paid and finally were able to leave. I think the prices were kinda high for the quality and quantity of food. Our waitress was nice and kindly took $5 off our bill due to the missing turkey from the scramble. She also kept talking up the rewards program but I did not bother to sign up because I will not be returning. The disappointment continued even once I got home - my husband opened up his salad and discovered an inedible mess. They put toasted garlic bread and hot crispy chicken in with the greens which caused steam in the container. The top layer of greens was a soggy mess and the moisture/steam also caused the garlic toast to become soggy. He ate 2 bites and tossed it. Such a drag. The great preserves and good biscuits are definitely not worth returning for that kind of debacle. And note to management - you really need to talk to the staff about sanitary practices. Items should NEVER EVER be picked up off the floor and put on a surface where customers are dining. This should be common sense to anybody but especially to someone working in the food service industry. And your hostess seemed to think nothing of the action.

Any place with breakfast tacos on the menu automatically garners my immediate attention. Growing up in Texas, bfast tacos are a diet staple but outside those state lines you can only find breakfast burritos- which are totally NOT the same thing. At all. 

Plate here includes two massive tacos on double-layer corn, with options to add sausage, chorizo, or bacon to your eggs, cheese is included and condiments of sour cream and salsa are provided. You also get a potato side (reds or browns).
Huge portion: tortillas were overflowing, removed over half the filling before I could even pick up the tacos to eat properly (not a complaint!), and the corn tortillas held up so well that I was able to stick to a single layer and used the extras to make additional tacos with the overflow!
Not following? You can easily make 4 good sized tacos with this plate.

Chicken fajita omelet is a good pick too- potato side and bread side included (toast, english muffin, or biscuit). Servers have no problem with substitutions, and easily changed out my bell peppers for extra mushrooms. Sadly, the mushrooms seemed canned, but there as a more than generous portion of veggies in the dish. Hashbrowns were undercooked, but we didn't come close to finishing.

Now for my gripe. You're the BISCUIT Caf√©- not the breakfast taco caf√©, not the omelet cafe. The biscuits here were lackluster and dismal, with little taste and an oddly crunchy exterior. Fluffy interior was great and the raspberry jam we received was off the charts, but when we ordered a side of gravy ... well, that was bad, too. Virtually tasteless and gluey, like a poorly made box mix. 

I didn't expect the breakfast tacos to knock it out of the park like they did (highly recommend the bacon and chorizo), but to fail at making your namesake dish? Really bummed by that.
Service was amazing and even at 10:30AM on a weekend, there were a few tables available without a wait. But the line was out the door by noon!
Service was good- decor great- food good but high prices for area- $ for $ I would rather spend this amount of money for breakfast at Snooze in Gilbert.

This place is wonderful! Prices appear a bit higher than other breakfast places, but you get huge servings for that. We came on a weekday for breakfast and it was quiet and service was great. On the weekends they sometimes have long lines which has deterred us in the past but not anymore! My hot tea came with a big selection of tea bags (while other places like Village Inn limit the number of tea bags you're allowed to have) to choose from, the food tasted great and the atmosphere pleasant. I've added pictures to show the food.

Great breakfast and lunch place. They have big fluffy pancakes and yummy biscuits and gravy yum 

The place is a bit cold inside but the service is nice and attentive. They have daily specials that focus on American traditional meals. 

Try their biscuits and gravy or chicken fried chicken!

I've been in Arizona for a year, and the staff at this place was the only thing holding me back from giving a decent review. They have greatly improved their customer service, from grumpy and indifferent to cheerful and attentive! The meals here are large and delicious, they even have 4-egg omelets!!! It's definitely worth a try if you're looking for a bright and tasty alternative from your Sunday morning breakfast norm.

Great food and prices! Even though it's packed on the weekends, service and seating has always been on point. The pancakes and eggs benedicts are delicious! Lunch time? Try their sandwiches and you won't go hungry. Great family atmosphere and the staff is always friendly.

Seated right away and our waitress was attentive and patient as it took me a little while to pick what I wanted from their abundant menu. 
The actual food: not good. I ordered the blueberry pancake combo with scrambled eggs and sausage patties. The eggs were fine but the sausage was somehow bland and tasteless. I'm not sure how that can happen with sausage but, that was the case were. The same was true with the 3 blueberry pancakes: bland and tasteless (and somewhat dry). It appeared there were blue berries in the cakes as well as some on top, but you just couldn't taste them. 
You can get plain pancakes from a number of other breakfast places, or even make them yourself, and I'm sure they'd have more flavor than these blueberry pancakes. 

In short, service was good, the problem is in the kitchen.

I had been told the food was amazing, though I didn't get to experience such myself as we waited 40 minutes with only our drinks after we had placed our order. A server didn't check to ask how we were or apologize for the wait, nor let us know when we should be expecting our order. The water was alright though.

They misplaced our order!  After waiting for our order for 30 minutes, I inquired with our waitress where our food was, as parties that came in after us had received their food already. Our waitress was rude and said, "I put it in!"  And she walked away. After not hearing back from her or anyone else, I asked for a manager and after a few more minutes our happy waitress showed up with our food. We were already on our way out when the manager showed up. I explained the situation to him and he said they had lost our order and that he was there when they whipped our order out for us. I told him that our server was rude to us, never checked back with us to see how we were doing and did not notice or care that we had not received our order. Nor did she ever apologize.  For that reason we won't stay or be back. Why should WE have to check on our food?  And we liked Biscuits' food and service in the past.

I went with my husband and son. My husband ordered the chicken and waffle with eggs. He had to remind our server that he ordered eggs. The waffle was fine, but the chicken strips were obviously not fresh, and everything was over cooked and lacked flavor. I ordered the country omelette with red potatoes and biscuits. The only good thing on the plate was the strawberry jam. The omelette was filled with what seemed to be old food. The potatoes were soggy, and absolutely no flavor. Even the gravy was poorly executed. We were never offered refills on our drinks. We will not be back.

Slowly but surely getting their stuff together. 

The last time I came in, the manager was very friendly. She addressed me by my first name so she must have read my last review (whoops).

The food has been better. That's why I'm changing my review. It was hot and ready when I got there. They are doing bigger portions too. Nothing was burnt this time.

Keep it up guys, is getting better!

This place is awesome for breakfast, except for the coffee. I come here often and have tried a few different breakfast plates. All have been very delicious, glad that i found this place. The only thing I don't like here is their coffee, but then again, it is not a coffee shop so...

We came in for the first time this morning.  We tried 2 different breakfasts and were happy with both.  However the floors are filthy, which makes us wonder if the kitchen is clean. The restrooms are filthy.  The waitstaff is very nice . Service is fast. Food is served hot.  Portions are large.

I was excited to see another breakfast place open up in town, close by and I finally got a chance to try Biscuits this morning.

The place is nice and modern.  It was clean and the staff greeted and seated my quickly.  Unfortunately the food was greasy spoon quality.  The hashbrowns were cooked with a nice crust but were dripping with grease throughout.  The sausage also had a thick sheen of grease. The toast had that nasty butter substitute that cafes soak their toast in.  If the place would ease up on the grill grease t would probably be worthwhile but starting the morning off with a gut ache isn't what I am looking for.

I've been debating whether to give a review on this restaurant. I've had many friends at church recommend this restaurant.

So I tried it this restaurant after dropping off my daughter and her friends at North Mountain Park so  they could go hiking.

I was by myself in a dress shirt and dress slacks,  asked for a small table and they try to place me behind the planter at a table for 4.

First time here so it took time to read the menu.  And was thoroughly disappointed!  My order was half cooked and gooey.  Ordered the cinnamon roll French toast with Ham and eggs.

Actually was served my food at the same time as the people who ordered before me at the nearby tables.

Except for a Italian and a Greek or possibly middle eastern persons who were with different groups of Caucasian  people, I was the only one who was not Caucasian in the restaurant... except for some of the kitchen staff.

I was not dressed like a wet back, as I said before I was in a dress shirt, dress slacks and had a nice coat.

It's been a long time, since my teenage years, that I had experienced racism at a restaurant.  I was polite did not make a scene and behaved properly pertaining to proper restaurant etiquette.

In fact the older couple  at the table next to me, when they saw that I knew how to eat properly with a place setting realized that I was well mannered and relaxed.

Despite that the restaurant tried to rush me out of the store because I was out in plain sight.   Yes, it was very busy, but I didn't see any of the other customers being served "extra quickly".  There were many other customers drinking free refills of coffee and taking their time.

The servers had no problem and actually appoligized.  Tipped the server more than 20% despite the bad treatment.  It was very evident the female manager on duty had the issue not the servers.

I cannot recommend a place that's still in the 19th century as it comes to Attitudes of those of different races.

If you are looking for an upscale Denny's, you will love this place. For a place called Biscuits, the biscuit was tiny. They really should call this place cornbreads instead. The food as a whole was underwhelming especially for the price. Two meals and two cokes $36.
