I ordered the veggie omelette, the eggs tasted like the egg beaters that come in the container and the veggies were still hard and raw. The pancakes were stiff and cardboard like. On a positive note, the restaurant was very clean and staff was friendly.

I've driven by here a lot on my way to work and thought my boyfriend and I would have to try it one day.  Today happened to be that day and we had a bogo coupon that came in the mail. It was 10am and the place was empty except for 3-4 tables, plus the table in the very back by the bathroom that had a group of older people, (I personally would not sit back there as I would feel like an ignored customer.) We were seated quite quickly at an awkward booth and chair table. Looked at the giant menu that was overpriced while waiting for drinks to find what looked tasty and ordered. My boyfriend ordered a simple waffle and I ordered the southwest delight scramble with biscuits and red potatoes,  it sounded good. The description was three scrambled eggs, with peppers, onions, tomatoes,  spicy chorizo sausage (mind you it says spicy), salsa, sour cream, and corn tortillas.  After about 10-15 minutes our food arrived. His waffle was mediocre and kind of dry he stated. Mine, it was thrown on the plate and was not pleasant to look at. As I stated earlier about the spicy chorizo, there was no spice to be had. The eggs were soggy and were loaded with stringy onions and mushy tomatoes with no peppers to be seen. It was very bland. The potatoes were burt to a crisp. You think of a biscuit being hot, light, and fluffy, these were heavy, tasteless, balls of dough. As I was studying my plate I came to notice my salsa, sour cream and corn tortillas were missing from the dish. I did not bother to ask because it would not have made the meal better. I was done after two bites. I just finished my biscuit and ate what non burnt potatoes I could find. Our waitress came by to see how things were going and I bluntly put it out there that my dish was bland and not good. She seemed oblivious, stated "oh!" and walked away. We thought she was getting a manager, but turns out just went back to serving her other tables with nothing else to be said only to come back and drop the check. We will not be back. Bad food and bad service. I wouldn't even give this one star but you have to rate it something.

Guys, today I had the most amazing thing ever! Cinnamon roll french toast. Let that sink in for a little bit. Brunch changer! 

Imagine this: 2 giant house baked cinnamon rolls, flattened, dunked into a special egg batter and then griddle'd up like classic french toast, but the end results are wild! 

I never knew that I desired some crunch on my french toast, but the crispy parts on these french toast were absolutely phenomenal. Plus, my teeth appreciated that it wasn't overly sweet. 

You also have a choice of bacon, ham, or sausage and 2 eggs any style. I requested to have my bacon extra crispy and they made it perfect! The price of $10.59 is not bad for the amount food that you get; It's enough to cover your breakfast for 2 days! 

On other occasions, I have also tried their Sweet Potato Pancake Combo $10.59 - 3 large and moist sweet potato pancakes, with your choice of bacon, ham or sausage and also 2 eggs. I chose sausage and 2 sunny eggs. Everything was perfect and I also really enjoyed the subtle natural sweetness of the sweet potatoes in the pancakes. The pancakes are different and I like that option. Flavor rating: 4/5

Smoked Brisket Benedict $10.59 - The brisket is tender and adds a great variety to the world of Benedicts. However, the meat failed to have presence in flavor and was lost in the hollandaise sauce. Flavor rating: 3/5

Country Benedict $10.59 - a country classic crowd pleaser. I felt that the sausage gravy had a slight watery consistency, but my date didn't have any complaints. You really can't pass the giant portions. It's truly enough to feed 3 adults comfortably. Flavor rating: 3/5

Biscuit and Gravy - They are called biscuits cafe, it only makes sense to try it! I really enjoy their homemade thick and creamy gravy with sausage bits. However, their biscuits were a little dense for our preference. I found that soaking the biscuits in the gravy longer until they soften, is an ideal way to enjoy this dish. Flavor rating: 4/5 

P.S. If you don't like soggy hash-browns (like me) I would suggest requesting to have them extra crispy! 

The bustling diner feel is charming and cozy; it's a real local's joint. I also really appreciate the wholehearted honesty of our waitress when she gave us her opinion on certain menu items - she really knows her food!

The prices are competitive and the portions are indulgent. These portions were meant to be shared. Bring your appetite and leave your boring toast at home.

Visited this place before heading to the Cardinals game on Sunday. There wasn't a big wait.
We ordered our coffee and orange juice and the drinks were delivered soon enough. It took a while before the wait staff returned to take our food order.
When we ordered my friend and I were very specific about asking for our eggs over-medium. Unfortunately every egg delivered to our table was very runny, badly under cooked. It was quite unappetizing. 
The place is named "Biscuits" so we were all anticipating some amazing biscuits. Yet what we received were ordinary in flavor and small. The gravy was average at best.
One more thing which really disappointed us as customers - they do not accept the American Express card.
Overall this place was a let down. It's certainly over-priced for what you get. We'll stick with The Good Egg.

Went here on Saturday June 11 while visiting the Phoenix area and must say we had excellent service considering it was very busy. There were 8 of us and our waitress Theresa kept up with all of the refills of coffee and iced tea. I got the almond crusted French toast that was absolutely fabulous!  It did not require syrup!  Hopefully the Biscuits here in Las Vegas is as good.

Nothing to complain about everything was very good including the coffee 
we ordered eggs and hash everything was just as it should be 
highly recommend this place

For some reason I expected Biscuits Cafe to be a lot better than it was.

Woke up early Sunday morning to have breakfast with my mother and we decided to try Biscuits Cafe. I heard tons of good reviews about their food. Mom decided to try their infamous Hollandaise brisket breakfast special and I had their country omelette with red potatoes and biscuits. The Hollandaise breakfast needed to be seasoned more. It just wasn't that good. My omelette was pretty runny and my potatoes were underdone. The biscuits, that the place is named after, were good but not memorable. The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere was clean and warm. I just wish the food was better. I definitely think Yoli's Cafe is better with the food and service.
Everything is so good and fresh. It starts with good ingredients. Everyone is friendly and the service is great.

Horrible service & food. This is my 3rd time here and I am so disappointed. My first visit was when they just opened and it took over an hour to get our food. Unfortunately we spent our entire lunch break waiting for food that never came. The second time was decent. But today, it took our waiter 30 min to bring us water and coffee. The food I ordered came out wrong and the hashbrowns were cold. When we told the waiter he proceeded to touch the hashbrowns with his fingers before he took it away. The biscuits were dry and hard and the gravy was grainy. I wish this place was better because it is so close to where we live but sadly we will not be back. I've tried this place multiple times and it is NOT worth it. If you want pricey & mediocre food with the worst service then this is your place.
Food was good but way overpriced. 13 dollars is overpriced for breakfast. Portions are big. If I want good food and big portions I'll choose cracker barrel over this place.

Get to know this place!  Biscuits Cafe is a breakfast and lunch place featuring home style cooking and which is headquartered in the Pacific Northwest.  However, they also have some locations in the Sunbelt, such as this one on Las Vegas's west side.

I was given a Biscuits gift certificate and, instead of using it locally, I used it at this location.  This Biscuits is in a dime a dozen strip mall off of Sahara where the tenants are now but a blur.  What I do remember is that there was plenty of parking.  I also remember that, while close to Summerlin, it was not at all like Summerlin, though that fancy high rise residential tower was fairly close by.  It was on one of the major brash thoroughfares with three lanes in each direction, with lots of retail, and with people driving briskly, as is often the case here.

While a Biscuits in some place like the Pacific Northwest may choose to be homey because the area sort of likes that vibe, this one in Las Vegas is spacious, comfortable, clean, and awash in natural light.

And, because I surmised that they might do breakfast well and to get more mileage from the funds on my gift certificate, my friend and I went for breakfast platters at approximately the lunch hour.  That was a good decision.

The breakfast platters were very good, featuring traditional staples and with "plenty of meat on their bones," figuratively speaking.  Breakfast food can be heavy and sort of bog you down.  Here, it was filling without doing that.  I don't know how the kitchen would "lighten up" the breakfast fare, but it hit the sweet spot.

The service was amicable and casual.  We got to sit were we wanted.  The air conditioning worked like a charm and, in addition to our beverages, our glasses of water were also kept filled.

The experience at this Biscuits was essentially seamless on all levels.  They know how to put together a good breakfast.  I'm betting that they also know how to put together a good lunch.  I wouldn't mind finding out.
Awesome Breakfast/Lunch Spot. Staff and management is amazing. The almond crusted French toast breakfast is the best I've had. Fresh squeezed lemonade is perfect.
Decent experience. I don't understand why Yelp asks you to keep writing long reviews...?

Hubby and I arrived about 9:30 hungry for breakfast. Might have been 15-18 patrons at tables, some waiting on their food. We were seated next to the entrance to the kitchen, which is Nikkis section and was told Nikki would be right over to take our order. We watched for 13 minutes the comings and going of waitress with plates of food dashing to hungry patrons, but also noticed a heavy set young female waitress chatting with a male waiter where the other wait staff was busy picking up orders. The chunky female stood there laughing and playing with her hair (gross) chatting up the male waiter, kept looking our way, but never came over. The waitress who seated us, believe her name is Amber, came back by and asked if Nikkie had taken our order. We told her no, that perhaps we would go some place else. She apologized for Nikkies non appearance, took our order, and brought us coffee. Amber went to the kitchen area, placed our order, then she must have said something to Nikki about ignoring us. We were given the 'go to hell look' from the chunky waitress which we found out was Nikki. Nikki brought our food, didn't say one word, placed the plates on the table and left, not I'm sorry for the mix-up, she said nothing, she went back to the kitchen and chatted up with the male waiter all the while playing with her hair. Perhaps I need to make a phone call to the Health Dept, and they could speak to Biscuits Caf√© and Nikki about the importance of keeping your hands out of your hair while waiting tables. Sorry Biscuits, you have failed!
I would not eat here the food was horrible hash browns taste like old oil left bad taste in my mouth found hair in potato and my wife fish

Aside from the almond crunch French toast; this place is just mediocre. The wait is always long, and it's just not worth it for such a basic breakfast. The servers are always kind though, and the food doesn't take too long to come out. All in all I would give it a 6\10
Really good, surprisingly! Went for breakfast,  had chicken fried steak, eggs, biscuits and gravy and it was all good.
Awesome breakfast place. We love the almond crusted French toast an biscuits and gray. Yummy.

I been saved!!!!!! Too hungry and in right place!

It worth of waiting 10-15 mins!!!
Been here numerous times. Very recommend!

My favorite is the Country Benedict.  They always poach the eggs just right, not too hard or over cooked.  The hash browns have some kind of weird taste like the oil is bad or something but I put the sausage gravy on it and then it's great.  The sausage gravy is the best I have ever had.  It has some kind of herb that just add that little something that other places don't have. 

Service is always terrific.  The wait staff are so friendly and polite.  I don't know their names but in particular there is a young African American man and a petite lady with short brown hair who always make you feels so welcome.  I know it can be a demanding job, but these two always seem like there is nothing they would rather do than help you.  Really nice customer service. 

The cinnamon rolls are amazing, similar to Cinnabon but better. 

I once had a patti melt but wasn't impressed.  The bread wasn't crunchy and the burger was greasy.

I'll stick to the breakfast as they have never let me down with that!!!!

This is a great place to dine.

Love, love, love this place!! Chicken Apple Sausage is second to none, pancakes are fluffy and HUGE, eggs are always done right. Cafe mocha is a lovely change from the standard coffee, and the cinnamon rolls are ginormous! The decor and service are old school in all the right ways - looks like home and the treat you like family. I am NEVER disappointed coming in here, even on busy days.

For lack of a better description, this place was just okay. I got a BLT and Fries.

The Bad:

Too toasted bread, I ended up scratch the corner of my lip trying to bite into it.

Parts of the bacon were so hard I literally could not bite into it. 

The fries tasted like fries you would get from the freezer section at Walmart and bake at home and they didn't cook all the way. 

The Good:

Good Service
Not extremely packed 
Variety of options
Fresh vegetables-on a BLT having fresh lettuce and tomato is key and they had it. 

I may give them a second chance eating , but I definitely ordering  some of their biscuits to go as I am eager to try their namesake.

Three stars: 1 for fast movement in the wait list and 2 for the awesome waitress we had. 
Meh!! I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. Two entrees and 2 coffees was $32 w/o tip. I felt it was overpriced for bland food we received. Service was great, our server was attentive never had empty coffee or water. 

My husband ordered the almond French toast and it was so hard. Yuck.

I was excited to try my pancakes because they seemed so fluffy but they were also hard. 

The search goes on to find a breakfast restaurant here in Surprise.
I loved this place. Came here late brunch on a Sunday after a fail somewhere else. Staff was awesome. Food amazing. Loved their homemade jellies.

This is a great breakfast place wether you are eating by yourself, with a friend, or with 4 other people. My family and I have been here a few times, there is really something for everyone on the menu. The chicken tenders are amazing I have ever had, we all love them so much. I would really suggest trying them if you're a fan of that! The eggs and really anything we've tried is very good, and they really do cater to your specific preferences. I personally am not all that crazy about breakfast but they have a "keep it simple" section on their menu! The service is good, they are always nice and they are efficient. I feel like they could do a little bit of a better job motivating the servers and maybe get a few more because it seems like they are spread thin. But we do enjoy this place, you really get the feel that they want every customer to have a good experience.

This place is the absolute worst. The waitress was eating and cleaning the refrigerator after she took our drink order and took 10 minutes to get us two iced teas. She touched the rims of the glasses with her hands, which were covered with cleaning solution. After 30 minutes our food was still not served and four other parties were served before us. We saw one of our items sitting on the counter getting cold for 15 minutes while the other servers were bending over the counter and squishing the food with their aprons.  When we complained about how long it was taking the manager started arguing with us, so we left the payment on the table in cash and walked out. The attitudes of the staff and manager are EXTREMELY poor. Not only does this place NOT care about the quality of service it also seems that the employees ignore health codes and do not care about remaining in business. STAY AWAY AND DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

So dissatisfied with this morning visit ...My boyfriend and I are loyal long time customers . We have been coming long before they switched to the new woman Manager . My boyfriend ordered the fajita omelette with pancakes and sausage . I ordered the cinnamon roll French toast with bacon and scrambled eggs . When our food came Out it wasn't done the eggs were runny...my French toast was doughy and not cooked well . It was also a smaller portion , the bacon was burnt . We ended up telling our server that we were dissatisfied and walked out .  We both have rewards points that we signed up for a year ago . This may be our last visit . Where are the cooks ??? The manager is in the back cooking and it doesn't taste the same . Seems like they are understaffed and the food and customer service is going down . We are now at black bear diner about to enjoy some pineapple upside down pancakes with all the fixings . Biscuits cafe feels like a ghost town wth is going on ??? The old manager was so nice and always spoke to the customers and was concerned with the taste of the food . The manager never ever came out just stayed in the kitchen hidden . We live a block over and it was a complete waste of time to get let down . A very sad experience !!!!

I was happy when I finally ate here since it is located just a block down the street from my house.  The atmosphere is very home-style kitchen esque. I absolutely love their eggs benedict and who can resist a giant gooey cinnamon roll!! The coffee could be stronger for sure, but unless I'm at a coffee shop or home, my expectation of receiving strong coffee anywhere is pretty low.

We decided to try this place for the first time. It was just okay. Hash browns came out cold. Corned beef hash was terrible. Potatoes were crunchy and it had zero flavor. Drinks were never refilled even though server came back to check on us a couple of times. I probably won't go back until I see an improvement on food and service.

This was my second visit to Biscuits Cafe and I am beyond disappointed and will not be returning. The first time we went the food was great service was awesome and you get so much food!! This last visit was disturbing to say the least. Our food arrvies and I noticed that there was a drop of red stuff on my plate, thought it was ketchup so I wiped it with my finger and it was BLOOD!! I immediately went to the restroom and washed my hands and asked for my server the manager. I showed them the plate and when I looked at my other plates yes there was blood on them too. The manager proceeds to say oh I don't think that's blood it maybe blueberries...???! So I am now a little upset because I know the difference between a blueberry and freaking BLOOD!!! I gave the place a second chance to remake the food the kitchen staff that I had thought and mentioned to the server who's hand was cut was now wearing gloves... Well a little grossed out we didn't finish our food even though it was good. Now at the end of our meal and considering what happened I did expect a discount for having a stranger's blood on multiple plates but that didn't happen we had a full bill no discount and was offered a cinnamon roll.. really a cinnamon roll so I declined paid my bill and left.

Gravy not great. Was not sausage gravy, but pepper gravy. Biscuits were tough. I normally can break up biscuits with fork but not these biscuits. Wife had strawberry waffle and she said it was good, so that is why 3 stars instead of 2

First visit to Biscuits Caf√© (open for just over a year), early on a Sunday morning.  Even at 7 a.m. opening, the place had a good-size crowd.  Server was Robert who was quick and attentive--covering many tables, he still refilled beverages without having to be reminded.  Food was good, well-prepared and served hot--and VERY generous portions, including two biscuits with each breakfast order.  Great home-made strawberry jam was served in a small cup on each plate instead of those little plastic packets on the table.  Prices were moderate--in line with other local breakfast spots like Village Inn, Denny's, and Coco's--but food here is much better (with large servings), while atmosphere, staffing, and cleanliness are all better here than at most other places.

Horrible food!  No flavor! My boyfriend and me decided to try a new spot, which I totally regret now. Ordered steak and eggs over easy with hash browns with a biscuit. First off the steak wash not even cooked it had zero seasoning at all, I guess they cook it on the flat top she said with no seasoning. Rise and Shine in Summerlin has way better steak! No grill marks wtf! I had to send it back, next the hash brows had no flavor, I get they are simple but how do you mess that up ? Anyways asked for sausage links instead, brought me patties. So basically didn't eat meat I asked to remove the meat all together as soon as I saw, which they did. As for my boyfriends his cheesy eggs looked like liquid disgusting. I think my 5 year old could do a better job. I told the person checking us out how horrible my meal  was, you would think she would remove it. Clearly they don't care! Don't eat here people unless you want to leave disgusted!! Nasty as can be!! Oh yea the biscuit was disgusting too I think bisquick taste amazing compared to that thing they have! I didn't take a picture of my steak sent  it back too fast. My boyfriends eggs are below.

Wow! Never again.... I had some family in town and ended up taking the 6 of us to Biscuits Caf√© for a Brunch around 10am. We had heard good things about it and expected it to be busy, and it was. We really didn't mind the 35 minute wait to get seated; but the following, no customer should have to go through. 
It took a few minutes for our waitress to get to us after being sat at a just wiped down table. We got our coffee & menus, and then about 10 minutes later she finally came back with a stack of napkins and a handful of silverware (literally) that she just put on the table in a pile. So, 35 minutes after taking our order, she returned to the table and apologized because the kitchen was so busy the food tickets were running at about 30 minutes to fill. In the mean time, we watched another table turn over and get their food before us. Well, after our 45+ minute wait for our food it came to us COLD, and since the waitress didn't return to check on us for another 10 minutes, we ended up eating our cold breakfast. For a supposed Breakfast/Brunch specialty establishment... They are about the worst their is!!! A $110 breakfast with this service.... NEVER AGAIN!!!
Very testy breakfast, I loved the pancakes. It's was a very pleasant atmosphere and quick service

The food is actually good. I'd give it a 4. The one is for service. I tried it for the first time about six months ago. My friend and I came in for breakfast. There was only one other customer there and one waitress. The waitress was having a full on conversation with this customer. We waited for about 5 minutes. We were just ignored. We finally just sat down. This waitress continued her conversation for another 10 minutes. Then finally came over gave us menus, went back to her conversation for another 10 minutes. I wanted to leave, but my friend wanted to wait. We finally got served. The food was good. I decided to give it another try today. It's close to the house. Same friend. We went. They were busy. We were seated right away. Good sign, right! Nope. We were waiting for literally about 15 minutes to give our order. This entire time the manager was standing in the isle beside me talking to the people behind us. She was loud! We had to hear about her daughter's college, how she shops at Walmart, what kind of snacks her daughter wants for college. On and on she went! We shot her a few looks like, first of all, can you take our order and 2. can you shut up? She was literally giving me a headache. I don't know who these people were, the owners or frequent customers, but it was ridiculous! You want to talk, sit down and talk. Don't yell out your business in my ear!! Better yet, do your job and make sure customers are taken care of! Then the waitress who brought our food finally came to see if we wanted more coffee. Our cups were empty so of course we said yes. Instead of going to get the coffee to fill our empty cups that she's neglected, she starts chatting up the same people behind us! The manager had finally stepped away for a moment comes back and starts again, now she has pictures on her phone! So now we have the two of them yakking! My friend finally interrupted and asked her to get the coffee.  This was not an enjoyable experience to say the least. Then we get to the register. My friend pays the bill. The boy running the register punched a wrong button and had to make change the old fashioned educated way, using your brain! Well, he couldn't manage that and my friend had to tell him what the change is. Needless to say, I will never go back there and I will definitely pass on my experience to others. I can't imagine how this place stays in business. If you like slow service and want to know more about strangers than you ever cared to, then this is the place for you! The food is good, but not worth dealing with the nonsense and unprofessional behavior.

Had breakfast here with my wife on a Saturday morning. Not real busy but ample seating. I had the chicken fried steak, really good,  the gravy was delicious . The red potatoes were  gummy and undercooked . I ordered the sourdough toast and it came with one slice cut in half . Who charges 12.00 a plate and only gives one slice of bread ? Biscuits Cafe does that's who. I asked the waitress if that's the norm and she said yes if you want more you'll have to order it as a side. ...... What? Prisoners get more bread than you do here . Very pricey place for what you get. I might try again to see if they serve you half a sandwich for lunch.

Just had breakfast egg over easy biscuits and grave and bacon.  Eggs were practically raw.   I said I couldn't eat them. Whites weren't cooked. Sent them back for over medium. Whites were still partly raw. I wasn't going to send them back again.  Somebody needs to teach the cook how to make eggs. The gravy for the biscuit wasn't very good either. Not what you'd expect biscuits and gravy to taste like.  I think I maybe saw 2 pieces of sausage in the gravy.  Don't think I'll becoming back again. The place has gone downhill.

Breakfast with the family, 2 adults 3kids.  Menu was good,  variety of omelets, scrambles, french toast, pancakes to name a few of them.  It was super busy, all employeess were nice,  greeted us, asked if everything was good several times.  Issue: eggs and pancakes were over cooked, we could tell kitchen staff was overwhelmed.  Everything else was great will definitely give a second chance, will try again.

I like the feel of this cafe style spot. I ate breakfast, but there were other options for lunch as well. The food is better than Denny's and the staff is friendly. I would definitely eat here again when i'm in the area for breakfast! I had a chicken fried steak - we all know it's all about the gravy, and I'm glad to say that I enjoyed theirs . . . the most important part of the review is the taste!

Hey y'all!  I was so excited to see a new breakfast place settle into what I think is a very prime location - perfect for a huge residential neighborhood that doesn't want to travel north to Good Egg, east to Ihop or south for Mimi's.  I ordered the corned beef hash (one of my personal favorites that is not always on a breakfast menu, crazy - I know right?)  Husband wanted the Florentine Benedict without the spinach, but got talked into the Avocado, the kids chocolate chip pancakes.  I had a nibble ... well ... okay, I had like three nibbles and it was a very yummy pancake.  They were excited about their hot chocolates - the do a great job presenting it!  I liked my corned beef hash, but it was probably a little on the healthy side :) as it wasn't oozing with salt.  But that's actually a good thing because I'm trying to watch my portions and the salt would have begged me to devour the whole thing.  There was enough meat and potatoes for three breakfasts.  It was huge.

Poor husband.  He wanted the Florentine without the spinach because it's more like the Eggs Benedict he's accustomed to.  The server suggested the Avocado thinking that would be better but it didn't have HAM.  So he was a little deflated.  The hollandaise smelled very strong to me for some reason.  We ordered a side of bacon to compensate and while it was 4 slices of natural cut bacon, that was $4 worth of bacon.  Which leads me to the biggest beef ... it's probably a tad pricier than Good Egg and definitely pricier than Ihop.  So I had to nick a star, sorry guys.

Would I go back?  Definitely - I like the convenient location - maybe next time I'll try something a little 'easier' on the eyes.  And I like that it hasn't caught on just yet.  WHO WANTS TO WAIT FOR BREAKFAST?!  I am somewhat a patriot too, so I loved the wood paneled wall that had the Bill of Rights and Constitution framed ... made my heart feel good.

4 stars for good intentions ... and sorry for the long post ... it's a new place and I just wanted to make sure the people were informed.

Our waitress Brandy was one of the best I've seen in awhile. Great customer service very attentive! 5 stars for her...however, the food was very good but they do not offer a military discount.  With an Air Force nearby and the military communities in the area it was very unfortunate. 
Other cafes offer a military discount #dontforgetthemenandwomenwhoserve#freedom#takecareofyourown

OK but overpriced food. 

Decent service, but why do all the people working here look miserable?

Bring your appetite!!! I am a big guy and I couldn't finish my ultra delicious Southwest Scramble which came with two large fluffy pancakes!!! My wife had the breakfast tacos which looked good and my wife said tasted good but would only do bacon in the future. 

I would give 4.5 if possible as the food is really tasty but is more traditional and less outside the box. 

The restaurant is clean and well put together. Seems like a traditional breakfast diner/cafe. Lots of business type people here for lunch. 

Overall 4.5 stars (rounded up) for great food, huge portions, excellent service, a clean restaurant with a nice atmosphere. Super impressed, we will be back!!
Great service and great food. I had the house made hash and hubby had the avocado benedict. Both were delicious and the jam and biscuits were off the charts!
We went in for breakfast this morning. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was great, service was quick. Our waitress was wonderful. Will definitely be back.

We ordered pancakes. My plate had somebody's salad remnants on it, lettuce and some kind of a small seed. The plate clearly had not been washed. Plate was dull looking and greasy, not sparkling clean. We alerted the first person we could find and their response was, "Do you want me to take it back?"   Our response was, "What do you think?"  DUH!!!
Deplorable and completely inexcusable.  We will never return.

Let me tell you about the amazing breakfast I had last Sunday. Having mentally bookmarked Biscuits Cafe several times, we finally pulled the trigger to check it out. On the outside, the restaurant is unassuming, so I'll do the bragging for them. 

Despite it looking busy, we were seated right away. Our waitress came by to wish us a good morning and pour us coffee and water. Their coffee mugs have a sleek black design with their red logo - also for purchase on the way out. 

We pored through the menu calling attention to the great variety of breakfast specialties: Corned beef hash, black oak kielbasa, chicken apple sausage... I could go on. I ordered the Kielbasa, that came with two eggs, hash browns and a choice of biscuits, toast or pancakes. I chose the biscuits, which were soft and warm, tearing apart easily for me to lather on butter and what tasted like strawberry preserves. I don't often share amazing food, but I had to give my girlfriend a taste so she could see what I was raving about. Let me also point out that the hash browns are no ordinary helping. They overflow along the sides of your plate, offering a wonderfully tasty crunch and fresh potato underneath. And, the Kielbasa had just enough spicy, smoky tenderness to satisfy even the pickiest of sausage fans.

If my girlfriend hadn't ordered the Avocado Benedict, I would have. Fans of poached egg and hollandaise creations, look no further! These come with tomato and avocado, hash browns or red potatoes. Well assembled and not runny or soggy. Definitely in my top 3 of Benedict's ever tasted.

It was hard to leave food on my plate, but I had to. I was just too full to keep going. I can't wait until the next Sunday morning when I can come back for Round 2!

Me and my girlfriend went to this cafe for breakfast, we were in a hurry and the hostess could tell, so they made it a priority to get our food as soon as possible to go. The employees were incredibly nice and Alex especially was amazing in making sure we got what we needed and made us feel like a family. Thanks biscuits cafe!!!

My wife and I have been here twice and wish we lived closer.  The place is immaculate and tastefully decorated.  The staff is friendly, courteous, and helpful but not overbearing.  The food is outstanding - especially the omelets, bacon, sourdough bread, jam, and more.  Not fast service but quality dishes perfectly prepared and served piping hot.  Not inexpensive, but worth every penny.

Here I was thinking "yay a new favorite breakfast spot" until I crunched into something alien in my red potatoes. Not sure if it was eggshell or glass or sand. But it ended my desire to take another bite immediately. So disappointed because I was really enjoying the eggs Benedict prior to that.

Sadly, my first time at this location is disappointing. The service was good, but my sausage was cold, and my dining partner, who ordered the waffle said his waffle was cold, his eggs were overlooked and his bacon was so over cooked it crumbled to the touch. Still searching for the ultimate breakfast spot.

I am giving this place two stars one for the service was and second the place was very clean and well decorated.

The cons, so a place that has the word biscuits in the name should be known for some killer biscuits and gravy. Nope , biscuits were not soft and didn't have to much flavor. I also got a side of red potato's  , should have save the extra $1.99, as they were hard as well.  My mom had a order of pancakes just three and a side of fruit. With my one biscuit meal and two coffees the bill was over $30.  I was hoping for more since I live in surprise and like the short drive.

We normally LOVE Biscuits, but our experience yesterday may cause us to never go back. 

The restaurant was busy, so the initial wait to be greeted at the table is understandable, but after that.... 

We ordered two adult meals, 1 kids meal and a side of eggs and the only item that came out correct was the side of eggs. My sons meal had hash browns when he asked for red potatoes (twice), my wife didn't get the egg whites she ordered, got bacon instead of sausage and pancakes instead of toast. The server was apologetic, but at no time did a manager come by our table to talk with us about all the mistakes. We had to ask for our check 3 times and when it came no compensation for all the mistakes was offered. 

I paid the 30+ dollars and decided we'd just have to find a new breakfast place for the future.

Very good food, good service.  This is the "everybody wants breakfast but no one want to cook" go to place.  They have great country gravy, the blueberry pancakes get more than 5 blueberries like most places, and the coffee is good.  

If you are looking for typical, American Style, breakfast cuisine, you cant go wrong.  The only reason i give 4 instead of 5 stars is inconsistency.  Sometimes service and/or food can be a bit off, but all in all, i go here once a month.  Try it and see!

I went in the other day me and my wife and the food wss good most DEFF fresh n hott I loved the fact that the gravy wasn't soo salty I hate salty food but verry clean on the inside  I had the chicken fried steak bomb very tasty ;*) fyi there bacon is soo yummy n thick cooked just like  I like it !!!

Thursday 2/12
11am

My boyfriend and I just had to walk out of this place because we were seated and just left alone for 15 minutes without a single person coming up to us to take even a drink order. It seemed like the feeling was mutual within the whole restaurant. People were looking around to see where the servers were and if they were ever going to get their food/drink. Ridiculous.

I was in Las Vegas for the weekend with a friend and he suggested that we give this place a try. I'm glad we did, it was a pleasant surprise. We went in for breakfast around 10:00 AM on Sunday morning and it was busy, but not packed. We were quickly seated in a large booth and served coffee right away in an oversized coffee mug. We didn't have to wait too long before our waitress took our orders.

The menu had great selections for breakfast and of course their specialty...biscuits & gravy. I ordered the  Black Oak Kielbasa that came with two eggs, choice of hash browns or red potatoes and choice of biscuits, toast or pancakes. I had my eggs over easy, hash browns and of course biscuits. When my food arrived I was pleased that the food was prepared just right. The biscuits were very warm and seemed fresh out of the oven. The Kielbasa was tasty and the biscuits were definitely good! 

Overall, my friend and I enjoyed our breakfast...we had no complaints with either the food or service. The restaurant set-up was very spacious, bright and clean. They even have newspapers available for the customers to read. In addition, it's located in a nice area of town in a strip mall...so parking is plentiful & convenient. Check out the photos I posted...

As a side note, we liked it enough that we went back the following day for breakfast again...we were in the area & it was just convenient. It was a Monday morning around 9:00 AM. It wasn't busy and our waitress was very attentive. My friend and I both ordered the French Toast Combo and we both felt that the French Toast was good. The next time I'm back in LV, I plan on having breakfast here again.

We have been wanting to try this place and are glad we did. The restaurant is really large. Didn't expect it to be as large as it was really but it was nice. They traded cute for functionality at this place and honestly I prefer it. Other breakfast places are cute and petit but they end up have long lines and obnoxious waits because of it. This place was able to seat is right away even though there were lots of people dining and we got our food quickly. The prices were competitive too. They have a rewards program with good benefits as well. We will definitely be back for the convenience and good food

Menu is fabulous different variations of standard breakfasts' dishes.  Homemade biscuits and jams. Perfectly prepared egg dishes. Light fluffy pancakes. I had the fresh blueberry pancakes...perfect!  Not your tiny coffee cup, no, no. A real coffee mug. Family operated. Warm, friendly fast service. Will be back again!

I came here on Father's Day around noon after a hike at Pinnacle Peak. Overheated and starved, I was ready to load up on carbs and protein. I ordered the Country Benedict, which consists of a biscuit, two sausage patties and two poached eggs smothered in gravy. It also came with a choice of hash browns, red potatoes or a substitution of fruit for an additional $1. The meal was enjoyable but average, much like the restaurant itself. Furthermore, the restaurant's temperature was a little too warm for me and I usually prefer not to sweat while I eat my breakfast.
Enjoyed our breakfast. Great customer service. Was a little pricey but worth the visit

First time there,  we had the cinnamon roll french toast it comes with eggs and choice of ham sausage or bacon. Also had the 1 biscuit and gravy with eggs and ham. Both choices were good sized portions.   Delicious very nice restaurant. The menu has lots of choices we were very happy with our meals.  We had a coupon in the weekly coupon mailing.

If you know how to look, Las Vegas is famous for "locals only" funky spots tucked into a shopping malls. And this Breakfast place is just that. 

When I am in the mood to go out for breakfast, I want "Diner Style"- big, hearty, classic and delicious. I have eaten at Biscuits many times and have never been disappointed.

Sausage Benedict- YUM! My partner says the Sweet Potato pancakes are the best he has every had! The scrambles are really good too!

The thought of an $12 breakfast still has me reeling. The portion was nice, and the quality was okay. Corned beef hash was waaay over seasoned with a burned oregano overtone , while the hashbrowns, were completely flavorless, and raw in the middle. Ironically(?) the biscuits were damn good.  I ate like an 1/8 of it. (See picture).

We really enjoyed our breakfast here. I had the country Benedict which is biscuits topped with sausage, poached eggs and sausage gravy. Also included hash browns. It was really yummy but the eggs were poached a little hard and next time I'll get the gravy on the side (too much gravy on the plate). My husband had the apple sausage with eggs, hash browns and biscuits. He said it was good. The strawberry preserves that came with it was very good, like homemade. My son got the chocolate chip pancakes. He loved them. The restaurant was busy but we were seated right away and service was quick. Overall great experience.

I think the food is good. It's nothing to rave about but it's still good enough to keep me coming back. The staff is friendly and they have excellent service. This is one of the only Breakfast places in the area, besides IHOP and Denny's. I fall in love with their jams!!! They are freaking amazing!!!

I cannot begin tell how how AMAZING this delightful little restaurant is. Upon walking in, the first thing you'll smell is coffee. Delicious coffee that is roasted in house and also available for purchase. The smell alone will make you glad you came. Then you'll look at the menu and be torn on what to order because it all sounds good. (Let me recommend the Almond French Toast. It's amazing!) The service is wonderful and you'll have a small army of smiling, helpful wait staff coming over to refill coffee and check on you often. When the food arrives it will look delicious and beautiful. The best part is, that no matter what you order, you'll find a chocolate covered strawberry on your plate. It's the manager's touch, and a lovely way to finish off a delicious and delightful dining experience. Highly recommend!!!

We were hungry!! Any food would have made us happy.....but...we have to say, B Cafe came to the rescue.  Great service , shout out to Dan! our amazing server who even supplied some much needed hangover ibuprofin to the table!  We were visitors to this city and sadly, are thinking: we might never be back and two, wishing there was a brunch spot like this in PHilly!!

Well, Biscuits Cafe opened up at a location that has seen two other businesses crumble! After having breakfast there this mourning with my wife. I really don't see them lasting here either. We will come back to try lunch, hopefully it will be better? 
We decided to try a variety of things this morning. We ordered the biscuits and gravy, apple wood sausage breakfast with over easy eggs, hash browns, it also came with pancakes. Wife ordered: red potatoes, scrambled eggs, and sourdough toast. We also added a cinnamon roll.

Food:
It really wasn't that big of a deal. Biscuit was kind of rubbery, and I was not a big fan of how the gravy was seasoned. And yes I said seasoned since the gravy was probably the only item that was seasoned. I asked for the hash browns to be well done, the only thing that was well done was the outside layer. It was crispy, however the inside was a little to mushy for me. I did like the apple wood sausage, but it did need to be cooked a little bit longer. Pancakes were OK if you put enough butter and syrup. The texture wasn't all that great. Wife's red potatoes looked really good, but again it wasn't seasoned enough. The cinnamon roll looked really good, they over do it with the frosting, it is served hot. You might want to let it cool down first. Because when you eat it hot, it like eating a cinnamon puff? Lots of air. 

Service was OK, more like a cafeteria environment. 

With Archies, Nicks I and Nicks II near by, this place will need to improve to stay around.
Super delicious food!  Very generous portions.  Wait staff was very attentive, especially Theresa.  Definitely will be back.

Been coming here for years and they never disappoint. The service is just as good as the food and its outstanding! I love their French toast combo. And their coffee is delicious. I also use their reward system and I've gotten multiple discounts. I highly recommend biscuits for breakfast

We came here while running errands around 11am on a Saturday. There was no wait, but when we left a while later, the place was getting packed. I think the decor is what turned me off the most. It was like a cafeteria in a hospital. Very stark and minimally decorated if you can call some stenciling on the wall decorations. The wait staff also seemed off in their overall service, like they were overwhelmed or confused or short staffed. My bf said from his view, the kitchen staff didn't seem to have a handle on their roles either. Our order did come out rather quickly. It was just ok, nothing that had me jumping for joy. There are other breakfast places with a lot more oomph, pizzaz, and wow factor here in town to make me want to choose Biscuits over them.

I was very disappointed. I went there on Saturday October 28th. The first thing I notice is that the interior is very dark admittedly they were quite busy spirit I was alone and chose to be seated outside. The chair at the table they sat me out was covered with pigeon droppings and I had to request another chair. I placed my order the combo which was eggs bacon hash browns biscuits gravy and coffee. The order took without exaggeration about 25 minutes to arrive. The waitress kept coming by saying she would check on the order and sorry for the wait. When I received my food the gravy and the eggs with cold. When I went to add cream to my coffee to cream was curdled. I complained to the waitress and she brought me a bowl of hot gravy an extra biscuit and fresh creamer. I received my check and was informed by the waitress that I had to pay on the way out at the cashier. The problem with that is the cashier area is also where they check in the customers for seating so it is a complete chaotic situation. You have people trying to check in horse eating while you have people waiting to pay the check. It was a mess and there was only one person there to take care of directing the seating and accepting a payment. For all my trouble the check was almost $20. I did voice a complaint with the girl at the cash register and she just said she was sorry due to her being so busy that was the end of that. After receiving my change I had to make my way back outside where I was seated and leave the tip. What a hassle. I try to support neighborhood businesses as I live in the area and I will give them another chance. Anyone or any business can have have a bad day. But as you can read my first experience was extremely frustrating and overall extremely poor. The waitress was a tentative and she was quite nice so I'm not sure how much of this was her fault.

Stopped in today for the first time and have finally found a great breakfast place in Surprise. Had a simple "scrambler" with ham and eggs which were cooked perfectly, red potatoes which were nicely seasoned and plentiful and a wonderful pancake and biscuit on the side. Having mentioned that I could not decide between the pancakes and the biscuits for my side, our wonderful waiter, Zach, suggested one of each. You don't often find a place so accommodating. Our waiter was very helpful and attentive offering suggestions and making us feel welcome even though we came in near the end of the day. Definitely recommend Biscuits Cafe and are glad to have them in our neighborhood. Oh..and the strawberry jam..yum!

Visiting from Las Vegas and stopped in for breakfast. Kids had the chocolate pancakes. I had the chicken fried steak and it was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. Gravy has good flavor. Service was very friendly. They also have an outdoor eating space with tables under umbrellas for when the weather is nice out.

We went in to see the new restaurant.   We have to admitt not to excited.  The wait was not long maybe 10 minutes, sat in a area that was very cold they had there ceiling fans  on and they were on fast. The wait for the food was more then 30 minutes. The food was ok we have had food at better restaurant.  Checking out took a while the server had a mistake on our ticket. She was confused on how a beverage got on there when she did not put it there.  So over all it will be the first and last time...
Ordered country Benedict and had it delivered via postmates. The Benedict had no gravy on it. Just a biscuit, dry sausage and eggs. Last time I will order from this place.

Great breakfast. We are new to area and have tried Eggworks and The Cracked Egg. I think this will definitely be a place we frequent....the Joe's Scramble was excellent. My daughter's Mac and cheese was super cheesy. Good stuff!!
Generous portions, large menu. Good service. Been here a handful of times, and have not been disappointed! Katy is our favorite waitress.
This place is in desperate need of ceiling fans. It's almost too warm to enjoy a meal.

As a fan of good breakfasts, I was thrilled to try the newest addition to the neighborhood here in south Chandler. Put simply, my chorizo omelet was muy bueno, and clearly cooked by someone who loves omelets as much as I do. Beautiful fluffy eggs, savory chorizo and fresh veggies. Loved it. The pancakes were very good and the coffee was decent. Crank that coffee up a notch and I'd have no trouble going five stars for breakfast. Last note, the staff is wonderful. They took great care of us and every table around us. And that's just awesome.

Everything I've ordered here has been delicious. The omelets are flavorful and filling. Start looking at the menu before you sit down, because once your waiter leaves your table the first time, he's not coming back. The service is terribly slow, albeit friendly. The food is well worth the wait.
They are always great, with the service and they always have great food! Just wish my food was hot when it got to me, it tends to always be a little cold but the biscuits and gravy are super good!

This place is great. They have above average food and fair prices. The entire menu breakfast/lunch is open all day, which is great when I have family in town and we get brunch at 11:00 AM. At that point, some people want breakfast, and some want lunch. 

If you're a healthy eater, or salad fan, they have great salad menu with really generous portions. In favor of being healthful, get the dressing on the side. My favorite is the SW Chicken salad. 

This place is a real gem, especially because of the newness and cleanliness. My theory is, once they get on google maps, and discovered by more locals, they will blow up, and then there may be a weekend wait. 

I'm docking a star because I had the personal kielbasa breakfast sausage one time, and it was so salty it practically wasn't edible. I think it might have been a fluke though, and that's not something I normally order. 

They have a super friendly and robust staff. Everyone has the attitude, "I'll get it done for you", which I think is important especially on crowded weekend mornings. It's great to see a truly local, independent breakfast joint hit the ground running. I hope they keep it up!

Met my sister and her family here for breakfast.  I was very hungry.  Walked in and saw my sister and family sitting at a table.  We sat right away.  The place was nice. Started talking and notice after 15-20 minutes no one offered coffee, water or juice. Waited another 15-20 minutes still no one came to the table. Finally one of the waitress acknowledged us and that someone would be right with us. Waited another 15-20 minutes and we finally had to ask someone to get someone to wait on us.  The waitress apologized and took our orders. Another 15-20 minutes went by again and we did not get our drinks. We had to ask another waiter. He apologized and got our drinks. 

After a little wait we finally got our food.  Nice portions, presentation and food tasted great. The wait staff was more attentive because the breakfast crowd slowed and they weren't so overwhelmed. 

Overall the food was good (biscuts were great)but the service lacked.  I will give them another try and hopefully the service will be much better.

My parents love this place. It's decent. The 2 times I've been here I had the pancakes - very berry and chocolate chip. The portion size is huge! 

Good family friendly place and quality food.

Where do I start......Fist time visiting this place and everything was awful. Server forgot our drinks for 5 minutes, told my wife not to get the cinnamon French toast because it's usually soggy, my wife's coffee mug has sticky crap all over it, the walls were nasty looking like they never clean them, and to top all of it off when our food arrived their was a LONG hair in my food. We immediately got up and told our server we are leaving because of x, y, and z and we will never be back. I didn't want to waste my time even talking to a manager because they could have offered me free food for life and I would have never returned. This place is terrible on every level, go to McDonalds instead.
I've had the French toast and it was really good, the place was packed and service was good.  The portions were decent size, the biscuits weren't fresh & tasted as they had been sitting awhile.
Very good food! Wide menu variety, quick service, nice people. I love it here!

It was a Sunday morning and noticed it was very busy.  It was a fun atmosphere and we were greeted with a smile right when we walked in.  We were seated within 5 minutes and a very short time later we were greeted by Chas and he took our drink orders.  Even with the very busy restaurant the service was great!  Chas was doing a great job with not only waiting on our table but I also noticed him staying on top of his other tables too.  The food was awesome!  I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and my wife had the ham & eggs benedict.  We will be back!

I ate breakfast this morning at Biscuit Cafe, for the first and last time. When I walked in the place was pretty much empty...maybe 5 customers. I was seated and given a menu quickly. I think its fairly pricey...$10.00 for bacon,eggs,hash browns and toast. With an additional $4.10 for a glass of OJ. When the waiter took my order I requested the eggs be soft boiled, "real runny". It took 30 minutes to receive my food. The bacon looked like it was probably good when it was first cooked but it was dried out . The hash browns were run of the mill...nothing special. But the soft boiled eggs...OMG...they couldnt have been more hard boiled. Totally the opposite of what I ordered. It took a while to get the waiters attention but when he came over to my table I showed him the eggs. He said he would get me another order of eggs. Then about 5 minutes later he came back to my table and said my eggs should be ready in about 10 minutes. Really?  So everything else sits there getting cold, while I wait 15 minutes for my 2 minute eggs. No, I told him to forget it and asked for the check. The only food that was really good was the toast and a small container of strawberry jam. Dont waste your time and money on this place. There are places in town that are much better.

Met friends for brunch.  The menu has breakfast and lunch options.  Waffles, biscuits, toast and of course pancakes. Soups, salads and sandwiches are options.  Burgers, fries and onion rings are optional.  Very big portions of very delicious food options.

I must say that I haven't been here in a few months. Decided to take my beautiful girlfriend to this place and I was hoping it was still good. Yes it was very good. She loved the place as did I. The service is great and the food is just magnificent. You can't eat it all that's for sure but man it fills your stomach. We both highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch

Little has changed I'm sorry to say!  They gave us a $5 discount for her birthday. We ordered the same meal for my wife (chicken fried chicken special breakfast and I had their new sandwich, beef brisket dip with fries and a pickle.  The meat had little flavor other than a smoky one and the au jus had very little taste.  Wife's hash brown had a nice flavor but needed to be browned more, my fries were meh. Noticed that her chicken fried chicken was $1.60 more since our last visit 2 1/2 years ago, had a nice taste, still small.  A 2 1/2 star meal, please remind me if I ever think about returning :(

The food was tasty. The service was less than stellar. I expect somewhat of a wait to be seated on a Sunday morning at a popular place, that's not a big problem. We checked out the menus while we waited to be seated so we were able to order right when we sat down. The issue was waiting 30 minutes for our food after that. When we asked what was taking so long we were told it's busy and there's two tickets ahead of you. Magically, our food appeared about a minute later, lukewarm, with an incorrect side order. We pointed out the mistake but never did get the correct item. The family next to us heard our inquiry and said they had waited an hour and none of their food came to the table at the same time; one person was served when everyone else was almost done. The couple on the other side of us struck up a conversation to tell us they had also been waiting and were served cold soup to start but nothing since then. Behind us, I heard another couple ask what was taking so long and they were told it was busy and there were two tickets ahead of them. It's really a shame because we had high expectations and the food really was delicious once we finally got it.

UPDATE: Since posting this 5 star review about a year ago, I can say that Biscuits has steadily declined in both service and quality. I've been back multiple times, and it's always hit or miss with servers. Some are in a great mood and on top of their game... while others have poor hygiene, are rude, careless, and really don't care if you're happy with your meal or not. The last few times i've been in, they do not honor the $5 coupons which are sent to email for discounts (birthday, anniversary etc) even if they are not expired or have not been used. The cashier will say "I can't find it in the system", although I received an email from Biscuits they day prior (timestamped) advertising a $5 coupon. When asking how this can happen, the cashier simply shrugs and says "I don't know"... well, that's unacceptable. This morning I got breakfast to go- my usual chicken fried steak. The final straw with Biscuits (hence the updated review), they didn't include ANY gravy in my chicken fried steak meal (which included biscuits and gravy WITH NO GRAVY), eggs were cold and rubbery, potatoes slimy. Not impressed- it's unfortunate an establishment can have such a rapid decline in less than a year. This definitely explains why their competitors always have a line out the door, while Biscuits line has diminished.
Mediocre to marginal food. Sub par at best, fake eggs and dry chicken, be specific if you want anything well done. Good fast service with a friendly waiter, QUICK seating as well.

Decided to try this place because I was in the area and always seem to drive by it. Location was clean and busy this Friday morning. My server was Linda, she was amazing. Linda was friendly, joked with me, and kept me filled with coffee and water.

I got "Joe's Scramble" which comes with 3 eggs, spinach, tomato, red onion, sausage, and parm cheese. I forgot to say no onion, but I didn't even care. It was pretty delicious. It also came with a biscuit as a side, which I asked with gravy. The biscuits were fluffy on the inside and a nice crunch on the outside. The gravy wasn't what I was expecting though. It's like and oregano style gravy rather than a southern sausage style gravy. It wasn't bad, just different.

Everyone on the staff was courteous and never looked like they didn't have something to do.

All-in-all, great experience and I'll definitely come back again!

This place can easily obtain a 5 star rating. The best breakfast in the area... By far. Great food a little expensive for breakfast and they need more seating with the demand. Too bad they are next to Zipps, the awful establishment next door with not very nice people working there. I recommend the scrambles and the pancakes are very good! Service is always excellent! Highly recommend!
Had a wonderful breakfast here.  I really enjoyed their way of doing potatoes and of course the biscuits are light and tasty!

I went to the website first to  contact them and wasn't going to yelp them.  I live close by and have been here a few times.  Every single time something is messed up.  My honest opinion is that its the management.  They need to train their employees.  Some things are not common sense.  For example during todays breakfast the waitress think her name is Michelle came over and asked the girlfriend if she wanted a refill.  Because she had basically been slow the entire meal I asked for one also mine was half full.  On the way to fill it up she stops and takes an order.  Setting out drinking on a resting table.  Common sense is that when I'm eating my meal I want to have a beverage at the same time.  And I do not want to wait for you to take an order from silver hairs which predictably  took a long time to place the order so I got up and took my drink back.  No apology.  No recognition that a mistake had been made.  Maybe she didn't realize that is not the proper way to serve a table.  Tip.  When someone flags you down while you are doing a refill tell them you just have to refill the drink and you will be right back.  So maybe things aren't common sense like when you serve potatoes.  You can't mix two batches together.  One that is crispy and another one that is raw.  You actually want to try to have your food come out consistent.  They should always be cooked the same.  Customers are not very crazy about having a few raw potatoes in every bite.

This is not the first time I have had issues at this place.  It is a cute place and they do have the best Jelly I have ever had ever. So at some point in time some one knew what they where doing.  But maybe when they setup shop in Arizona they sent out someone who was not qualified to train and open new restaurants.  I would like to believe if you go to Oregon they operate better.  I wish I could remember what some of the previous issues were. But I know it has been 6 months and mistake I tried it again.

Thing is if they cared about doing things properly they would have feedback forms in the restaurant.  And maybe a way on the website to send a message.  I'm not going to send snail mail to the corporate office to complain.  So hopefully they read this review get better management and train their employees cooks and servers.  This could be a great restaurant with a little care and TLC.

So you are warned. It's a roll of the dice if you will have a good or bad experience.

What a great place.
The food was awesome.. Try the sweet potato pancakes, they are like candy and melt in your mouth.

The wait staff is very fast, highly attentive, and VERY VERY FRIENDLY..

This restaurant is on my favorite list for breakfasts..  If they were closer to where I  live, id gain 20 pounds eating there daily.  Prices are good too.

Go, experience, enjoy. 

Marlene and Art run the  restaurant, and  they hand pick the nicest staff... 
To ensure a pleasant experience.

I am very candid with my reviews and have no problems giving a 1 star when warranted..  Biscuits Cafe has earned 5 Stars with ease.

I gotta say, my initial impression of this place wasn't a good one. We walked in just after noon and found only 2 other tables in the entire place to be occupied. Then when we got seated, we had a super weird start where we basically got juggled around with 3 separate waiters/waitresses coming up to our table. Luckily, it was smooth sailing after that and I was extremely surprised with Biscuits Caf√©.

The restaurant itself is located on the SE corner of Sahara & Durango. Inside, they've got a really big, spacious dining room and they seem to be doing a great job of keeping it clean and organized. Instead of getting too into detail on what it looks like, I'll shamelessly plug my first opportunity to try out the Yelp video function. ;) *Although you might have to go to the business photos on the mobile app to find it*

As far as the food goes, they have a fairly large menu with choices for both breakfast and lunch. I ended up going with the Zesty Chorizo omelette and was really impressed. The chorizo was cooked perfectly, had great flavor and just the right amount of spicy heat. All the other ingredients were fresh and aside from tasting great, the portions are huge. They literally put what looked to be an entire avocado inside the omelette and it's served with a side of your choice, and biscuits. The salsa appeared to be fresh made and was easily one of the best I've had in a breakfast joint. My only complaint on my plate would be the potatoes. They were cooked well and also served as a huge portion, but they were lacking in salt. If I were to order this omelette again though, I'd ask for extra cheese. 

Now, with a name like Biscuits Caf√©...they better have some good biscuits! Were they the best I've ever had? Probably not. But they are solid and in my opinion, far superior to what you'll find in most other restaurants in town. Buttery, flaky and served with both fresh butter and jam. You can tell they are fresh made every day and even though I'm not usually one to get biscuits for breakfast, I'd make sure to get one every time I'm here. Biscuits and gravy fans will love the version here.

Aside from the weird start, the customer service is great too. I could be wrong, but it looks like a family run joint and even if they aren't, you can tell they put a lot of love into their food. As others have mentioned, it's only a matter of time before this place starts getting busy and you're waiting for a table. It may have started off bad and a dead restaurant at peak times, is almost always a red flag...but Biscuits Caf√© is serving up huge portions of killer food at great prices, and I'll happily be a repeat customer!

This cafe was amazing!! Wow!! Never been here before and came with my dad right before it got busy at 10am. The atmosphere was really pretty but we got sat under a fan and were freezing the whole time. The only con about this place was that our food took like 20 minutes but it was really packed and it was a Sunday. YOU HAVE TO GET THE CINNAMON ROLL FRENCH TOAST OMG it was SPECTACULAR!! I usually always get pancakes at breakfast places because I prefer my mom's homemade french toast, but this beat it out of the park!! They are popular for their cinnamon rolls but you gotta get the french toast form of it! Overall great place but took a long time for food. Would go back 10/10!!!
Fast and fresh breakfast! I like the simple things for breakfast sometimes and they do a great job at it. Will definitely be back.
Great breakfast! The cinnamon roll french toast and meat lovers omelette are top notch! Biscuts and fresh jam are terrific.

Just a block away from our apartment, decided to check it out.  Greeted quickly, seated in a clean booth, coffee and water delivered, coffee was quite nice.  Server was knowledgeable of menu which was great, also very friendly.  
I had a western scramble, with red potatoes and pancakes.  Meal was delicious and it was served with a few small tortillas which was unexpected but loved them.  Pancakes were also yummy.  Coffee refills were coming around frequently which was nice.
Only thing I would recommend was that the manager should spend more time table touching or checking on the customers instead of micro managing her staff.  She walked by our table 9 times but could not be bothered checking on us or even making eye contact.  Only saw her smile once when she was called to a table for a complaint.

What nice surprise,  the food was fresh and hot out of the kitchen.  May breakfast came with the best strawberry preserve,  my wife had Marion Barry preserve which was equally as good, and homemade.. A really nice place, very clean, would recommend to anyone that wants to try something a little different.

Went here on a day off mid week for a good brunchin'. I got the veggie omelette (minus the cream cheese) with the hash browns and side of fruit. Had to get coffee too , of course. The omelette was huge and very tasty. The hash browns were nice and crispy but a little too greasy for my liking. The coffee, however, was super yummy! Bonus.....the patio is dog friendly! Wish I knew that before I left my pup at home

This is a it is a great place for breakfast. First, the establishment is clean and warming. It has easy access right off of the 101. Plenty of seating to house larger groups and the staff are super attentive. I ordered the standard fare for me: eggs, sausage, Toast and Hashbrowns. 

Here is the really good part. They use a fabulous sausage link, 2 ounces and big! Not that Seinfeld, George in the pool episode! The food is fresh and it was prepared perfectly. My server who's name escapes me, was dialed in. Her manager should pat her on the back. She's a keeper! Check this place out if you are near the Westside! Weekends can be quite the wait, so get in early!

#vino2 #vinosquared #vino2ultimate

When we got there parking was a nightmare.  We were seated right away,  that was awesome.  However,  the service is not that great. Our waitress didn't do anything that stood out,  she was boring and had no personality.  I say this because the food was good.  I enjoyed my brisket Benedict  was awesome.  I think this place deserves a real wait staff, that's attentive,  suggestive,  and more excited.  The prices are a touch higher than they should be, so your tip will reflect that,  therefore,  a much better wait staff is needed.  I give the service a 1 star,  but the food,  an easy 4 out 5.  So 3 stars, is generous.
Great breakfast place!  Portions were big, food was tasty. Definitely would go back! Staff was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.
My daughter and I sat outside on the patio which was lovely. We both ordered the Avocado toast .  DELICIOUS!!!!  Our server was so sweet and attentive.   Would definitely go back.

I live right around the corner from this new brunch spot.  Finally tried it and it's my new favorite!  Very friendly staff and yummy food!  I love their biscuits and their homemade strawberry jam is to die for.  Haven't had a meal I didn't like yet.  The only thing I did not like was the giant glob of butter served on the cinnamon roll.  This is personal preference though, so I certainly do not fault for that!

Very good food, nice ambience and good service. Went there for breakfast on a whim one day and was not disappointed. The biscuits were delicious, as was everything else on my plate. I sat in a corner so it wasn't excessively noisy but there are a lot of middle of the room tables that are right next to each other as well. Multiple servers stopped by my table to refill my drink. All were kind and quick. Nice place.

Nothing is worse than getting ripped off for low quality food. This location of Biscuits ripped us off this morning!  I ordered a scramble with red potatoes as a side, and the dish tasted as if it was warmed in a microwave or maybe sat under heat lamps for 10 minutes? Eggs had an aged taste of them and a slight curry-ish flavor or something bizarre. Not sure what a cook does to eggs to make them taste this way... and I don't really WANT to know either. Absolutely disgusting. I don't think the curry flavor was actually intentional. Biscuits are tiny and miserly, especially for a place named... well, you've seen it before. And the bill was $45.00 for three breakfasts and low end, flavorless 7-11 coffee and creamer from Sam's Club? Come on. Worst quality and most ridiculously overpriced breakfast I've had in decades! This place is an embarrassing joke.
Had a great breakfast for our first time to the Cafe. Food was excellent as was the service

A group of 7 of us went for a birthday breakfast this past Saturday and we got right in for a table. Service was friendly and good! I had the Two Eggs Your Way with Bacon and then also split biscuits and gravy with someone else. Portion sizes were great and you could easily share something. If I'm back on that side of town I will certainly be back.

Decided to stop in for breakfast since we were heading to Chandler. We arrived about 10am on Saturday and while it was busy we got seated right away. I had the chipped beef w/2 eggs over easy, crispy hashbrown and two biscuits. I had decided to go outside of my box with this order. When it arrived my eggs were over cooked as my yolk wasn't runny at all and that is my favorite part. I was expecting some gravy over the chipped beef as it was a tad dry without it so I asked for a side of that which definitely helped. The hashbrowns were cooked crispy like I like but the best part of my breakfast was the two biscuits that I put gravy on one and the jam on the other. My boyfriend ordered the waffles with sausage links. He said it was good but I could tell it didn't stand out like other places. Service was very good but I think we will try other options around the valley before really coming back.

I went to Biscuits Cafe today after passing it several times and wanting to try it. I decided to go with friends this morning and was super excited about it. 

I ordered my favorite breakfast choice, biscuits with gravy. I became immediately disappointed after taking my first bite. The biscuit tasted horrible and the gravy was just so-so. I couldn't believe it. With a name like biscuits cafe, I through their biscuits would be, well fantastic. 

One of my friends had a breakfast burrito and did not care for that either. The sweet potato pancakes were good though as was our service.
Biscuits were great the gravy was just okay but the service and red potatoes were excellent.
Great food service sucks 1 waiting for food drinks Etc...... I'll be back because food is good but be willing to wait
We went for breakfast. Large menu and quite a number of choices. Food was okay, service was  good. A little pricey. We'll probably return.
Best breakfast place!!  The waffles and bacon are crispy and the juice is always fresh and cold.
Big portions, good flavor, great prompt service, great price.  Pancakes  than IHOP, waffles better than Waffle House, French toast better than...making it yourself.  Will be back.

Panera prices, without the Panera taste!  If you like bland, mushy food, this is the place for you!  Its called salt, and they should probably put some in the kitchen.  Service wasn't bad, but the food was.

I had the Avocado Toast, which was soggy and somehow bland.  The basted eggs were, you guessed it, bland.  With a heavy dose of salt and pepper it was edible, but I certainly wouldn't say two pieces of soggy avocado toast and two basted eggs was worth $9.50.  

We also had a $5 doughy and bland cinnamon roll which was covered in a fairly sweet, but bland cream cheese icing.  

She had the breakfast burrito with ham ($12), which had a lot of grizzle in it, barely any egg, and wasn't toasted on the flat top after being assembled.  

Basically this is cheap cafeteria food, at good food prices and we were VERY disappointed.
Food here really sucks. Eggs like rubber, hash browns unlike potatoes, fruit like frozen w/sugar added, biscuits hard and gravy s/be dumped over all of it. Huge disappointment
It was my first time here and I had a delicious meal! Yum! The service was nice and welcoming.

Let me start by saying I was shocked that Las Vegas even had a Biscuits Cafe.....because we have a couple in AZ and I thought it was only in Oregon....AZ and Washington. So imagine my excitement when I found out one was here and my wife could use her 5 buck Birthday Certificate for our entire meal. We have not been to Biscuits in years because with us being VEGANS there was nothing there we could really have. However upon looking at the menu when we arrived out here......we found that they actually do have a couple of items that are VEGAN. We ordered the Veggie Wrap which comes with your choice of hasbrowns or Red potatoes. While neither item was seasoned very well.....we fixed that issue with some salt....hot sauce....and ketchup....LOL!!!!! 

The Customer Service was awesome.....the establishment was very clean.....and location was very easy to access. I would honestly only come here if I had a coupon or gift certificate to use but all in all it was a very good experience. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!

I'm not a local in Vegas but visit family frequently throughout the year and this is my go-to breakfast spot every time! The biscuits and gravy are to die for and everything I've tried on the breakfast menu has been A1 so far  staff is quick, courteous, and have great personalities. I always have the pleasure of sitting in Glor√≠a's section where she takes really good care of us. Definitely a must if you're in Vegas and trying to have something outside the strip!

As I read the reviews, I didn't encounter any of those things that were posted, the greeting was nice, sat immediately and took my drink order ... Also inquired about WIFI.. Yes they have it.. My BLTA was great.. Definitely would come back .

The only quick part of my meal was the bus boy asking if I was finished-my plate half-full of food, my fork in my hand, and still chewing the last bite I had taken.
