I had to get someone's attention to be sat, I waited nearly 10 minutes to place an order, and I finally had to go up to the cashier with no check. When I expressed my disappointment in my first visit, I was told, "That's too bad. I hope we see you back again."  Yeah, that's not likely.

My friend insisted I go to biscuits to give it a try.  I decided to have the chorizo omelette with avocado and cheese.  The omelette came with onions and mushrooms which I asked to remove and it was missing the avacado.  I also had a large orange juice and a side of gravy to go with my biscuits.  Total was $19 which I thought was a bit high.  Food was average.

Service however was great and had enough extremely friendly server.

It was pretty busy so we thought it was going to be amazing. It turned out that the service was horrible and the food was mediocre. The server was Kathryn. She must have been having a bad day because she kept rolling her eyes! Unbelievable. 
I liked how they had condiments on the table. Tabasco and Cholula. The atmosphere was loud. It was OK. Not somewhere I'd go back to. 
We all ordered something different. The ham Benedict was good. The ham was cooked to perfection but the Hollandaise sauce was too greasy. The Pancakes from what I hear we're delicious. 
I don't think we will return.
Great place, but they are PERMANENTLY CLOSED!! Sorry for the bad news. We went today to closed doors and a sign saying they are closed
I came here specifically for the sweet potato pancakes. I have been searching high & low for a breakfast place in Phoenix with these babies!

Breakfast was delicious again. We came rather early so wasnt packed. I like the food here. I like the location in proximity to my house however I wish patio was a little more serene. They cant help that so I just choose to come early and sit inside. I like their pancakes but also their lunch items.

Man, do I love a good breakfast spot. Biscuits Cafe, you are a good breakfast spot.

My dining experience at BC was a home run. My only regret was that I did not try the coffee which would have made my review complete. I will definitely have to go back and include an addendum.

A colleague of mine and I hit up BC for a quick bite while on lunch break. When we walked in I quickly noticed the place felt fresh. All of the decor was simplistic, clean and appeared new. I was very surprised at how big the restaurant was as well. We were quickly greeted by one of the smiling waitresses and seated. I opted for the Country Benedict and my colleague went for the Chicken Fried Chicken. When our entrees arrived I could not believe the portion sizes that were heaved onto our plates! There was probably enough gravy on my plate to fill my water cup. No complaints here! The quality of the food was par for my expectations and my colleague's as well, and the price seemed just right. The servers were also really on top of their game and not overly attentive.

Next time you're craving some breakfast, do yourself a favor. Skip Denny's and IHOP and give Biscuits Cafe a shot.

Ugh, so disappointed. Just tried this place for the first time. We have a 2 year old son and it's not easy to go out to eat with him so we ordered breakfast to go. We had a rough morning walking out to a dead car battery and had a hectic morning. So when we got home without our full order of food, I was upset, we called Biscuits Cafe to let them know we were missing an item and they told us to back come in and get it. We live 6 miles away from this restaurant, so it's not just down the street. My husband went to the restruant and picked up the item, they didn't offer him anything complimentary for the inconvience nor did they even appoligize. This was the last thing we needed to deal with on top of our hectic morning. Unfortunately I will not be coming back here and I will not be recommending this place whatsoever.  $35 for a cold breakfast... Beyond disappointing.

Service was great. Waitress was very attentive. Food was not very good... so bad in fact I did basically nothing more than taste test: coffe=bitter, gravy on biscuits=tasted like flour paste and pepper, Biscuits=hockey pucks (mine were better when I was 12). Bacon=burnt AND raw..... waitress.. very sweet... very good.. manager insisted "I had bad taste", this was the " best food she had ever had"...( poor woman.) AND  she expected me to still pay full price for 2 sips of coffee and 2 bites of biscuits/gravy, zero of the bacon...sigh... great location... but for a fairly new place, only open part of the day, it could also have been cleaner... placed had greasy floor/corners and the lovely scent of dirty mop water. Would not try unless you and your grandma are bad cooks and cover taste with coarsely ground pepper.

This review is completely about the service we received. Our server, Melissa, was kind and professional. She made sure our service was great and the food was cooked to order. At one point, she got sat with 5 tables at once. She greeted them all within a reasonable time and never forgot about us. I will request her as a server from now on.

Came and had breakfast with the hubs and baby before heading to the pumpkin patch. Service was quick and friendly. Tried the homemade corned beef hash which wasn't bad but a bit salty. Having the over easy eggs and added hot sauce helped. Hubs tried the biscuits and gravy because I feel like you have to and he said they were good, not as good as my homemade ones, sorry! They charge for refills of coffee so I was really disappointed with that since a small cup ended up coming to almost $3 each. For black decaf, that seems excessive. With so many other breakfast places in our area, not sure if we'd swing by again.

(Lyrics - Limp Bizkit - Break Stuff)

Its just one of those cafes 
When you want to order coffee to wake up
Everybody's ready for brunch

You don't really know why
But you want to justify
Eating a big breakfast!

Add ketchup with eggs
You don't have time to interact
Your mouths full of jelly smacks

Your best bet is to keep coming this way, Yelpers
It's just one of those cafes!!

Biscuits Cafe is definitely one of those cafes; once you wake up to after a night out.  A night out with Jack, Jose, Sam Adams that is - wink!

Needless to say, Biscuits Cafe is a breakfast and brunch joint that serves up some wholesome breakfast mom used to make.  If you were born in the 50's and your mother actually cooked 3 main meals a day!  As that is now gone, Biscuits Cafe is probably one of the few closest place that brings that to life.  Welcome to the 21st century and I'm not talking about the insurance business! 

I ordered their Chicken Fried Steak and guess what else it came with?  Bacon, hash browns, scrambled eggs, and pancakes!  Wowza!  I'm a quality guy and not so much a quantity so this was too much food.  I nibbled around and my Chicken Fried Steak wasn't too bad.  The gravy a top was nice and creamy and kept it warm.  The bacon was crispy and the hash browns were too.  The pancakes, well they were dry.  In the end, the entire meal was pretty dry aside from my gravy. 

Overall, it was a nice experience and I rather enjoy long breakfasts with friends. The place itself is like an old school diner and service was good. - Enjoy!

We have frequented Biscuit's Cafe many times and found the breakfast to be very good. My wife loves their sweet potato pancakes, or when available, their seasonal pumpkin pie pancakes. My favorite are the omelets (Greek or Country) served with link sausage. They also have a "Keeping It Simple" selection on the menu that gives you a choice of any 3 items (out of over 20 items). Service has always been good but can slow when crowded.

Food was bland.. service terrible..  I get better service at McDonald's..  our waitress was to busy to be bothered to stop her conversations with her friends to check on us.. and she couldn't care less when the food wasn't satisfactory... Hostess didn't if inquire about our visit.. will not be back..

Ordered Country Omelette It Was Delicious! It Was Covered In Gravy And Accompanied By Red Potatoes And Pancakes. Portions Were Larger Than Anticipated Which Is Always A Plus. Service Was Efficient And With A Smile

I gave three stars because I hope the bad experience my wife and I had was unique and rare: Table hadn't been wiped down before we were seated. Utensils and napkins were dirty and we were given a new set that were also dirty. Turns out something had spilled (syrup?) into the bin of fresh napkins and utensils which we had to point out before getting a clean set. I ordered the Black Oak Kielbasa with 2 over easy eggs, biscuits  and red potatoes. The biscuits are good... but kinda small? They are tall but not very large in diameter leaving little surface area to spread butter onto. They are baked to a perfect golden brown but resembled store-bought in regards to size. I guess this really disappointed me since the name of the place is what brought us in. (I assumed a place called "Biscuits" would have yuge biscuits.) They are served with a good red fruity berry sauce to dip or spread that actually goes perfect and balanced the rich and salty sausage. As for the sausage, the bottom half of the Kielbasa was cold... Like it had been taken out of the refrigerator and cooked on the flattop on only one side for only a few minutes. One of the yolks was cooked to medium which is weird. The potatoes were good and cooked proper with herbs and spice. My wife ordered the Ortega Chilies & Jack Cheese Classic Burger. The meat was cooked to death. Dry. Waitress did not ask for preparedness and we failed to specify, but it's basically burnt. The sandwich itself fell apart easy because it was so dry. The fries were pretty standard and prepared well.

Service was okay, but not spectacular.  Had mixed views on food.  Food also seemed pricey, though portions were fairly large.

Went in with my husband for lunch.  We were seated and served quickly but service was just okay, not special...i.e., no warm greeting, no smiles, etc...just the bare minimum was done to keep it from being bad service.  Our view on food was mixed.  I got the biscuit and gravy plate with bacon and scrambled eggs.  I tried the eggs first and found they really tasted like bacon.  So either they were cooked right next to the bacon on the grill, or the cooks use bacon grease to cook the eggs.  Lol.  Either way it was weird.  The biscuit seemed small and was covered in room temperature gravy, not the best.  I wished the gravy was warmer and the biscuit was fresher.  The bacon was good, thick cut, and cooked to my liking.  It was the best part of the meal.  My hubby thought his California club sandwich was excellent, super fresh, and tasty.  It really did look delicious and had me wishing I'd ordered it too.  His potato salad was your basic salad.  We both had sodas to drink.  The tab was just over $30, including tip.

Overall, I'm giving it a 3-star review since it was a mixed bag for us.  My husband really enjoyed his food.  My food was filling but nothing to write home about.  We'll likely be back since it's nearby.  Will update if our views change.

This place is excellent! We all know it as the place where the dog place use to be ;) AKA Biscuits. They have excellent service, it's super clean, food comes fast and it's a lot for your $$. We went in the second day it was opened and we left full, happy and ready for a mid morning nap. Take my advice and try this place.

So so..won't go out of my way to come here again. Coffee was OK..got the French Toast with eggs and sausage. Sausage patties looked like they were microwaved and we're dry, my daughter's potatoes were cold. French Toast was the best part of the meal .

Absolutely great spot for business breakfast. Much better than the egg and I.  The country omelette smothered in gravy was delicious and the hashbrowns were nice and crisp. Service was friendly and attentive. Will be back soon and many times

So yummy! I had the almond crusted French toast and my girlfriend had the apple sausage breakfast combo. The French toast was so good! A new spin on the classic favorite. The bacon was delicious and thick cut. Her sausage was tasty and the biscuit and jelly were really good! I'm glad it opened and is just around the corner from the house. Everyone was super friendly and the owners came by to say hi as well. We will definitely be back!
Chicken fajita omelette and the best bacon I've ever had! By far the best breakfast place in AZ so far! Not greasy, healthy options, and giant portions!!

After searching for a great breakfast place I thought I finally found one.  The restaurant was clean and quite quaint.  The servers were pleasant.  The menu offered a nice assortment of items although very pricy for breakfast.   The server was nice and coffee came out fast. We ordered and waited for sadly a cold meal.   Side note the biscuit were hot a pretty good.   This was there second week open. We will try them again in a month or two.

Stick with the biscuits if you go. While I enjoyed my food (eggs, bacon, sliced tomatoes, and biscuit), my date's meat-lover's omelet was a disappointment. There was a TON of meat in it, about a tablespoon of cheese, and a slice of processed cheese on top. Processed cheese! The omelet kept falling apart because it appeared they had cooked the egg as a tortilla and then filled it with ingredients; nothing would stay in.

The service was good, and our waitress checked on us a few times. She was pushing the cinnamon rolls, but for the price, they didn't look very tasty. 

My date raved about the jam, which appeared to be homemade since they sold jars to go.
Love this place!! Portions are huge and the food is always on point. Friendly staff and they also have a rewards program!
Well we have been here twice.  The service was slow and food was cold.  May have the most uncomfortable seats for seniors I have ever sat in.   Will not return

They shouldn't have the word "biscuit" in their name...

For a place that calls themselves Biscuit Cafe, you would think they would have some great biscuits... Or at least some freshly made and unique biscuits... Maybe because it was drowned in gravy, but it honestly felt and tasted like a generic biscuit that was purchased in bulk. 

Among having a generic biscuit, the gravy & sausage links I had was a tad too salty. The crispy house potatoes weren't bad. 

I wouldn't say I left mad and upset, just disappointed. 2 stars seems more than fair for my experience. No need for me to go back again in hopes of having a better meal.

Ben eating here since they opened ! Had out of town guests and had great memories here till today. Ham was cold on breakfast and wrong toast brought to table. For a place called biscuits don't order any ! They're small dry ,tasteless and just not worth the effort. Omelet wasn't much better. Bummed I guess I will be on the look for another place for breakfast. Feeling disappointed and bummed. Wondering what caused the change in quality of the food !

If this could have zero stars it would. Server was very nice and friendly but as I finished my meal and was packing it up to take home for my doggies I noticed green spots on the bottom of my biscuit. Little specks all over. It was moldy, the biscuit I had been eating was molding on the bottom. I wrapped it up quietly to take inside and show the man running the cards. He held it up, felt the spots, wadded It back up and threw it away and said "that's weird and definitely doesn't look right, hmmm". Then proceeded to say "want me to split the check in both cards?" He didn't give a hoot and was so un-bothered by the fact I just ate a MOLDY biscuit they just served me. Never going back. EVER.

Very nice place! Good food, friendly staff. I was really impressed by it. It's a lot more nicer than a Denny's or IHOP for sure when it comes to breakfast. Very clean as well. They had vegetarian options for me which is great and something I look for in a place. Overall, will definitely come back
Awesome service from Diana and great food! Pancakes tasted like cake! So yummy!  Will definitely be back!

This place is like a half mile from our house and we finally got around to trying it.  Impressive menu and the place is bigger than it looks from the road. Chicken fried steak and eggs were great and the service was friendly and very attentive. Definitely will be returning.

Awesome Florentine eggs benedict!!! Service was adequate but not overly attentive... it was way too freaking hot to even contemplate the patio today but in cooler months this would be an awesome place to enjoy!!! I know it's weird but I wasn't looking for a mimosas or a Bloody Mary so I'm not sure they have that but that would make it even better!!! Yay!

You can pick up HUGE cinnamon rolls on the way out to take home and enjoy. They look amazing!

I decided to take my boyfriend out for a nice Sunday breakfast at a nice little cafe around the corner from his house. We arrived a little after 11AM and had to wait about 15 minutes. Once we were seated, we noticed how cute the decor inside was and how many great choices the menu offers. I decided to get an omellete, red potatoes and biscuits and gravy. We waited about 15 minutes for food but everything that came out was good. Service was spotty but not complaining. I would come back to try some of the other menu items.

Just left Biscuits(Grand/Bell) ..love the food but we are thoroughly disappointed by the food prep.  Sat directly in front of toaster where a server was handling money, peoples water glasses and toasting everyones bread...ontop of eating her own food.  Not once but twice now.  Plus we didnt see any kitchen help using gloves. Needless to say i didnt eat my toast . I wanted to talk to management about this but he was standing next to server as she ate her sandwich and putting bread in the toaster.  Didn't think that would have done any good. Cant go back.

Oddly, the biscuits weren't all that great, but the gravy was good. It seemed like the biscuits were the kind of standard mass produced products that you would expect at at a supermarket. I like my biscuits toasted on top and I like them to have a taste and texture beyond bland spongy bread -- especially considering this is their signature food. The biscuits were rather small considering the price -- and the gravy wasn't hot. If I didn't know better the cafe used Pillsbury dough for their biscuits. Eeek!

Overall BC is a great  place to get a meal that tastes very homemade. The red potatoes are heavenly and the french toast is about the best I have had. The coffee was good too. 

The corned beef is good but I wouldn't recommend ordering this with red potatoes because the potatoes used to make the hash are very similar. You end up with a big plate of potatoes.

The eggs are disappointing. When I order two eggs I want two separate eggs, not one big round thing containing two egg yolks.

I came during off hours. The service was very good and friendly.

To me BC seemed sort of high priced, but the quality made the experience worth it.

Biscuits Cafe is probably one of the most underrated breakfast spots in town. I'm a fan of cinnamon rolls and a fan of French toast, so the cinnamon roll French toast ($10.99) was a marriage made in fat-kid heaven. Sweet, cinnamon filled, doughy and delicious, there's enough sweetness without being overpowering. The portion is large and included eggs and bacon. You'll probably skip lunch after eating it.

My kid's order of chocolate chip pancakes ($4.99) was obscene. Way more than any nine year old needs to eat. It's two large buttermilk pancakes full of Ghiardelli chips with whipped cream and chocolate syrup on top.

Service was a little slow even with the place nearly empty early in the morning. But, that was the only downside to our meal.

After reading the reviews we were hesitant about trying this place out. But we figured we try. Boy are we all glad we did.
We got there at 8:30 am on Sunday and we're seated immediately.  Our server brought water and offered coffee while we looked over the menue. Our order was taken and about 15 minutes later our food arrived. Everyone in our group got biscuits and graveyard and we all thoroughly enjoyed them. I thought the grave was very creamy with lots of flavor but wish it had bigger chunks of sausage. The biscuits were very good. Flakey and rich. The hash browns were crispy on the outside and not to soft on the inside with lots of buttery potato flavor.  The thick cut bacon was excellent  (nice that u get 3 pieces).
We all said that we will be back.
Service and food are both okay. My husband liked his roast beef dip, I thought my turkey sandwich lacked flavor. We'll go check it out again to give it another shot since it's in the area

This has become my favorite place for breakfast. The patio area is very nice. I've never had to wait to eat even during peak breakfast/lunch hours. The waitresses are always extremely nice and helpful. I don't know what it is about the batter that they use to fry, but its delicious. I usually get the chicken fried steak (so good) and substitute my toast for some fruit; they give you a very substantial amount of fruit and they almost never add the $2 up charge to my bill, and if they did I wouldn't mind because they don't skimp and I know fruit can get expensive especially if substituting for bread.They also have a pretty good rewards program and when I was signing up they asked if I wanted to include any other family birthdays or special occasions to receive extra money off on those days. They definitely didn't have to do that. I've never left this place unhappy- only once were my eggs not cooked enough and she took them back immediately and replaced them with fresh ones. All in all, if you're looking for a good breakfast/lunch place I fully recommend Biscuits Cafe! (at least this location)

After Harlow's down the road was so packed we couldn't park, we decided to give this new breakfast cafe a try.  The portions are extremely generous and overall the food was really good.  The prices are a little high I think, but not so much that I wouldn't return.  I knocked down a star because the ham I received was "off" and tasted like it was past it's shelf life, and the oj was just so-so.  They do give complimentary chocolate covered strawberries that are epic!

Wonderful gluten free waffles!

It's a smaller cafe, so I always go off peak hours.

We always have a great waitress.

My husband goes with friends at least once a week if not more frequently.

Parking... it's a shopping center, so it is what it is.  The bank in the plaza has a fit even when they aren't open.  I wouldn't call it patio seating as only a few tables... they have some work to do there it's a nice try.

I like the decor and real maple syrup when you eat in.  When you get it to go, it's Mrs Butterworths.
Nice breakfast place. Had the meaty omelet with hash browns and pancakes. Nice portion size.

It was , nothing special. Had eggs that were cooked good, bacon that was bacon, the hash browns were cold and horrible I will say. Had the Apple Cinnamon French toast, it wasn't bad, sweet, good. The strawberry compote or jam was the best thing in my opinion. I also like that they had a variety of creamer. Coffee was your average diner cup of Joe. I would eat there again but not by my choice, just think that there are other places way better were this was average to poor. Clean and looks nice inside and service was good.

Always good but it's usually loud. Service is tricky since they're usually busy and have the weirdest division of tables (today our waitress had 4 tables seated at the same time on opposite ends of the restaurant). 
I've only been here for breakfast but the bacon slices are good!

The pancakes at Biscuits are so great. The servers are always so friendly and personable. We did have to wait a little bit for a table but only because we arrived at prime breakfast time on a Saturday. So worth the wait though!!!

A favorite breakfast spot on the West side of town. Food is really good and selection caters to healthy and happy. Always have tables available and staff are friendly. Place is big and spacey. Wish they would up their coffee game as that's the only thing not up to par!

Went in for breakfast this morning around 10am and got seated right away. Good size restaurant and patio with casual atmosphere. Our server was Cathy and she was phenomenal! Very nice, constantly checking in with us, and always made sure our water, coffee, and creamers were full! 

Started off with coffee that was delicious and steaming hot! Served in a huge 12-14oz black mug. Good flavor with different kinds of creamer on the table to choose from. For my meal I got the 3 pancakes with fresh strawberries and whip cream. It's was delicious! The strawberries were very fresh and sweet. The pancake itself was huge, thick, and fluffy. 

I got bacon on the side as well. Came with 4 large slices of bacon Very Crispy. I love my bacon crispy so it was perfect but if you like it a little under done make sure to request it and they are happy to accommodate(they did it for my friend)! 

Overall everything was great! Good food and awesome service. Looking forward to coming back and try something new.

Sorry to hear that this place is closed. I had good times here, and it was fairly consistently decent food, that was homey. But something was always a little bit off.  The service could be inconsistent, and the price was a little bit overpriced.  Biggest problem could have been the hours.  Oh, well, it is all moot now.

How unfortunate because the biscuits were tasty. We were seated within 15 min which was great. However, once we placed our order we waited for about 25min and realized that other patrons that had arrived at about the same time or after us, were already eating. The waitress realized and brought us the biscuits I mentioned earlier. However, after another 25 min,  we decided to cancel the order. The waitress felt bad, but by then we weren't hungry anymore. I just don't think it should take 25 minutes or worse 50 minutes, to make a biscuits omelette and a Greek omelette. Too bad because the food the other patrons did look decent. I should have asked for the manager, but not too keen on making big issues.

ARRIVED 1:10.  No greeting.  8 employees on the floor with 14 tables more than half done eating and leaving. What? More than 2 employees for every table, your kidding me.  Additional  5 employees sitting on break in dining room.  Order given, asked server (who is always friendly we get her alot) looks like u are the only server, she says yes it does... what are the other 7 doing?  Neglecting customers and dirty tables - l9ts of hanging around and talking.  NOTE:  we were not the only ones grumbling and shaking our heads as the SO OBVIOUS  lack of direction, leadership, organization, total disfunction.  By now 10 tables total in the dining room, at one point 6 needed to order WITH 14 employees on the floor.  Now maybe some were getting ready to go home but seriously who goes home when the dining room is dirty, in disarray, and customers are being neglected... leadership promotion of teamwork  NOT HERE... but to be expected by the middle aged hag of a general manager.  We were treated so rudely by this woman.  I am embarrassed for this restaurant to have such poor representation of management and leadership with one of those rude people who smile and say have a nice day with a lot of disgust and dismissal and keeps on walking away hiding behind that sarcastic have a nice day... like we all haven't seen that move before, no academy award for her performance... should be completely ashamed of herself for her unprofessional behavior  and shortness at her age she should know better, but based on the leadership that was nowhere to be seen it makes sense.   Our food arrived at 1:45.  Open kitchen showed a breakdown occurring and french fries were barely warm and soggy and chili not warm.  Food dumped on us server rushed off, no soda refill  (half empty) no extra napkins,  no check back... gosh 14 employees and thus server is buried.  Got up and walked food back to kitchen to be fixed myself.  10 minutes later new fries arrive on a tiny plate while eating sandwich off a napkin, no offer for another plate or napkins or refill.  Now fries are hot, but white and raw and our sandwiches are cold.  Wave server down to say, we don't want this food, in a disappointing way not rudely, she needs to get manager.  She arrived and the rest is history.  What's the problem.  Not a hello, my name is... we respond we don't want this food (sandwich has 2 bites so don't think anything else) we brought u new fries (ok, so u knew already we had an issue and said come on don't play that game) ya but they are raw we respond... ok, have a nice day... but she really meant ok, go F-OFF ... you'd have to be deaf and blind not to know what she meant.  And she abruptly walks away, our reply you are being rude... HAVE A NICE DAY as she runs her passive aggressive poor excuse of a manager self back to hide in the kitchen where she was planted from the time we arrived.

Not the first time we had a poor experience but the last.  DON'T GO HERE!  and if you do, tell the manager she should be in uniform not her ugly street clothes she always wears.  Tell the young blonde we don't need cleavage in our face it's vegas yes but this is a breakfast joint not Hooters.  Tell the cashier that you are suppose to smile and walk faster than my 90 year old grandmother in a walker.  

No wonder this place sits half empty at all hours when other places have a line out the door.  ONE REASON ONLY - YOUR GENERAL MANAGER.  With 25 yrs food and beverage experience, we speak with experience.  

Watch your camera footage and pull labor reports if you don't believe me.  Shame on you for treating  us this way and ruining Father's day.  Hope u r proud of yourself.
Let just say I wouldn't go here if you want a light breakfast, very heavy food, kinda made me sick
Love the food, and the service is fast and friendly. Restaurant is always clean and on top of things. Delicious biscuits and u have to have the raspberry jam.

Solid menu. Best Hash Browns, Gravy. I am not usually a biscuits and gravy guy but I had to try and have had breakfast combos that included that ever since. The name and brick and mortar appearance are deceiving, i drove past this place 30 times before I stopped. I get the Chicken Fried Chicken or Chicken fried Steak.

Busy Sunday morning and only had to wait about 10 minutes. Really quick service & the food was amazing!! The biscuits & strawberry jam were my absolute favorite part of the meal. The Orange juice taste so fresh! I love the fact that they serve flavored creamer for the coffee. Our server was very nice & helpful.

Amazing! The Veggie Head omelette was delicious, the cute hostess was professional and seated us fast! The manager Kelly was nearby helping another customer and went out of her way to make their day special. This is a fantastic breakfast and brunch spot with a small town feel. I have been here a handful of times and even though I am not a regular they always remember my husband and I. Highly recommend.

Meh. Wife loves biscuits and gravy so we decided to try it out. Service was good but food was not. Both of our eggs were flavorless. Bacon was like cardboard. Our mugs were dirty and my wife wiped hers off with a napkin and left the napkin brown. Will not be back. Plenty of better spots to go.

A while back this place showed up on a search in my neighborhood for new breakfast places and I bookmarked it noting it would have to be a place I went to when not opening until 6;30 would be OK.

I was the only customer in the place until just before I finished.  Kelly, my server was pleasant and the only problem was she gave me a couple of minutes to look over the menu which turned into about 5 because she was chatting with the manager who was in my line of sight as I set down the menu and started playing with my phone. The remainder of the service was good.

The food was good with one exception. Two cooks, one customer and the timing of the plating was off. They serve toast with soft butter on the side and the toast was stone cold and even though I spread the butter immediately it never did melt in to the bread. Now that I know I may ask them to butter it right out of the toaster next time.

I prefer sitting in a chair at a table and the whole restaurant is set up that way. Sort of like not having a bad seat in the house. :) It is obviously a chain but I liked it and will probably go back again to try a couple of the other items that looked good on the menu.

3.49 stars

Me, the Corned Beef Hash plate and the Mrs. the Biscuits and Gravy all the way!

Cubed red potatoes is the only way to go and the bacon was just right, not too thin and not too thick - And the mug of coffee was huge!

We were hungry and found what we wish there were more of!  A place with a wonderful menu and excellent service that when you left, you felt full!

Terrible. Waited 20 min for a watery so called veggie omelette promised with fresh veggies and berries and whipped cream. The omelette was flavorless and the veggies were literally bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes! And no cream cheese. The berries were a soup of nasty crushed up waffle topping with a sad dollop of whipped cream for $4! So dissapointed.

We had a party of 10 people..this was my first time here ..it took a little time for all of us to show up.. the service was a little slow..I had to ask for eating  utensils ..but what got me the most was them asking us to leave after we have eaten ..they were polite about it but really..don't think I will be back..the food was OK not great..

First time here. We arrived early, about 7:30am. It was still nice enough so we sat outside. I tried the biscuits and gravy. It was very good. Have a feling they may be heated in the microwave though as my biscuit got a little hard as it sat on the plate. The gravy was good and plentiful. Husband said the coffee was excellent. Our waitress was good, but didnt come by often enough. 
We'll go back to try it again.

Ants, LONG food prep times, undercooked food time and time again... I , really wanted to LOVE this place.  Home style cooking right here in our Chandler neighborhood.  Such a disappointment. We haven't just gone once or twice we have given this conveniently located restaurant MANY times to rise above our last experiences ..and each time it just gets worse :(. I love Chicken Fried Steak and they have delivered but I ask for red potatoes with them and when they arrive at least 35-45 min later which is soooooooo long(the server always apologizes on the cooks behalf) my two eggs each time ( asked over hard) are runny and my potatoes are Crunchy!!!! Ew. We have sent them back and been patient time and time again. When you sit outside they don't clean all debris off the tables properly and it is often sticky... so, ANTS will join you during your breakfast.  I have seen the reviews on this restaurant and wanted to be able to justify all the insubordination.. I just can't.

Highly recommend... The food is delicious and very fresh. We only waited about 10 minutes on a packed Sunday morning and no one was rushed. Nikki is an AMAZING server. She was friendly, fun, and actually took the time to talk to us. And she was like that with all her patrons. She is an asset to this establishment and I want to go back for the food AND her. Love this place.

Grabbed breakfast here with a friend. I got the turkey & veggie scrambler. The food and service were good and the inside if the restaurant was nice. I probably would have given 4 stars, the reason I'm only giving 3 is because I was blown away by how expensive it was when I got my bill. I did substitute berries for potatoes as my side but still it was $22 (over $25 with the tip) for a plate of eggs and a cup of coffee. I mean this is just a diner, typical denny's/ihop type food - nothing special. Good but not that good.

I have eaten here before, as well as at other locations for this chain.  Blah.  "Friendly" but poor customer service from the time I walk in the door and have to wait to be seated (when they are only 20% ful at the height of lunch hour), to getting water brought to the table, to the waitress not understanding I wanted "kielbasa and scrambled eggs" not a "kielbasa scramble".  And then the food was only "blah", even their signature biscuits- a little over done . . . what a shame.  This part of Surprise is really humming.  Loads and loads of retail business with full parking lots all around.  Yet this Biscuit's Cafe struggles along - due solely to management's tolerance of far-less-than-stellar customer service.

Our 3rd visit. I picked this place for a Mother's Day outing. Bad choice. Service was not great, food tasted as if it was sitting there pre cooked and warmed in the microwave. Waitresses looked like they were run over by a truck so tired and walked around with frowns, dirty tables and floors..just felt dirty. Looks like they could use better management. Tea was good. We plan to not return. Expect more for the prices. Such a shame.

First time in and it was great.  Huge cup of coffee just what I needed to start my day. Scrambled eggs were perfect and my biscuits and gravy was amazing. Highly recommend.  Linda was our server.  Very nice quick with refills and very attentive.  We will be back!

First time order through Postmates which is how I found this spot. Delivery guy said everyone looked happy inside and the bags are heavy! He had never heard of it before and he wanted to try it now too. We got 5 different items but this burrito was mine. And GOOOOOOD!!!

Went here this morning.

The biscuits and gravy were just ok, the gravy was good, the biscuits were not light and fluffy. 

The blue berry pancakes were good. Who I had breakfast with said that the corn beef has was good. 

The service was just ok. 

The prices were high for the quality of food that you got. 

I won't say I won't return but it won't be my first or second pick more than likely.

I have eat here on many trips into town and will be my last!!! I went on a hike with two friends and after we decided to go here since they have never ate here.  They ordered breakfast and I had lunch.  My one friend ordered the one biscuit breakfast her eggs were cold her sausage patties were black,burned and dried out that a knife wouldn't cut them.  My other friend ordered a short stack that they over cooked one side and served them not even being able to cut.  Me well I ordered  BLT with avacodo and fries well how could you go wrong, well fries were cold and BLT was cold and bacon not cooked.  It was so bad and embarrassing that they had a bad experience there first time in.  I apologize to them and there response was its not your fault but we won't be coming back!!!!! And neither will I

Came here for breakfast and was really disappointed with the food quality. The restaurant is very clean, the service was good....but the food was just weak. We got the breakfast burrito (with corned beef hash) and it was just okay. We also got eggs Benedict which was fine but nothing special. 

Food is kind of overpriced and we probably won't be coming back.

We had breakfast here today, and will not return. Apparently this is a local outpost of an Oregon chain. The waiter extolled the virtues of the house-made sausage gravy, the biscuits, and wonderful strawberry jam made in Oregon. We found the biscuits to be heavy, possibly under-baked, and the gravy to be grainy with too much flour. I had a blueberry pancake, which was, well, ordinary, with only a few blueberries. I should have known better than to order mixed berries in October, because they had been frozen and were thawed to unpleasant mush. We did not have occasion to try the strawberry jam. Prices are pretty high for such mediocre fare.

Will never be back!! The one star is for the food, it was good.... But just luke warm. Doesn't surprise me since the tables around us (that got here after us) got their food promptly. My mom ordered fresh fruit and what she got was a syrup covered berries that looked frozen. We asked the waitress and she was surprised she wanted the fresh fruit. She replaced the side of fruit with what was originally asked for, fresh fruit! After that she never came back to the table. Never asked how our food was. Never refilled waters. Nothing. She sure was attentive to the other tables. The service at this place is always lack-luster and I've tried giving them the benefit of the doubt since it was busy. But today was hardly busy. Unacceptable!

Nice place! Wait on a Saturday morning wasn't too long, like 10 mins.. Good coffee with flavored creamers in nice big mugs. 

I had the smoked brisket eggs benedict. The brisket was sliced niced and thin and smoked perfectly, it was also very tender. Their hollandaise sauce was a little bland for me but my wife loved it. She had the traditional ham benny with added avocado and she said it was great. 

I also had a side of one sweet potato pankake, never tasted that before,  it was yummy.  Wifey had a sweet cinnamon roll which I tasted. It was light and fluffy, very good taste and you could tell it was  real cream cheese icing on top.

Service was very good and the servers are super friendly. Linda was a pleasure. 

Prices are reasonable and the food is fresh and yummy, I would recommend this place. Afterwards, you can shoot up 59th and go to Hot Bagels and pick up a fresh dozen to take home. The best bagels in town. 

We will def come back.

This place is awesome! My husband and I brunched here after church today and we had a wonderful experience. We were sat in a timely manner and the food was delish! They definitely have the best biscuit and gravy I've ever had in Vegas. It's not salty not tastes less, but instead just right. 

They do however need to staff more servers because they place is starting to get really busy.

I enjoyed my breakfast very much at this location. I had 2 pancakes, 2 bacon strips, and 2 biscuits and gravy.  I was very, very happy with the food. Good orange juice, environment, service, etc. This place is a keeper no doubt!! (Mind you I went in on Friday morning at 7am so my review does not reflect the weekend service or food)

The first few two times we ate here it was decent. But almost every time after that the service has been horrendous. I have found hair in my food and my husbands food and even found pieces of plastic in my grilled sandwich. It was appalling and the staff really didn't seem to care at all. Needless to say, my family and I do not visit this place anymore.
Finally made it in to try this place,  yummm!   The service was great & food was wonderful.  Well definately be back!
The staff is amazing and works well as a team. The food is great especially the sweet potato pancakes. They are so nice they even offer a drink to go. Fabulous place we will definitely be back!

Great breakfast place, but they need a hostess to sit people. I don't mind waiting for a table if it is crowded. But there were empty tables and and it was taking a long time to get seated. There was about 3 different groups the just left because it was taking to long.
5/10/18

I have to be honest, I wasn't really expecting much when my husband suggested this place for breakfast, I was wrong!! Amazing customer service, the food was hot and fresh and delicious! Huge portions! I was definitely pleased with the place and will definitely return!!

Not sure why the reviews aren't as good as mine. I love their biscuits and gravy, their red potatoes are great too! Pricing is okay but even better when you order their "Keep It Simple" option where you choose 3 entree's/sides. I also like their reward system.

This place has been bookmarked for awhile. So I decided to stop by here for breakfast and was hesitant to try this breakfast place because of the mixed reviews of fellow Yelpers. However, I stumbled across Antonia M. review and she mentioned the best item is their Cinnamon Roll French Toast plate. By now, your probably wondering...why did Marlon got this particular item when clearly it's called Biscuits Cafe. First and foremost, I have a sweet tooth and anything cinnamon sugar is gonna get my attention. As my server Brenda took my order, she was very knowledgable with the menu and history of biscuits cafe. She made my visit a pleasant morning and was very attentive to my needs. Water cup was filled constantly and my black coffee with small amount of cream was filled a few times too!

Onto the my Cinnamon Roll French Toast, from presentation and to the very last bite was amazing! The French toast was soft in texture with a good amount of cinnamon flavor throughout. The best part was that it was moist and not dried out. It included your choice of eggs and bacon or sausage. Both side items were good along with the side of hash browns that I got to contrast with my French toast. I would definitely come back for this dish and to try out other items.

2017 Yelp Review #8

Went there on Sunday morning about 9AMish and the place was constantly busy but not the rush that we find at a place like this for breakfast on Sunday morning.  Easily seated and drinks ordered right away.  Wife really liked the scrambled eggs and my omelette was pretty darn good.  What surprised me most and I am liking it for it,  they had the Tabasco brand of Chipotle hot sauce on the table.  You usually have to ask for it or most do not carry it at all.  Reasonable prices quite outstanding attention to service although the food did take a little more time than other places.  If you have time to spare,  it is a good sit down restaurant.

No matter how packed this place is the service is always amazing! The wait times are never long and the staff is always busy making sure every table is taken care of!  Highly recommend. Even on the weekends,

Went here for brunch on a Sunday. It get full pretty quickly. Service was great as for the food it was ok. It was just basic diner food.  I had the chicken and waffles and the Wifey had the country fried steak

Food is good
Service is ok

This location is very busy and takes a very long time to get your food! Be aware when you come here! I don't recommend coming with kids ever! The hour wait at your table will not fair well. You will likely wait both before and even longer at your table.

Everything about this place is outstanding! My friend and I arrived here on a Sunday morning for breakfast and good conversation.   The place was already packed!  We waited about 15 minutes for a table.  

The atmosphere here is pretty good.  You have a choice of indoor or patio seating which I think is nice.  We sat inside as it was a scorcher. 

I ordered the corned beef hash and it was dynamite! Real corned beef. Not that mushy canned junk. This was the real deal all crispy and tender and delicious!!! My friend had the avocado benedict and was extremely pleased.  Of course we HAD to try the house made jam as it is wonderful!!! I also appreciate the good sized coffee mugs they use and no shortage of refills.  I need a constant flow of coffee in the morning and Biscuits delivers. 

My only complaint is the parking. There's just not enough for this amazing restaurant.   You may find yourself walking a little ways from car to restaurant...but you may need it after filling your belly with the tasty treats you'll find on this menu.  Mmm.

Came here for brunch with the fam after church. Customer service was fantastic. We were greeted warmly and sat right away. Coffee and waters came out quickly.

I was a little taken a back by the prices, with the average being $10-11 bucks, but when the food came out I understood why...the portions are HUGE. My mom and I split a meal and we couldn't even finish it.

The food was pretty decent. I got the apple chicken sausage meal. I was excited for the sausage but it was pretty bland. Pancakes and eggs were good. Potatoes were greasy and chewy, Coffee was good. My sister got one of the specialty egg Benedict's and the whole plate was covered in gravy. Didn't look appealing to me but my sister said it tasted pretty good.

I didn't like that they charged us an extra $2.50 to share a plate.

Overall, it was a good experience. I also think the decor is cozy and adorable. Quality of the food could be taken up a notch or 2 though.

We found Biscuits Cafe (Biscuits with an 's' even though the Yelp page is singular) in an unassuming strip mall in front of Smart and Final.  I was not expecting much when we pulled up, but the exterior is misleading because once you step inside this place is large, bright, and airy.  I found it very refreshing.  We stopped by closer to lunch than breakfast, so the rush was over and we were seated right away.

We ordered the Smoked Brisket Benedict  $10.59 and the Joe's Scramble $10.49.  Both were eggs-cellent (haha).

The Benny comes with mesquite smoked brisket, English Muffin, 2 poached eggs, and hollandaise with a side of hashbrowns or red potatoes.  The brisket was fantastic- tender, moist, with rich flavor.  The hollandaise flavor fell a little flat, but was okay.  Hashbrowns, standard diner fare.

The scramble comes with FOUR eggs, spinach, onions, tomatoes, bacon, potatoes (in the scramble), and parm  on top.  This thing was massive and dense and all the flavors played well off each other.  But, man, it fills you up fast because it is so hearty!  I would likely 86 the potatoes in future.  They were unnecessary (IMO).  As if the dish itself were not large enough, this scramble comes with a side of biscuits, toast, or pancakes.  Since I'm obsessed with finding the perfect pancakes, I went for those and they were pretty darn good!  Fluffy with crispy edges.

We will definitely be back when venturing to the West Side.

Feeling a little under the weather this New Years Day, we ventured out to grab a bite... After driving by a few times and reading the reviews, we decided today was the day.. So glad we did!!! It's rare to browse a menu and want to try several things on the menu... But, we did and over ordered just to try some things out...  
We both ordered The Biscuits Burger.. This is a first for me... Hamburger, ham, bacon, cheese, egg, tomato, and onion..... Holy moly, this was super messy and delish!!  Our toddler ordered Mac & Cheese that came with a side of garlic toast. She LOVED it, and is super picky when it comes to Mac & cheese.. We also ordered the hash, very good, a biscuit to try their jam... Wow!  And instead of fries I ordered the pot roast soup...
The staff is very nice, the restaurant is very clean, and the food is very good.. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is timing of the food, and I will take partial responsibility... All the food came at once, including my soup...  Next time I will ask that my soup, and any extra items we order come out first...

Was my first time eating here this morning and I have to say.. Our waitress was great! Very friendly and attentive. The food was great and they certainly do not skimp on anything! Big portions we had to wrap up. A great place for breakfast and definitely will be back!

I wish I'd has as good an experience as others with this cafe.  My bacon was burned and the coffee smelled and tasted burned as well.  This cafe is priced higher and the food quality is lower than other breakfast eateries in the area.  I certainly won't be back.

This was our third visit to Biscuits Cafe and the prior visits were pretty good.....food was really good. Today not so much.  We ordered a four egg meat omelette with red potatoes and pancakes to split.  We read on the menu there was a charge for splitting and we were good with that.  Waitress seemed annoyed from the second we asked to split the meal.  When the meal arrived the portions were much smaller by half than the previous times I've ordered it for myself. The potatoes were cold...not even warm.  When we questioned the portion size of the meal the waitress rudely replied, "I don't know....it depends on who cooks it". Then promptly walked not even allowing us to finish the conversation.  Needless to say we will not be returning.

First visit to Biscuits. We got there about an hour after opening. The coffee was a
little on the strong side, but I could live with that, thanks to ice cubes and creamer.
The oatmeal was wonderful and my husband loved the potatoes. The one thing I
noticed most was the wait staff (the girls mostly). They just kinf of wandered around
with nothing to do and stood around and visited. We had the view of the kitchen
watching the kitchen staff going outside to smoke or on their cell phones.
What did we  ever do without cell phones, oh I know we worked, or at least looked around for something that needed attending to. Had the waitresses been asking diners if there was something they needed instead of just looking bored I would'nt have
mentioned it. Not sure I'll go back, a little too industrial.

Had the fish and chips and iced tea. Subbed onion rings for fries. Two of us split it because the waitress said it was a pretty good size. The food was good, but not 20.00 good. Iced tea is 3.00, which is ridiculous, but we are finding is becoming the norm around here. It was okay but I wouldn't go back mainly because it's way too overpriced for what you get.

What a great find. Great food an amazing service... My husband an I saw this place while looking for new places to eat in our area but at the time it was closed. So we decided this morning to go there and have breakfast and try it out. We were so glad we did. I had the cinnamon roll french toast which was amazing and he had eggs benedict which was also very good. We also had a side of the biscuits and gravy which I thought were great. The service was exceptional, always making sure everything was okay and our coffee cups were full. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.  With It's great food and exceptional service we will definitely be regulars here. So if you haven't tried this place yet I definitely say go what are you waiting for.

We stopped in early on Sunday morning for breakfast. Service was great, but they weren't too busy at the time we were there. Jamie was our server and she was wonderful! 

The food was very good for the most part. We split a cinnamon roll, and I think it's the best I've ever had! Gooey, soft and with tons of delicious frosting. I would recommend this. I ordered the apple french toast which was delicious as well. I had it with scrambled eggs and sausage (links) per Jamie's recommendation. I was not disappointed! My husband had the biscuits and gravy combo. His only complaint was that the hash browns weren't seasoned at all. 

It's worth mentioning that they have a rewards program. I'll definitely be back for breakfast!

We went there after planing a baby shower with my wife and mother -in-law. I ordered the first item on the Menu. A Biscuit and Gravy meal. The service was friendly, but when they brought the food I thought I had taken a trip to pre-prepared land. My sausage links we cut in half and over cooked . My Hash browns were in a rectangle (frozen and reheated like that) and my eggs were over coked in a hard circle. The biggest issue was they forgot the biscuit and gravy. The waitress said it to me as a after thought before she left, "did you have Biscuits and gravy?" Yes! She came back in less than a minute a dropped a tiny biscuit with only a little gravy on a plate and rushed away. The food made me sick. 

HEALTH CODE VIOLATION!!
The worst part of the whole visit was the end. As we were waiting to pay at the register, we watched two waitresses rolling forks and knives in napkins while eating (we watched one dip a fry and ate it and then wrapped a napkin, greasy gross). That is so unsanitary and against health code. Do they not realize that their germs are being passed to the mouths of every guest? Never going back.
Very cool place !! Has misters out side  had a good breakfast   That's my review thank you for reading!!!!:)

I am a corned beef hash guy and I know how hard it is to find good hash in a restaurant.  believe me, it's hard.  that being said, CBH is on the menu at Biscuits so I decided to try it.  let me also say that I rarely find that a restaurant's "homemade" CBH is anywhere close to as good as the stuff you can buy in the can.  Biscuits is no exception.  if all you want is a huge plate of food you will actually like Biscuits (in that respect it is very similar to hash house a go-go.  actually, both are equally poor on quality).  back to the CBH.  it's not really hash.  it's more like a pile of dried up shredded meat on top of some under-cooked, under-seasoned potatoes. truly gross.  after 2 bites I had had enough.  the server asked if I liked it and I said "no".  she laughed and asked if I wanted a box.  of course I said no.  I wouldn't feed it to my dog.  and, of course, she left it on the bill.  fair enough.  for that, I give my review and rating and promise to never set foot in the place again.

Thank goodness for a place in Surprise that finally has decent breakfast food. We've tried everywhere else and have always left disappointed. That was not the case when we went here yesterday. The cinnamon roll is out of this world! So good. The biscuits, contrary to many opinions on here, were actually very good; as was the gravy. Our server Carrie was amazing and the food came out quickly. The only downfall is that we felt it was a little pricy. Still, everything was good and we will definitely be back!

Best breakfast I have had in a very long time. The food was fresh and obviously prepared by caring hands. The staff and service was above and beyond. Watchi,g the staff interact with other patrons made me excited to make this a new regular stop. There are a lot of establishments in the area that could come by here and take some notes. Great job all around.

Short review:

It's an automatic fail when I come for breakfast and am there for at least 30 minutes and not once during that time did anyone come around to offer a coffee refill.  Not once.  

Longer review:

I saw Biscuits Cafe on Yelp and since it's close to home I decided I'd have to give it a go.  I wouldn't have ordered the biscuits and gravy combo but when in Rome... This is their signature, their biscuits.  The combo includes a choice of meat, I chose sausage, and two eggs any style.  I opted for over easy.

The order was done quickly.  I am not a connoisseur of biscuits and gravy.  In fact, I can't remember the last time I ordered this.  The biscuit was OK.  I'm not sure if it's supposed to be house made but I'm pretty sure it wasn't.  There was nothing special about it.  The gravy was OK, too, with a hint of ground pepper.  I'm certainly glad I didn't order the breakfast with two biscuits.  The sausage was two links that were sliced horizontally and grilled.  The eggs were done over easy.

All in all, breakfast was OK.  I should have stuck with an omelette or Benedict--my usual go to breakfast dishes.  But, I'll never know what they're like because I won't be back.  

When I paid at the register, the woman asked for my member number.  When I told her I didn't have one, she asked me if I wanted to join their club.  My answer was a polite no.

People, when you have three servers covering about 7 tables, it's not hard to bring a carafe of coffee around and offer warm ups or refills.  It should be something you dream about at night.  If one of your two specialties is breakfast and you fail on service for that, there's not much hope for you.

For a place called biscuits you would think that they would be outstanding.  I ordered the two biscuit plate and it was not very good.  

The biscuits were small and the gravy was flavorless. I have had bigger and better tasting biscuits out of a can.  

I will not be returning here when I come to Phoenix.

Stopped over here for breakfast with my family on our way to a Spring Training game and when we pulled up i saw that there was a lot of people waiting so I figured this place must be good. Waited about 30 minutes for a table we got seated and our waitress was good she has our drinks to the table pretty fast and she was officiant with our order. I ordered the chicken fried chicken and it was really good the biscuits and gravy were excellent and you could tell that all the food was homemade. Everyone enjoyed their food the table was big the restaurant itself was decorated nice I highly recommend this place if you are in the area.
We were Very disappointed! The Eggs were horrible, the pancakes bland.. Long wait for food, expensive.. On a good note-the bacon was good..Won't go back.
Large portions and good quality. Suggestion is to split a plate. Breakfast seems to be their specialty.

They old saying holds true.  Minimum wage earnings will give you minimum wage results. From watching the staff cough, sneeze...and not washing their hands once. . And the best I've never personally seen before. .staff is carrying food. Put there finger in the plate of food and LICK THEIR FINGER CLEAN AS THEY ARE CARRYING THE PLATE TO THE CUSTOMER!!! That's when i stopped eating.  Food was bland...potatoes boring and not seasoned.  I give this place 2 months at this pace. ..waste of time

This makes me sad the food was not good. I've been here a few times and they must have a new cook. The service was excellent but the food was not good I had the Mexican egg scramble and it wasn't good I posted a picture of this nasty mess. Not sure if I will be back

Sunday am breakfast   Excellent service from the minute we entered the door.  Server Amanda very attentive. Coffee hot and nice flavor they have flavored cream at the table which is a
Nice touch.  UnSweet iced tea had a nice balance of flavor sometimes restaurant tea is flavorless.  Very clean tables and floor.  Women's bath immaculate and spacious. Would recommend for sure and will be back.  We had the breakfast burrito and meat lovers scramble   The biscuits were piping hot and the berry compote tasty

Was seated right away, which was great! Friendly staff too. My coffee tasted old, it was very bitter. I then ordered the Florentine Benedict with potatoes. My food arrived and it looked presentable. Upon first bite, It was just barely warm and not hot enough. The taste was okay, yet could have been better. I was not impressed overall. 

My daughter ordered the kids macaroni and cheese. The food was unpleasant looking. The macaroni and cheese had melted cheese of course, but then it also had shredded unmelted cheese to garnish. I thought it was a bit odd. She was not to fond of the taste either. My son ordered the biscuits and gravy. He was satisfied with the taste of his food. His only complaint was that the biscuits were too small. He thought it was Odd being called "biscuits cafe" with small biscuits. 

While I was impressed with their employees, I was not impressed with their food. I think they can do better than they are currently doing.

We were super excited to try this place as the first time we went to try them they were closed. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and they weren't bad but they were to small. You would think for a restaurant whose name is "BISCUITS cafe" their biscuits would be a decent size. They weren't even the size of my palm. We also ordered the skillet and that portion was small as well. Unfortunately I don't think we'll be going back.

Almond encrusted french toast is the stuff dreams are made of! I can't stop thinking about it! Awesome service from Jen and Linda for our large party also. Thank you to the management for being so accommodating on a Saturday morning, they had a table ready and waiting for us!  This place is always friendly AND efficient and it is much appreciated! Good job guys!

We eat here regularly.  Food is ALWAYS great! The service is typically beyond reproach- until today.  Our male server didn't do anything wrong per se BUT he did not seem to really care about us.  I watched our food sit up on the "warmer" ( not sure what that area is called exactly) for about 5 minutes.  We waited almost 20 minutes for our food and our server only came by 1x to check on whether my husband wanted his coffee refilled. After our food was served we only saw him when he gave us the check. He never asked us how our food was, to refill our drinks, or to offer a to go container.  This is the ONLY time we have had a less than great experience ( hence the 4 stars).

Tried this place for the first time and was pleasantly surprised! Excellent food, I got the avocado Benedict and it was delicious, hubby got the two biscuit n gravy breakfast and it was some of the best biscuits n gravy I have ever tasted. Fast service, quaint atmosphere, only thing is there is zero alcohol, so no breakfast mimosa or Bloody Marys :-( But we will definately return, food is worth it!

Very open and spacious. Average crowd noise level. Very friendly staff. 

My first time here but I will definitely return. I ordered the CFS&E because that's all I ever order for breakfast. It came out in a timely manner and was very good!! Coffee was descent but would prefer stronger blend. The waitress was very friendly and attentive, Kellie was her name and she did a fantastic job in my opinion. 

I will say that the pancakes could be a little lighter. They very heavy so try the biscuits instead.

The cafe is large and very spacious. The service is GREAT. Since it's called Biscuits Cafe, I had to try out the biscuit. Since my chicken and waffles didn't come with a biscuit, I asked our waitress how much one biscuit would be because I want to try it out. She wasn't sure, but she said she'll just bring me one, and even asked what kind of jam I liked. Then later when I mentioned how delicious the raspberry jam was, she told me it was freezer jam and didn't have any preservatives. I don't like jam, but this was very good. I dipped my fried chicken tenders in it too. 

The chicken and waffle I had was alright. The chicken was overly fried and was hard, and the waffle was just a waffle. It was good food but wasn't amazing.

Everything else about this place is great. I would definitely come back to have breakfast/lunch with my friends!

I was on the fence about coming here based on previous reviews about the service. I am so glad I made the choice to come anyway. The service was prompt and friendly, even on a very busy Sunday morning. Now for the food. My guy got the Brisket Benedict. It was full of meat griddles to perfection on top of an English muffin. It also had perfectly poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce. It was served with a side of hash browns (you can also get red potatoes). It was a big enough portion to fill my guy up. I got the almond encrusted French toast. It was tasty. Crunchy on the outside, sweet and buttery on the inside. It came with good, thick bacon and eggs. I don't like eggs, so they happily substituted hash browns for me. It was a great experience and we will be back for more!

/: For a place named "biscuits Cafe" you'd think the were we something to the biscuits right? Well you'd be wrong like we were. We ordered delivery thru door dash this morning. I the ordered blueberry pancake meal that came with 3 huge pancakes with blueberries on top, 2 eggs and a side of a breakfast meat of your choice, I choose 3 strips of bacon. My fiance ordered the biscuits and gravy that comes with only one biscuit (add another for $2, we thought that was rediculous but maybe they were crazy sized biscuits or something) two eggs and a breakfast meat side, he added hash browns to his meal for $2.99. The hash browns were just bland. The gravy just wasn't very good at all. The biscuits are basic, small and unimpressive. The portions, aside from the pancakes, were small. The prices are rediculous for the portions. The pancakes were huge but they just sent some prepackaged syrup that was no where near enough for the amount of pancakes. I do not recommend this place and will not be ordering again.

I wish I could give this place ZERO stars, on Jan. 16 at 10 30 am we got typical arizonen service. Came in stood there for 10 minutes a white couple came in and then the hostess ran to the door to seat them. The only reason we were seated is because the couple asked if we were seated, "clearly we're not if we're standing at the door". The couple then proceeded to say they were regulars that's why they were being seated before us, WOW! So my wife and I realizing what just happened fit up and left.  So the moral of this story is do not go to this restaurant if you're not a regular and if you're a minority please stay away they treat you accordingly to the code. In 2017 wow, and fyi we went there every weekend since we've been in arizona, never again!

Never have I had pancakes that you have to cut with a knife. Service was very slow, our order went to the wrong table and then when they brought our food it was cold and sloped together. I posted a picture of dirty straws and a knife that was in our setup. Eggs were cooked perfectly, bacon crunchy, but French fries were under cooked and hardly any bacon on a BLT.  Ceiling fans were on high and uncomfortable with all that air blowing down on you as you ate. $30.00 for pancakes and a BLT, prices are high for the quality you get!

Just ate breakfast at Biscuits Restaurant in Chandler. This well developed and marketed brand helped determine which restaurant my family would go to after attending our monthly SGI Buddhist meeting. We have eaten at Biscuits on Dobson in Chandler and we're not impressed with the food but when this restaurant opened near our home we decided to go. Still not impressed with the food. This was the third time we ate here and we determined that this would be our last. First, the food is overpriced compared to other restaurants in the area. Second the service is inadequate because there are too many young part-time people holding down the fort. They don't even know what they don't know about the food service industry. Third, the food was not good. The potatoes were crunchy and under cooked. The pancakes were mushy and undercooked. The coffee was weak and watery. My well done English muffin was mushy and under toasted. After complaining to our waitress and manager all we got was an apology. No replacement, discount or raincheck. The only thing this restaurant provides is ambiance and branding. This is the one star. They have yet to live up to expectations as an upscale restaurant to justify the pricing. We suggest an overhaul in staffing that recruits higher-end restaurant management and servers. Until we recover from Biscuits mediocrity we will not be back.
Large selection and portions of standard breakfast and lunch fare. Food quality is good and tastes like breakfast should.  I have been here several times and have had great service.

Unfortunately the quality has gone down quickly. Great location, friendly staff but even their eggs are very watery, super low end quality. Our friends had pancakes that were under cooked and super tough from the cook over mixing the pancake batter. Love the to go cups for their coffee though.  Not sure if we'll be back.

Service was good food came out 'hot' which is always a plus! The strawberry jelly was freshly made it actually tasted like strawberries and not sugar! Awesome!!! I would eat there again...a little off putting that the waitress kept staring at the top of my head when she would one to the table. Maybe me think is there a bird on my head and you're not telling me...BUT the food was good especially the biscuits!!!
Crazy to see the bad reviews. I'm the pickiest diner I know and I love this place. Almond crusted French toast, omelettes and club sandwich are among faves. The coffee is super good too.

Awesome food! Yes it is a little more than Denny's but the portions you get are more than excessive. Be prepared and come with an empty stomach. After the massive and delicious cinnamon roll (homemade frosting was heavenly) I had their Biscuits omelette with a side of a sweet potato pancake. Everything was amazing, I couldn't put down my fork. Will definitely be going back and make it a regular spot!

We went here while on a visit to Phoenix. Stopped on a Sunday morning. Had about a 15 minute wait to get in. We split a Denver omelette and a side of bacon. The omelette was good, bacon good, and the service ok considering how busy it was. The strawberry jelly is fantastic! Not a bad value.

I love Biscuits Cafe!  The pancakes were huge and didn't taste like it came out from a box.  The sausage was grilled to perfection and packing with flavor.  I loved how they actually didn't break the over-easy eggs I ordered as well as food coming out hot.  I am glad they finally opened here and it provides a much needed breakfast place not named Denny's.

Awesome food, great service and very convenient. The biscuits & gravy are amazing. I like that there's not a lot trendiness in this place. No duncy kids in silly outfits catering to weirdo hipster wannabes, just cool people serving great food.

I never got to taste the food because the service was so bad that I left.  There is a sign that reads, "we don't serve fast food, we just serve food fast".  That couldn't be more untrue.  Our server was inattentive and slow. Maybe she was having a bad day;  I try not to hold that against people.  The restaurant was not packed, but was pretty active, but there were 4 servers, no reason for such slow service.  Then when the food finally came, they forgot my youngest son's food, and said it would be right out.  All servers bring out the plates there, so the person who brought our food was not our server, and although she acknowledged the missing food, she went on about serving her customers and not getting mine.  Our server made no effort to pursue the missing food, even when I asked her to look into it, she still went to other tables and took her time going back to the kitchen.  When she came out of the kitchen with empty hands, we got up and left.  Nobody made any effort to resolve our dissatisfaction.  The owner should be embarrassed of this service, or lack of service and corporate should be careful as to whom they sell their name to.  About a year ago, I read reviews of slow service there, and I should have heeded them today.  Will never go back.  If you decide to go, give yourself a lot of extra time, because there is no hustle in this establishment.

Service is good food is sub part. I ordered fish n   chips gf ordered huevos ranchers. My plate came with no lemon and a small portion of tartar sauce and fish was over cooked. Huevos ranger's was good but hash Browns were old and overcooked so definitely not made to order.  For the price food should be better. Will come back but not in a hurry

Nice addition to the Surprise area breakfast choices.  My wife and I had breakfast at Biscuits today.  The atmosphere is "modern industrial".  A bit noisy but, having a busy restaurant is a good sign. This is the only reason it gets a 4.  Not easy to have a quiet conversation.  We had their Apple Cinnamon French Toast Combo and Avocado Benedict along with a Cinnamon Roll.  The portions are really large next time we may consider splitting breakfast.  The French Toast Combo was fluffy and the custard base was excellent, not too sweet.  My wife's Benedict was filled with healthy veggies and perfect poached eggs.  Her serving of hash browns was ample and she shared a ton with me.  It's hard to find an interesting and good place for breakfast in Surprise; however, Biscuit's will be a place that we come back to for lunch and breakfast.  Our cost for French Toast, Avocado Benedict, Cinnamon roll and two coffees came to $33.12 with tax.  This is comparable to other restaurants in the area.

Well this is my 3rd visit so now I'll review, 1st time our food & service was excellent, 2nd time food was good all but scramble was over cooked and the server needed to brush up, she gave me Luke warm water for tea, ten I had a hair in my butter and nothing was addressed or adjusted for it. Then I asked for strawberry jam to go and she brought me mixed berry pre packed jelly.
3rd time Service good but food was bad. My soft scrambled eggs weren't soft and we asked for crispy hash browns and all that they did was partially cook it on one side, and they were greasy. My husband's omelet, meat lovers wasn't that enjoyable to him like before. We mentioned it to server and register person and no price adjustment was done this time either. I don't think we will return here until they get better

Great breakfast place, fantastic pancakes and french toast.  Great Service, everything was hot and fresh.  Also have been here for lunch their portions were large and very tasty had the turkey melt sandwich. Will definitely be back.
I definitely recommend the breakfast, the food was great. However,  it is a long wait 30 min before food came out. In addition,  the manager maybe owner was very gruff and made us uncomfortable.

This is usually a solid 5-star choice, but this morning we had a new waitress.  I asked for my eggs to be extra soft, even runny.  the waitress seemed to understand, but she brought out well done, rubbery eggs.  I reluctantly sent them back.  She wanted to take back my whole plate, but luckily I asked for a small plate for the return so that I could keep the other items.  Luckily, because it was more than 10 minutes for the new eggs to come out.  And...yes, they were cooked more well-done than the first set.  Another regular waitress came over and saw the 'situation' and offered to fix it...but my wife is almost done with her meal, so it is just something I need to live with today.  Oh well.

Ok I have been back to this restaurant several times since my initial review and I have to say this is my new fav breakfast place !! I have tried the French toast with eggs and bacon , the cinnamon roll French toast with eggs and bacon , and most recently the smoked brisket eggs Benedict.. That my friends is a knockout !! The hollandaise definitely wasn't from a mix or a can .. Run my friends and don't miss out on this treasure
Seriously best breakfast ever !!!!

Late breakfast today with the family.  We got a variety of items to try out this new to us place.
Service was great.  We came at a bit of an off time and there was no wait for a table.  We sat on the patio.  The table was very nice and shaded. 
We had the Biscuit omelet and it was very big and delish.  The whole grain toast and freezer jam were a nice accompaniment.  We even purchased some jam to take home.
We also tried the pancakes and French toast.  Both were very good.
The biscuits and gravy were decent but I didn't really care for the hint of oregano.
Next time we plan to try the cinnamon rolls.
My only request would be for them to add alcohol to their menu.  This would be a nice place to spend Sunday morning with a mimosa or Bloody Mary.

First off, this was a Sunday morning, wait times were about 10 minutes to get seated. Not too bad. Then the fun began. We got our drinks within minutes of being seated. Awesome. Then 15 minutes to take our order. Then 45 minutes to get our order. Inexcusable. They were fully staffed. They had more folks walking around looking at things rather than helping customers. They came by the table once to top off our drinks and once to apologize for the wait. When we finally did get our food, the eggs were undercooked, the ham and French toast were burnt, the pancakes were raw, and the potatoes were unseasoned.
