The kielbasa on the menu sounds as if it's homemade, don't let it fool you, I think they ran next door to the grocery store to get some. How disappointing. We ate because we were so hungry. We did not see our waitress again so we could not discuss these issues with her. There were empty tables around us so I can't believe they were so busy that they couldn't be attentive. When I discussed these matters with the kid working the cash register the only reply he had was 'sorry'. Wow! Poor service, long wait times, poor food. Not worth the hype. We won't be back.

Love me some breakfast foods.  I like the country benedict here.   The gravy is creamy,  salty, and thick.  It's not your usual gravy but still good.   The service is friendly and they have a loyalty program too.

The service was good, and the breakfast was good. However, I would not go back because when we were seated we were presented with dirty torn menu's.  No excuse for that lack of pride,  and it instantly made me feel the place was dirty.
What a great place food is outstanding got to see Jamie the waitress she is amazing if I could rate this place a 10 I would I will be back definitely

We saw Biscuits had opened here in Summerland and had to try it out. We love it in Phoenix. Came in on a Wednesday at 9am. Place only had 4 tables going so no wait. Waitress was on it and super friendly. Have to comment here on their coffee, hella good. I ordered Breakfast Tacos with Chorizo. Also some Crispy Bacon. This was a great breakfast and the Chorizo is excellent. Wifey ordered Biscuits and Gravy and she says it was damn good. 
Overall the place rocks and will return often.

What a total disaster ! Called from across the parking lot to see what the wait was for 12 people and was told 15-20 min. I said really ? Are you sure? She said yes we are very quick. We drive there LITERALLY across the parking lot and when we get there she says it's an HOUR wait ! WTF ?!

After we wait and are told we were next some IDIOT seats another large party AHEAD of us and WE were there FIRST !  THEN after we FINALLY get sat they took our drink order but left us waiting forever to take our FOOD order. After THAT we waited ANOTHER 25 minutes to get any food ! 

THIS PLACE IS A JOKE ! I'll NEVER come here again ! 

Thanks for TOTALLY screwing up Mother's Day breakfast ! 

We got here BEFORE 10 am and we didn't get our food until 12:18 pm !!!! On top of that my mom was the LAST person to get her food !!! 

The worthless manager didn't even bother to come and see how we were or apologize for the HORRIBLE experience we all had !
Decent food, very nice staff and a good atmosphere.  A welcome addition to Tempe's breakfast options.

Went there on a late Saturday morning. The place was fairly crowded and very noisy.  The restrooms were dirty along with the restaurant. The coffee was weak and didn't taste good. Ordered a country omelette with a side of biscuits. The biscuits were small and tasted like they come from a package.
Flies all over the place. One of the servers walked through the restaurant with a can of garbage. 
Very pricey for one meal. I will not be going back there and do not recommend this place.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places, the biscuits with the fresh made jellies are excellent. Everything I have had here I always enjoyed, much higher quality than Dennys without a price gouge.
The staff was friendly but I'm wildly disappointed with the food. I got my to-go order and it was just a bunch of mush.
A good breakfast close to home and they stay open a little later than many breakfast spots.  Good service too?

3 of us went yesterday for breakfast. 2 of us had the Almond crusted french toast ala carte. It was fantastic and the portion was huge. The almonds are ground fine, so your not crunching the nuts, and there is a slight hint of cinnamon. It was the best french toast we ever had. The other person had the Cinnamon roll french toast combo which came with 2 eggs and sausage links. He loved it as well. Service was great. The place is very nice, lots of great things on the menu. Can't wait to go back and try something else. I wish you had a location in the NW.

Chaz was a fantastic server!  He was incredibly helpful and friendly with my family of 4 (with two crazy kids). He assisted me in getting the biscuit burger. This thing was huge and delicious. When we left, the lady who helped us pay and later was very friendly as well.

The kids mac & cheese was the best macaroni and cheese I've ever had at a restaurant. The garlic bread that came with it was also some of the best.  My wife's fiesta salad was fresh and delicious as well. A true five-star place for breakfast or lunch.
Always a breakfast favorite, the homemade corned beef hash is delicious. Everyone is nice and they serve large portions.

Well, what to say about this place...the food was okay.  I really could have done the same thing at home and it would have tasted better and wouldn't have been so blah.  The one good thing was the cinnamon rolls...we took a half dozen home with us and they were absolutely amazing.  Also the prices were a little high for the food you got.  I might go back for the cinnamon rolls but for just a general breakfast, I'll most likely go somewhere else.

I came here a couple weeks ago and got the avocado benedict which was delicious. My husband got the country benedict which he also really liked. We didn't have to wait for our table and the service was fast. As we were leaving our waitress asked us if we wanted our coffee to go which we really liked. We will definitely be back!

My wife and I spotted this place a couple of week before, and decided to try it for Sunday morning breakfast. I read the reviews, and should have heeded the warnings. The location and setting were fine, but while the customers were mainly older, the wait were mainly younger and seemed disinterested. The menu looked good, but the biscuit and gravy were mediocre, at best. The gravy was congealed and the biscuit was unrecognizable. I asked for extra crispy bacon, but it was soggy, and had been sitting quite a while. Our waitress asked us once, near the end of our meal, "you guys need anything?", but otherwise was scarce. Another waitress went from place to place carrying on personal conversations with other waitresses, rather than paying attention to her tables. The prices were higher than most, the coffee was very good. Overall, I can't recommend this and we won't be returning.

Excellent food and great portions, you definitely get what you pay for.  The service was so fast our party of 5 was surprised when the food arrived!  From smoked brisket benedict, corned beef hash, chorizo omelette, french toast and eggs with a huge sausage and the egg white turkey scramble, it was all so delicious!  The fruit was amazing also, so fresh and quality fruit!!  We will go back for sure!!

Love this cafe! Now one of my favorite lunch/breakfast stops. Portions are large enough to share or box some up for later in the day. Have visited here for breakfast & lunch. The Reuben sandwich was delicious, not greasy or fatty. Shared the veggie omelet with a friend and substituted the cinnamon french toast as a combo dish, was especially thrilled the server did not respond with "sorry we don't substitute" - we both enjoyed the food & the service. Coffee is good too, had a variety of creamers.
There where flies everywhere inside. The food was not very tasty and neither was the coffee. The waitress was awesome though!

The overall environment of the place is great. Nicely decorated. The food was less than average. Skip the pancakes. They were inedible for me. They felt like cardboard and were very porous. The syrup just sunk in right through and didn't spread out on the pancake. Not appetizing-looking. 

My omelet (fresh Greek omelet) sounded delicious on the menu. Couldn't eat it though.... as there was a huge chunk of a plastic piece burned onto and mixed into my omelet. Didn't see THAT on the ingredients list! It was apparently the cook's spatula!!!! Not a pleasant experience. First and last time. The manager didn't do anything other than not charge us for the meal I didn't even eat! Ummm thanks? definitely won't be going back with that kind of disregard for customer service!

Love this place. I have tried their chicken fried steak, waffles, and biscuit specials. They were all great! Fast service. The staff make sure your drinks are always refilled. Our favorite morning place!!

Good breakfast and food. My food could have been a little hotter but overall good food. I had the eggs and kielbasa and the kielbasa is very flavorful. What I did love the most is their homemade strawberry preserves. I truly tasted like the freshest strawberries you ever ate. My husband had the country omelette with biscuits and gravy and he said it was all marvelous.

Really nice patio area.  In addition to patio dining area it appears there's a place to sit while waiting to be seated.  Another plus.
I was preceded by my son to the table so no clue how hospitable the host/hostess may have been.  Our waitress was timely and quite pleasant.  She used language that must work like subliminal messages because she seemed to convince me that I would enjoy my dining experience, even though it is not the same Biscuits I originally thought, and that I would be coming back here to dine again in the near future.
After me taking a lengthy period of time to decide what I was hungry for we managed to place our order.  I will say that our waitress checked in at least three times before I had made up my mind.  Another plus.  I've sat and waited at other restaurants because I wasn't ready to order when the server first came to take an order.
This girl was on task.
My coffee mug was never empty and my son's beverage got to no less than 1/3 full during our meal.
I ordered two eggs with rare bacon, red potatoes and a sweet potato pancake.  I asked if I could substitute the pancake and was told yes, but it would be one instead of two.  Heck, that's more than enough for me.
Son had the chicken fried steak with the hash browns and biscuits.  He said the hash browns were not good at all, even after salt & pepper.  I suspect the were over boiled cuz how else could they be bad?
My potatoes were good.  Creamy, nicely spiced and enhanced with a bit of onion.  My bacon was darn near perfect.  Thick, not excessively fatty and cooked to order.  Lots of places can't manage that last part.   And the sweet potato pancake was really good.  It was well flavored, dense and required no butter or syrup to enjoy.  A tad of butter and syrup seemed to transform my pancake into something more reminisce of sweet potato pie.  I shared it with my son and we got through about half of the thing.  He said the biscuit was light and fluffy in comparison.  A good contrast.
Overall, nice atmosphere, wonderful service and tasty food.  
We'll be back.

disappointing.  The location is awesome and we are always looking for good new food places.  We were seated quickly and our server all though friendly enough seemed over whelmed (aka under staffed).  I ordered a basic french toast combo (french toast, 2 eggs scrambled and bacon).  Long wait for the food.  My wife pointed out the sign that says they aren't fast food and everything is made fresh.  Well neither half appears to be true.  My french toast was soggy, my eggs cool and my bacon with limp and greasy.  My wife didn't complain about her food but I know she was not impressed.  You are better off going down the road a mile to the new Black Bear Diner.  Way better food, quality and service.  I will not give this place a second chance, sorry.

Great breakfast atmosphere and friendly staff! My wife and I came for breakfast and our server sat with us helping us to decide what to eat without being pushy. Large coffee cups with lots of different creamers to chose from. The price is very reasonable.

Been here a few times already.  Food is always great as well as the service.  Today I tried the almond crusted French toast.  Delicious! The atmosphere is very clean and modern.  Great place to have breakfast!

Meh, not so good. The place was clean and the service was good but the food not so much. I had the corned beef hash. It was fresh but it had huge pieces of corned beef and not hashy enough for me. The potatoes in the hash were crunchy not cooked enough. My husband had a Belgian waffle and sausage links. The links were cooked through but the texture was soft and mushy it felt like eating raw pork. My aunt had 1/2 sandwich and chicken noodle soup she said it wasn't anything special. Plus neither my aunt or husband like strong coffee and that is all they offer. You can't please everyone but that's why there is Yelp.

Came in for brunch. The host was really nice and sat us right away. Our waitress was totally annoyed with us and the table and chairs had food on them. Asked to get a towel and there was a total eye roll. We waited a long time to be served on but when the food came it was good. I would like to give it another shot but I would hope their wait staff would step it up.
Just so-so at the Chandler AZ location. Double the cost of a Waffle House , and half as good.
Pass on this. If I am going to load on carbs they better not make me regret it. My dish was not good. My husband did not enjoy his. Ok another place we would rather not spend money on

First off, AMAZING FOOD!
The portions are huge. Was put into a foodcoma after eating here! 
Emily was our server and she was very nice/sweet and professional.
My wife and I were very impressed with this place. This was our first of many visits for sure! 
The rewards program is pretty cool with all the discounts and points you get towards food. 
Highly recommend this place if you haven't tried it. Our food was our pretty quick too, so we weren't waiting long for anything. Our server checked on us and made sure we had everything we needed.

Super irritated with them. I've been coming here for a year and I've never had service that bad. Everyone working was super rude and we had one lady who was putting the silverware bundles together yell into the kitchen asking what I was waiting for even though she was 5 feet from me. I'm very disappointed.

My in-laws took us here for a late breakfast on veteran's day. We sat outside and were provided a friendly and timely waitress. I can't remember her name but she was very accommodating. 

I ordered the avocado toast, eggs, and a side of sausage. I'll be honest and say that sausage might have been bad because it was hurting my stomach all day. I eventually had to expel it from my body via mouth a few hours later. This doesn't happen often but when you know, you know. And it was the sausage that my body refused to digest. 

Aside from that, everyone else enjoyed their food. Not too much else to say about this place. 

They also do not support Veteran's Day meal deals FYI.

Great breakfast restaurant. Can't go wrong with the menu.. All yummy: French Toast, Pancakes, potatoes and has browns. Service was lovely. Only complaint: THE BATHROOMS!!! Only two bathrooms and a long line to get in. Kudos for making them unisex but after coffee,  only two stalls are not enough.
I love a great breakfast place! The coffee was so good! My omelet was gigantic and delicious. The prices were average for a diner and service was good. I'd definitely go back.

Running errands with the Fam and everyone is starting to get a little hangry. Driving down Bell and looking from side to side. "Hey!  We haven't tried Biscuits yet!"  Soooo glad we did!!!  I HAD to try the Almond crusted French Toast, it's what I do.  It was DELISH!  And now I have to go back and try the pumpkin pancakes and sweet potato pancakes. Hubby had the Brisket dip, Phillie style, and he really liked it and my daughter had biscuits and gravy, and wishes she would have ordered 1 more biscuit    We will definitely be coming back!  The service was perfect too. Very Satisfied!!!

The main reason I come to Biscuits is for the Wheat Montana Bread.  I grew up only a half hour from where this bread is grown and produced and being so far from home it's a little piece of comfort in a chaotic city like Vegas but the breakfast is FREAKING AWESOME

It's nice to see a menu that covers a broad enough range to make everyone happy. 

My group ordered our individual meals but shared family style so we could sample all this new place had to offer. Their corned beef was made in house and shredded. It was slightly seasoned and needed salt and pepper. I like that though since many times I have ordered and it was just too much salt.

They're sweet potato pancake was really good. Light and fluffy but not too sweet.  

My only real complaint is the gravy they use for their biscuits. It tastes more like a chowder than a gravy. It could use more sausage too. 

Our servers were great. They came by very 7-10 minutes and offered us refills for our coffee and even gave us a to-go cup when we were settling our bill. I was also surprised by how busy it was on a Monday morning.

I just came out of this restaurant actually today and the reason I decided to try it was from all the wonderful reviews I found here on yelp but guess what? After waiting for half an hour, our breakfast was no where to be found. There was no waiter who even asked us or checked on us. Finally, when the people seated behind me got their breakfast (they came way after we arrived), I asked one of the waitress what happen to our order? After waiting for another 10 mins, our waiter came back and said, "well we made a mistake, your order drop on the floor and nobody saw it so we are just ordering them right now". We cancelled our order, paid an $8 coffee and left. Suffice to say, NO, we won't be back!

I went here for breakfast on a Saturday morning, and it was a great experience. I really liked the layout and design of the interior. Everything was very new and modern. The food was great as well I had the veggie omelette and I enjoyed it. My girlfriend had eggs Benedict and she liked hers as well. Food came fast and service was above average. I will be going back

Sat down at 850; drinks came up right away from the man in a pink shirt, which might have been the manager. Great drink service.

About 15 MINUTES after; the waitress took our order, which didnt add up since there were around 5 to 6 servers for about 8 to 9 tables.  Food came out very quickly, which made up for the slow order taking.   

Update: the man in the pink shirt is the owner/manager.  He was very attentive and very willing to hear our feedback, which explain the fast drink service.  In addition, we found out the lady pushing her staff behind the glass was the wife of the owner.   Kinda like the urgency she enforce to her kitchen staff.   

I also love the idea of having an open kitchen where you can see everything that is going on behind the scene. 

My wife ordered the Joe's Special that was made into a burrito.   Excellent! 

I had the simply pick three, which was like everywhere else.   I did make the mistake of ordering egg whites and forgot to tell the waitress I wanted country egg whites and not from a carton.  Oh well.

My kids ordered the kids special.  Fyi, drinks are not included.  Buyer beware. 

All in all this place is very spacious, and does a good job in catering to their customers.

Called when we were less than a mile away to check on the wait. They wouldn't take our name for the list (understandable) but assured it was a 10 minute wait. We showed up less than 2 minutes later, get the kids unloaded from the car, walk in and they tell us it's a 50 minute wait. GRRRR.
I like the food but they need to work on their communication.

Their food is good but service is going severely downhill. Used to like this place. The wait time is long, while plenty of to go orders are constantly being filled, which makes the sit down customers have to wait longer. There is no excuse when poor service comes up, the women at the counter just state "We know, it's gotten bad".

Fabulous food with a fantastic price. The staff can't be beat! They are the best. They are very attentive and kind! I will miss them since I am moving to Texas. This is a restaurant I wish I could take with me.

Thought we were going to the place just called Biscuits so were a bit disappointed with no grits but the food was very good (had the benedict Florentine). Arrived at 7am on Saturday and they were still setting up and only had one waitress for the whole place. Not her fault but definitely felt the lack of an adequate number of servers.

Went for breakfast and it was not a good experience. when we went to pay first they messed up the receipt  and we where about to pay for other customers until we notice! The girl in the front was so unenergetic! She seemed like she hated her job completely! They made us wait almost 10mint to clear the whole mess! There was a bunch of people waiting in line . It was super awkward. they couldn't figure out how to split it that he end up only charging my friend!

Wife and I had breakfast Thursday morning. Kathy waited on us and she was excellent. Biscuits and gravy along with remainder of breakfast was extremely disappointing. Biscuits had to be cut with knife and seemed like Pilsbury Poppin Fresh Biscuits that were overcooked or sitting for quite awhile. Everything was cold. We will not be back.

Need a big farm style carb loaded breakfast...this is your place. Good biscuits and strawberry jam. I had the bacon and eggs and my friend had the country omelet ...very good but enough for 4 people...had to take home a box. Come hungry!

Great Food
Large portions
Excellent Service

Had a bacon omelette tons of bacon and the homemade jam was awesome. Smooth coffee and never was empty. The people workin there hustle and make sure your food is on time. I will never go anywhere else for breakfast for now on.

When I first looked at the menu, I thought the prices seemed a little high.  After getting and eating our food, I decided the prices were great.  The food was delicious and the portions were huge.

I order the chicken fried steak with 2 scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, and biscuits.  The steak was huge and was covered in sausage gravy; not just plain white gravy.  The hashbrown order was big.  The two biscuits were small and a little dry but came with plenty of butter and strawberry jam.  There were supposed to be two eggs but I would guess that I actually got four.  

My wife got the chicken tenders.  She could not finish the french fries and could only eat half of the tenders. 

Everything was delicious.  Except for the hashbrowns.  I ordered them extra crispy but they were just barely brown.  The cook did not use enough oil on the grill so the had sploches of brown with mostly pale, undercooked potato on the surface.  The server offered to have them re-done but that is never a good idea.

Speaking of the server, she was excellent.

Overall, an excellent meal.  I highly recommend them.  Just don't order the hashbrowns.

I went here for breakfast on Friday around 11:00 am. After standing in line for ~10 minutes to be seated (there were plenty of open tables) I was finally seated. For some reason it also took the same amount of time for me to receive my beverage. Twenty minutes later I recieved my food. 

I ordered the French toast and berries with no whip cream. The food came out with a giant dollop of whip cream. The bacon was really good. Eggs were over cooked. The worst part though, was the berry mix. It was all still frozen. The larger berries were rock hard. For the price and wait I would at least expect fresh fruit. 

When the bill came it totalled 19.xx for an ice tea, French toast, and frozen berries. 

I won't be back.

Breakfast was delicious as usual. The sweet potato pancakes are really good ! The turkey and cranberry sandwich along with the soup were just right. The reason for the 3 star rating is because we were sitting next to a manager of some sort for the restaurant when the cook comes out in chef pants and chef shirt just beyond gross. It's only 11am he can't be in that soiled of clothing at this time of day. It was like he had worn those clothes for two days. Very displeasing to see in a place where the service and food are good. A dirty clothed cook makes you wonder what the kitchen is like.

Not sure what all the hype is about. I ordered huevous rancheros. It was cold and tasted like it came out of a can. I ordered crispy potatoes, they came crispy on the outside and barely warm on the inside. Not exactly what I was thinking. We also had the cinnamon roll, barely had any cinnamon ( like I couldn't taste it at all) and way too much lemon in the icing. 
All that said I will be back because the service was top notch, they listened to everything I said, took the cold meal off our bill and the manager came out apologized also.

Posted a tip with more details but we were very pleased with everything. Food good and we'll cooked, good coffee,  good service. Biscuits and gravy were awesome - not southern style fyi. We'd come back for sure.  We came on a Saturday around 9am for reference.

I generally do not eat breakfast but decided to go for it on my birthday.  What a great find.  Had the Avocado Benedict and added ham to it.  Food cooked to perfection and my server, Theresa was just great.

I did not think the biscuits were that great.  I think if you are going to name your restaurant after a particular food, it must meet expectations of wonderful.  The biscuits, although good, were small and not wonderful.  Service a bit off, but understandable because they just opened.  The chorizo omelet was great but biscuits and gravy not so good. It tasted like an accidental pepper overload.  Thus, the place is good but not amazing.  Just ok.

When I walked in, I thought the restaurant was decorated very nicely.  There were quite a few customers for a Tuesday morning.  They offer loaves of bread and cinnamon rolls for purchase.  I ordered the biscuits cafe omelet and almond crusted French toast with hash browns.  The omelet and hash browns were just okay, but the French toast was really good.  They have a good variety of options and I'd like to try the restaurant, again.  The waitress was very nice.  She checked on me often and helped me decide what to order.  The only unfortunate part was I didn't receive my food for over 30 minutes so I had to eat quickly and ask for my French toast to be boxed up since it wasn't ready before I needed to leave.  The young man who worked the register also apologized for the wait on food.

I'm kicking myself for not eating here sooner. I've been hearing great things about this place from everyone I talk to in Surprise. I drive past it all the time. From the second we walked in we were greeted and seated immediately. Right near the door we're the cutest coffee mugs for sale and I love my coffee so I told myself I could not leave without adding it to my collection. The atmosphere is inviting with Great Wall art and sayings. Our waitress was awesome and our orders of coffee and juice were brought out quickly. The place was busy for a weekday and everyone seems to be enjoying their food. I decided on a chorizo omelette. I can not even explain how great it was. The present was awesome. It came filled with beautiful green peppers, onions, cheese, ground chorizo, and avocado. So much flavor, and so HUGE. It also came with a choice of hash browns or country potatoes and a side of toast or biscuit. I chose the hash browns and toast. I couldn't even eat the hash browns because I was so full from the omelette. The toast came with the yummiest jam. My coffee stayed hot my entire meal and true to my word I left with a new mug. Will definitely be back with the entire family.

Average food. Inhospitable  hostess.  We were expecting outstanding food based on other people's recommendations.  First person we see (hostess) is extremely rude!  I will point out our waitress was really nice and provided good service (hence the 2 stars).  The food was so blah, that I wouldn't recommend this place. There are so so many other great breakfast places close o this area.
Very good breakfast. Biscuits are yummy and red potatoes very tasty. Served with lots of bacon

I have to start off this review by saying that I love breakfast. And when it comes to breakfast, there is only one Place that truly hits all the marks. I just wanted to put that out there first.

This is a joint that has been on my list for some time. Today was the day.

I can't say that I have any outright complaints, but I do need to mention that for a place called biscuits, some people expect BISCUITS. I got them, and they were delicious; but man they were TINY. C'mon now.

I also had the corned beef hash and eggs. The Hash was a little...different that what I'm used to, but it was good! The potatoes were really well seasoned and tasty.

Mom is simple and her cheese omelette with wheat toast was solid and delicious.

Wife had the pulled pork and she loved it.

There was one real highlight to our meal: the JAM. IT was strawberry and it was freaking phenomenal on everything. I ate my leftovers with a spoon. So good.

The service was good, but not exceptional. No complaints.

Overall, I will definitely be back, but it's not going to knock any other Place off the top of my list, either.
We went for the first time on Wednesday. Food was great! Waitress was great and they have the best hot chocolate! Will definitely be going back.
Food was good. Price seemed ok. I like ihop better. I didnt like sitting on the wooden park benchs they had inside. But, the waitress was nice and it had a nice vibe.

I'm rather surprised by some of the reviews because I thought this place was great! My friend had the vegetable scramble and today is my cheat day, so I had the cinnamon roll French toast. It was yummy! And the service was fabulous! We sat outside cuz it's such a beautiful day. The outside eating area could offer more ambience, but it was clean and the service was still good out there. My friend and I were happy to find a new breakfast place!
Great location. Service was good.  The food not so much. Potatoes weren't cooked right, biscuits small, waffles not crispy enough to my liking.   Prices but high for casual neighborhoods restaurant.
Food is not good. Everything taste bland, if it's not bland it's drenched in butter or salt. Not a fan.
Yum super cheap and cool decorations. There aren't many breakfast places here in Tempe, which makes this place all the better. Great service and huge portions!

This place is horrible.10.50 for a lunch menu
The food was like it came out a box.if you think this place is a bargain or at all good you need to get out more often.i ordered the Mac n cheese and it really looked as if it came out of a box and a few foofy thing all over it.after I sent it back I just ask for a soup.im writing this cause I've since been sick all day and it's now 11:30 at night and I'm violently ill.my son ordered the fish and chips and neither him are I are a that picky.he took it home and threw it away.long 
John silvers has bigger and crispier fish that that place.this is Vegas where we know between good and bad food.and this place is bad.i never get this sick from food but here I am.RUN THE OTHER WAY!

I had no idea this place was a total sit down restaurant. I thought you could grab and go.

Food was okay. Pricing is extremely high for what it is. I think they are catering to being next to Midwestern Med school. 

Portion sizes are very large. I got the chicken and waffles. I do not recommend their chicken strips! 

Overall- meh

This is exactly the kind of breakfast place you want! The place is named Biscuits so I was pleased when the biscuits lived up to my expectations. The strawberry preserves are heavenly and could (and should) be spread on anything you can find! The sausage gravy on my chicken fried chicken was thick and flavorful. Finally, the eggs were a perfectly cooked over-easy. If this place wasn't a five star breakfast spot before, it became one when they brought out complimentary chocolate covered strawberries! 

I'll be back here very soon!

Very friendly and clean little cafe. Service was excellent.
Food was good, fresh, came out quickly.
I had the half Turkey Sandwich w/cup of Tortilla Soup.
Soup was excellent.... very nice flavor!
Sandwich was also very good... very generous amount of turkey, lettuce, tomato, mayo on wheat. 
My husband had the BLT.... his sandwich was great!!!! I stole a bite and wish I had ordered the same!
The bacon was again very generously given, nice and thick and crispy! Yummy!!!

Went here for the first time with my mom yesterday for a Sunday brunch. We went there around 12:30 and it wasn't too crowded--we got seated immediately.

I had a hankering for corned beef and hash, so that's what I ordered. Unfortunately it wasn't quite what I was expecting...at other brunch places I've been to, the corned beef and hash browns are cooked and served together, but here the corned beef was served with scrambled eggs on top, and the hash browns were on the side. I was a bit disappointed by that.

Other than the disappointing food, everything else was great. Service was prompt, our food came out quickly, and our server stopped by our table multiple times to inquire about our meal.

This place is great for breakfast, super nice and clean location with great service and huge portions. We came Saturday morning at 9:30 & it only took 10 minutes to seat us. The food is really spectacular also. I had the bacon & eggs, pancakes, waffles, & now the chorizo omelet (all great). The hash browns are awesome, and even the country potatoes are cooked on a grill (not deep fried!!). Next time I come here I'm splitting my meal.

Not thrilled with the waitress or the food but the Custer service at the register was amazing. She actually cared about our experience and assured me if we try it again it will be better. We will find out!

With a name like Biscuits, I felt compelled to stop and try it out. I'm glad I did. 

This is a huge diner open for breakfast and lunch. I had the "one biscuit and gravy" combo with gravy on the side and hash browns. The hash browns were a little bland but everything else was delish. The biscuit was fluffy, eggs were good, and thick sliced bacon - that's automatic love. I'm not big on gravy so I didn't try it, but it looked well seasoned. 

I ordered hot tea as a beverage and loved the assortment that they served. It's a rarity to be offered a selection but it is greatly appreciated. 

The waitress was lovely and the food was served pretty quickly. The location is great and there is plenty of parking as it is in a shopping plaza. 

I would definitely come back again. Sometimes these lesser known restaurants are a nice departure from the chains. Very peaceful, quiet atmosphere.

I'm sad to give this place a 3 because it looks like it has potential and the other ratings were so good, which is why I decided to give this place a try  .
They sat us down very fast and tried to take our order right away which was good but when I asked for a couple of more min our waitress forgot about us and didn't come back for about 20 min and then our order was wrong she states she didn't hear that she asked to remake but they took very long to make it that we decided to pick out at it, and she never check back to make sure we were ok and coffee topped off! I had to waive her down Lastly because the portions are big we got To go boxes and no bags! Sadly I would not recommend this To my friends and family nor would I come back. Food was comparable to IHOP and Denny's

Tried this place out this morning because it's so close to my house....I have not ONE complaint!  Friendly service, nice atmosphere and my breakfast was perfect in flavor AND presentation.  So impressed!  I ordered the almond & cinnamon encrusted French toast with over-medium eggs and a (hefty) side of thick, UNBELIEVABLE bacon.  Three slices, not two.  The other 2 people with me agreed that this classic cafe is fantastic and we all will return soon.  Don't think twice, just GO!!  :)

10 minutes to get our drink order.
10 minutes to get our food. 
10 minutes to get silverware.
10 minutes to get our check.

Food was okay. Came out cold...  Was even colder by the time we got silverware.

 It's breakfast... Nothing special to set it apart from other breakfast joints. All the wait times don't help it's case. You can't have just good breakfast and bad service.

i dont give out a five star to easily.... here's the low down... PROS: Excellent service. ..fresh  homemade food  (i had the chic fried steak amazing) Delicious  homemade  jam  ..Best biscuits and gravy in valley (could almost pass as my own). The coffee is flavorful not watered down chicory. CONS: Serving portion could be your next 3 meals with a price tag to match.

First time, great service from Elizabeth. She made us feel welcome, was attentive but knew when to not approach which I appreciate. Food was good, I had the French toast combo, the BF had the Country Fried steak. We will definitely rerun.
The portions are good and most of time I can't finish my plate since I always order with my eyes. I have never had a bad experience here and it's one of my go to spots for breakfasts.

Worth the wait for your food. Presentation is just how it tastes, Great! Personal fan of club sandwiches. Serve was friendly. Roommate got the veggie omelet and loved it. Can't go wrong with their house made biscuits with butter and jelly.

Pancakes are DELICIOUS!  Portion sides are hardy and huge!!  Homemade Corn Beef Hash was flavorful with red potatoes spiced just right!  Best of all the Biscuit and Gravy Wow Gigantic serving-Definitely a must order when coming here! Extremely  friendly servers and wait staff.   Looks like they have a steady flow of regulars including one WWII veteran who was known by staff and welcomed in this friendly establishment!  Family owed and we will be back!
This place is amazing!  Little pricey, but worth every bite. Try the cinnamon rolls!

This place is just awful. The first time I came and sat outside and the wait staff was rude and cold-especially the hostesses when I cashed out. I had opted for a healthy option on the menu but it came out with cubed processed meat and was so gross and flavorless.
The next time went a year later and decided it probably was a place that I should order biscuits and gravy and bacon and eggs. This Tim I opted for take out, and since I live around the corner, I got there pretty quickly. The hostess this time was WAY nicer, but when I got home my gravy was cold and not at all good-bland!!!
The potatoes I ordered "extra crispy" were so undercooked I had to fry them in my own pan for ten minutes! 
The bacon looked like it had been from a cafeteria  and was very chewy instead of crispy. 
This place will not be getting a third try from me. Driving the extra distance to Black Bear is worth it!!!

Food is great. Service slow. 
Complained to waitress and was told owner to cheap to hire more people 
I told her they will lose more customers
We waited 15 minutes to place order
Owner needs to fix this problem
We feel bad for employees

Couldn't wait to try this place. Not sure why they call it Biscuits, the ones they served were small and dry. I expected great food on Big biscuits, far from it. I was extremely disappointed. The Chicken Fried steak i got was a mass produced frozen patty that they deep fried. Come on guys, any crappy restaurant can do the same. How about some real home made food, especially for the bold pricing of your product. The prices were Very high especially for breakfast. We both ate a breakfast and the bill was almost $40. They also charged me $2.50 for having my gravy on the side, which they never told me and just stabbed me with it on the bill, thats atrocious. Shame on them for doing that. When i said something to the girl cashing me out she said, "thats how it is sir, its considered a side". I told her that should have been discussed with me when ordering, gravy still comes with the meal. I got less gravy in the small bowl then they would have put on the meal itself. I will never be back. This place is a glorified fast food joint. You can get a better breakfast at Golden Corral for $8. Sad, another crap restaurant in Surprise.

My husband and I came here for breakfast based on it's 4-star Yelp rating.  The staff was nice but it took forever for our order to be placed.  When our food arrived at the table 25 minutes later, it was less than average.  Fast forward 30 minutes and now we're feeling sick.  Bummer!

When it 1st opened it was like a secret place but it seems to be getting busier. We love it here--good and consistent. If we bring the pups and sit outside, they are very accommodating to us. Wish the outdoor was bigger and more shaded, enjoy sitting out. Everything I've ordered has been good. Great price and portions. Close to home. Biscuits and strawberry jam is sooo good. Yes the biscuits are small but, who cares, they are good. One day we had an extra long food wait so our waitress brought us out biscuits and jam to snack on--great service!

Very good food, it's a shame I did not get to enjoy it. 

I arrived an hour before closing on a Sunday and got my favorite scramble!  I looked around and remembered buying something on the counter last time I was there , but didn't see anything this time. 

After my meal arrived, I saw an employee pushing a cart out from the kitchen area. The bottom shelf was full of their muffins. They have several tasty flavors, but it seemed like they were more anxious to get out if there than making these available to the customers that were still coming in. 

After my eggs, I started on the pancakes I got as part of the meal. My iced tea needed a self refill from the fountain drink area, but the brewed iced tea containers were already gone. 

When they started sweeping out from under part of the table I was still seated at, I realized that I better find another new early afternoon venue for Sunday brunch.

A new and nicely appointed breakfast/brunch/lunch spot.  You walk up to order and then they bring your food out to you.  The food was okay.  I got a meltz sandwich.  The bacon was quite good; but I found the sandwich a little damp with melted butter.  They give you a chocolate covered strawberry, which is a cute little touch.  The prices were reasonable.  I would eat here again.

Well, I went back.  I gave Biscuits a second chance. I was seated and given coffee.   Once again I sat there for over 10 minutes and was ignored.  I tried to get a waitresses attention, but it didn't work.  There were only 5 tables with customers.  I counted 5 waitresses, and some of them were talking about non work related issues.  When some new customers were greeted when they came in, I interrupted and said that I had been waiting and no waitress.
Once I got someone and gave my order, my food came fast.
I went online and no email for customer service.  They want you to join their club, but they don't want to hear from you.

I just can't hold this back any longer.  On Tuesday 8-8-2017 my wife and I went to Biscuits for a nice breakfast.  At least that's what we thought.  My wife order scramble eggs, Hash browns and pancakes.  Hash browns were so hard you could use them for shingles on a house.  Pancakes were terrible.  As for me I order three eggs over easy.  One egg was over easy, one medium and the other was broke and hard.  Hash browns also could go on the roof.  Orn juice was good. I'm done with this place.

I'm on vacation in Phoenix and I've been here everyday. The food is so good! I get the joes scramble. They're so good about substitutions and happily accommodate to almost any dietary need. I exchanged my eggs for egg whites and the bacon in the scramble for turkey bacon. The manager, Zach greeted me every day and was very attentive!
Oh and the biscuits! I had 4 biscuits everyday. Also, no other breakfast restaurant I've been to has better jam. Their strawberry and Marion berry jam is incredible. Not your average smuckers packets.
Anyway, 5 out of 5 stars. Thrill ride of the century.

Always get in quickly on any weekend. The food is great and never leave disappointed. The staff is hit or miss when it comes to servers. I have had some really great service and other times I have had to wait 20 minutes to have my bill brought to the table.
Best French toast ever, my daughter loves the blueberry pancakes. Excellent customer service, you can tell this restaurant is well managed and they pay attention to the details. Five stars...

been here 2xs now.  first time was good had the Reuben sandwich. I liked it. there is a worker that tried to clean my table 2xs as I was still eating. dude chill... 2nd time came and had a scramble with chorizo... I have to say the servers even though some are new are all very nice and effective.  the strawberry preserves they give with the biscuits and toast is the bomb.  I will come again for sure.  nice to have a place like this in the west vally.  atmosphere is a tad loud for me but it's ok with the open style.

This place was so busy!  Because this part of town needed a new/additional breakfast place.  It's not fancy but it was new, cute, clean.  And we loved the food.  Service was great even on a very busy Sunday.  5 of us ate for cheap and we loved it.  It didn't take long to get seated either because this is a decent sized place.  I definitely would recommend it, and I will go back, even if they are busy.
I love coming to this cafe but they seem disorganized and slow.  The  food is good but seems expensive for the serving size.  I hope they get organized quick or I will have to find another cafe.

The food is above average but the management brings the score way down. I walked in today and they had the poor busser girl also sitting all of the guests and she was also in charge of running the cash register at the front because they don't allow you to pay from your table. So I waited both to be seated and to pay because the busser girl was busy handling all her other roles. The manager ended up sitting me and ringing me up because she was so happy. Maybe not hanging out in the kitchen so much would be better? They seem to have an emphasis on getting the food out quick which is probably why the manager is in there a lot but if it's not hot and you have to wait to get seated, wait for your server to bring your receipt so you can wait at the counter doesn't seem to be a receipe for success.

Friendly staff with a large dinning section compared to a Egg Works.  The Cinnamon Roll French Toast was really good.  The Country Benedict was also really good however the eggs and hash browns were I felt average at best.  The pricing is on par for the service and quality of food.

Really good food! Really good service and huge coffees. 

I ordered the pick three, which is great for anyone since it offers options of a little bit of everything. I opted for eggs over easy, dry sourdough and strawberries that came with whipped cream (cream not mentioned on menu though). It was nine bucks. The toast came with strawberry preserves she referred to as freezer jam. It was excellent. The eggs were cooked perfect and the toast was good. 

He got this black sausage plate and oatmeal. I was not impressed. He liked it. The oats were weird. it came with bags of nuts and dried fruit. It was like a brick. Needed liquid. 

The coffee is good, huge and good. Lots of creamer options/flavors too. There is a patio that is dog friendly and the staff is great.

The atmosphere is a little loud and very open but inviting. I wish it was more sectioned off. That's my taste though. 

I would be back...the only weird thing other than the oats is the biscuits are so small and underwhelming. The place is called Biscuits Caf√©...maybe it should be called Jammed Caf√© or Cinnamon Roll Caf√© since those are something to talk about!! Must get one of them rolls next time as there will be a next time :)

Second time going back after trying it a few months ago. I like to give time for a place to mature after it opens and do a recheck. In this case, much the same - the place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food is okay. I had the Southwest scramble and I have to say, surprisingly bland for something with Chorizo in it and though I appreciate the bell pepper and onions, I would recommend dicing them up a bit versus having them in strips.

As for coffee, decent drip diner coffee but I would like a mug versus a huge hot drink cup. Another diner noticed the same thing - a mug allows one to have a reasonable amount of coffee and then fill it up again so it stays hot. In addition, the little hot cup protection ring should be over by the coffee as you fill up the coffee in one place and then have to carry it over to where the hot rings are, and the creamer and sugar, and it is hot! 

The hashbrowns looked great but they use some sort of buttery spray when cooking them and it is an off flavor in a hashbrown. In addition, the insides of the hashbrown are somewhat starchy - if they dice their own potatoes I would recommend they wash the shredded potatoes to remove the starch. 

Oh, I did like the chocolate covered strawberry, that is a nice touch. Other than that, I truly wish I liked Biscuits more as it is a close walk from my house. Hopefully I'll try it again and change my mind.

Service was great but the food left a lot to be questioned!  Very high priced, bacon obviously cooked way prior and hard dried out, gravy had little flavor, and biscuits?? If your a biscuit cafe you would think it would be big, fresh fluffy biscuits right?? Nope! Very disappointed and when you charge 34.00 for 2 eggs, biscuits gravy and potatoes with 2 drinks, it better be damned good.

Won't let me do no stars.  What the hell is wrong with this place?  Service was terrible.  Food was cold.  Don't waste your money.  Go to the Hangar Cafe at the Chandler Airport.  Good food and a staff that makes your breakfast experience great.

I've been here a total of 3 times now and I'm still kind of feeling mixed about this place.  

The food has been really good, but for a good breakfast joint, their coffee sucks!  I've gotten something different during each visit and enjoyed more everything except for the red potatoes side dish, which always seems to be kind of cold. 

The first time that I went there, we were rushed and no offer for refills of coffee at any point.  Servers started mopping floors while we were finishing up food and then when going to the restroom before leaving, I almost got hit in the eye with a mop handle.  

On the second visit, it took a really long time to get food.  I mean, a really long time.  After two awkward experiences, was hesitant on returning. 

On the last visit everything seemed to go well.  It was well paced. Got coffee refills, even though the coffee wasn't great and didn't have to deal with mops.

My girlfriend and I had a $10 gift certificate from another Biscuits location which wasn't honored here. That's not ideal customer service, but it's forgivable.

What's not forgivable eggs Benedict with poached eggs that already have been broken, leaving the "grilled" English muffin drowning in yolk and far too much hollandaise. The entire mess was much too salty, and the hash browns appeared in an odd block shape.

The coffee lacked any semblance of flavor. My girlfriend's bacon was burnt, and her Belgian waffle honestly could have come out of a toaster.

The upside: Our server was fast and friendly. Seating was easy to find, and Biscuits was open for breakfast on Memorial Day.

I was excited to try the biscuits and gravy because when you have biscuit in the name of your restaurant it must be good, right. Wrong... The biscuit was doughy and the gravy was bland. I ordered the meat lover scramble which was good and my wife ordered an omelette with a side of pancakes. The pancakes were the best part of our experience here.
The menu and table were sticky and the cups had a film around the edge.
I agree with the other reviews about being overpriced. Two meals with no drinks $30, way too expensive. Dennys probably would have been a better choice.

I went here for lunch. I see that they have awesome reviews for there breakfast maybe next time i would try that instead. 

Today i ordered there chicken tender platter. Simple and easy . The fries were good, the chicken i was not a fan of... The batter was very flakey and pretty much just fell off and the chicken its self was fully cooked but kinda chewy it was strange... In addition to that the chicken also tasted  like it had a fishy taste. Not sure if they are fried in the same oil. I hope not becasue # 1 i personally dont like fish but i know some people who are very allegic to fish so i just hope thats not the case and it was a weird flook. 

Besides the chicken i didnt like, the resturant was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I liked that i got a chocolate covered strawberry with my order. There soup and sandwhiches looked very good as i saw other orders coming out so i would be willing to comeback and try something different on the menu. 

Overall just ok at best but I will give it another try with different menu items next time

This is a GREAT spot for breakfast!  Ordered the Corned Beef Hash, they offered sliced tomatoes in place of the eggs, biscuits and hash browns.  Let me start by saying...get the hash browns with the Corned Beef hash!  The Biscuits were hot, fresh and so light and fluffy.  Even after 5-6 minutes of sitting on my plate when I opened one up you could still see the steam coming out.  Service was good, food came out quickly, staff was very friendly.  The room is big, clean and has a nice homey feel to it.  Place was packed at 10:30 on a Friday morning, they offered me a hot tea to go after serving my first one in a huge mug.  I am definitely going back...something good for everyone!

Bomb! Everything's about 10 but worth it and if you don't eat it all you get 2 for 1 since it's a lot. You get a chocolate covered strawberry with your meal as a nice touch on top of that homemade jam which they should bottle and sell. I'm not a breakfast fan in general but yum!

One of my favorite breakfast places in North Phoenix. The service is great and the food is fast and fresh. The quantities are kind of big but still delicious. This place has great service for being a bustling breakfast joint. I've been here several times and I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes. Definitely would recommend as a great breakfast place.

So excited about the new Biscuits Cafe we have now in Surprise. Have eaten there twice. Once with a large group.  Wonderful service, food OK.  Had the 3 choice. Scrambled eggs and fruit great.  Biscuits kinda on the dry side.  The strawberry jam they serve with the biscuits is the best!!!  Second time I had pancakes with the wonderful Oregon Strawberry jam.  Service again was very good.  Our biggest problem , and I have heard this from other people who have tried them the biscuits are not great, very dry.  If you are gonna call yourself "Biscuits" they should serve awesome, flaky biscuits.

Really good homemade tasting food. Pancakes were so light and fluffy and yummy. I would say the same prices as the ihops junk but waaay better. I use to go to the good egg but no longer this is my breakfast spot now

Terrible. Stay away.  If your business name is BISCUITS - please have the courtesy to MAKE YOUR OWN.  Don't microwave a quarter sized rock and call it a biscuit.  Food is terrible!  We had to have our creamer for coffee cleaned as it was full of ketchup.  Nothing fresh.  Nothing good.  Take your franchise and start over.
The food is really good here.  Unfortunately, the management and service is horrible.  Very disorganized and the manager seems clueless.
Great food and service. A bit on the pricey side for breakfast but will return for the quality.

Has potential, but left a lot to be desired. 

First off, when you walk in, if during peak times it can be a little intimidating and off putting.  It is literally chaos as patrons are trying to pay at the counter while others are searching for some guidance on where to check in for a table.  It's a small entrance and needs revamping ASAP.  After a quick mental recap of the movie DaVinci Code I was able to decipher where one needs to check in.  I imagined the wait would be long, but to my pleasant surprise they do move quick. Was seated  within 10 min or so. 

Once seated you can clearly tell they may have been understaffed. The servers were doing their best, but it did take a while to get acknowledged and out our drink order in.  He was apologetic once he arrived and promptly took our order. 

I ordered the Southwest Delight ( egg scramble with spicy choose, onions, and bell peppers) came with hash browns and choice of toast, biscuits, or pancakes. I chose the pancakes as to me that is the baseline for all breakfast places.  Well the scramble was bland for being chorizo and a little soggy. The pancakes were very dense and slightly above say a Denny's pancake.  Seemed the batter was over stirred for those that know what I mean. A little on the tough side.  The GF ordered the Turkey Scramble and again very soggy like drenched in excess liquid and she got a side of biscuits which again seemed like they over kneaded the dough and had too much flour.  So far the best thing I had was the coffee.  

Once your done you pay up at the front. Which means having to tackle the gauntlet that is the death match of trying to pay in a line mixed with incoming guest looking to sign in and guest looking to pay.  Literally took me 10+ min of standing there while they sorted through the mess. 

While this place has potential and is slightly better then say the good egg. Can't say it would be by go to choice to return unless convenient. 

Really wish I could give half stars as this experience was a solid 2.5 stars.

I thought this place was amazing. We went in for a late weekday breakfast and were seated immediately. Many things on the menu looked good, I had the almond French toast, and it was incredible, but very sweet. My wife had a four (!) egg Greek omelette that was also very good and absolutely stuffed.  Servers were very attentive. Prices were about $10 per entree.
Descent breakfast menu. Large mug for coffee. Fast service.

Was not happy with food, biscuits tasted like they were  from the can, Potatoes had way to much seasoning, had to send back the egg's and the pancakes just tasted nasty..  There is one thing that tasted good and that was there jam....
Always delicious! Great service too. This is a local go to joint for breakfast. And their biscuits and jam are da bomb!

Tried out this new place today.   Looks good from the outside and the interior/atmosphere was decent.  Service was not all that great and the food was ok.  Not bad but nothing to write home about.   Overall a 2.5/3 on the scale.

I walked in to Biscuit's Caf√© after discovering Boston's had closed.  For an order at the counter place I was really impressed with the quality of the food and the attention to detail.
The portions are HUGE, I order the  1/2 sandwich and soup and could barely finish it. The second time I did  1/2 sandwich and a side and had the same experience.

The bacon and turkey on the sandwich each time was delicious. The meals were served with a pickle, a pepperocini AND a chocolate covered strawberry. If you order the special of the day you also get a chocolate chip cookie the size of your face. 

Lunch was served fast and they have tropical China Mist Tea. I will be adding Biscuit's Caf√© to my regular lunch rotation!

Oh yeah, join the FREE rewards club for all sorts of free stuff!
Chicken fried steak and freshly baked cinnamon rolls were delicious! Great service! We'll be back!

Alright, I was pretty impressed with this place the first time 5 months ago.  Since then I have gone back because of that and even bringing others here.   Now I have changed my review because they have continually disappointed me.  They never seem to get my eggs cooked the way I like them.  The corn beef hash use to be fresh and plentiful and now they are skimpy and dry.  The bacon (use to give 4 and now only 3?) my husband ordered was greasy and not crispy.  He likes his toast to be well toasted and they brought them out completely burnt.  It was sent back and all they did was scrape some of the burnt off the toast.  Our eggs were either underdone or overcooked.   They didn't even look appetizing.  The last time we were there the manager saw what was happening but didn't even come to our table to apologize.   So disappointing each time and we kept giving them another chance.  Their quantity and quality has gone down.  Most plates being fairly pricey at 10 bucks a plate for breakfast,  we think now its not worth it. Their motto "fresh and fast",  I think NOT.

I met my family here for brunch. We were a total of 8 in our party, and were sat immediately! The service was very friendly, and we never had to ask for refills or extra napkins. The food was so delicious, I had a club sandwich that was made just perfect! My father ordered the almond crusted French toast that was so delicious I will be ordering it next time we visit! Prices were decent a little on the high side, but for the quality of our meals-worth every penny! It had the same atmosphere as Wildflower Bread Co. A bit of a drive for me since I'm in Goodyear area, however it was worth it!

Breakfast...not Ihop, Denny's, or my favorite Village Inn. My wife wanted something different so we found this little cafe. It has a homey type of feel, and personally loved the decor. The menu had some cool options such as scrambles, eggs Benedict, and your typical breakfast items. My wife ordered the Cafe Mocha which she had majority hot chocolate rather than coffee, very delicious. I ordered Joe's Scramble, I hope your hungry if you decide to try it it was good with a side of pancakes. My wife ordered the French toast and she was extremely pleased! I give this place 2 thumbs up and say try it!

The food was pretty good, I had the chorizo omelet and my wife enjoyed her meal as well. The cinnamon rolls are huge, but they put WAY too much icing on them. The main issue we had was the lack of service. Once our food was dropped off we didn't see our waitress until she brought the bill.  Then we waited for some time trying to get a to-go box and drink refills. We figured we'd ask another server, but the only person we saw was the busboy. I'm hoping this isn't the norm.
Stopped for a quick bite. Super friendly staff. Food was served fast and it was tasty. Had the chicken fried steak and pancakes. Mm mm good! All for under $10. Very affordable!

Customer service has gone drastically down hill over the past year. Most of the time you have to beg someone to take your order or refill your drink, even if the place is empty.  Sometimes the food is good other times it is terrible. The pancakes are sometimes good, other times they are rubbery.  No consistency in anything anymore. Any time someone suggests  going here now I always decline or suggest somewhere else. Too bad.

The IHOP where I go tastes much better.

The food here is ehhh ok. Not that great. I was really looking forward to trying the food here too. I got the egg benedict, hash browns, and waffle w/ strawberries & whipped cream.

One positive note, at least they use FRESH strawberries on the waffles..... :)
Okay food. Overall, I-hop tastes better in my opinion. But the benedicts here are slightly better. Price is similar to I-hop.

Bacon bacon bacon!!!!! Awesome!!! 

Some of the best think crunchy bacon I have had. 

Been here several times and each time I am greeted with a smile and great service. The food is always fast and has great flavor. You can really tell that the owners care about service and their customers. 

Keep it up I will be coming back for more. 
Thank you.

Located right across the street from my apartment complex, I have dined here several times for breakfast or brunch. Biscuits has a pretty extensive menu and the items I've tried have been good but nothing spectacular. I most recently had their Brisket Benedict option which was loaded up on brisket which I loved. I've also tried their Chorizo Breakfast Tacos which were pretty good as well. Last fall I did sample their pumpkin pie (?) pancake special which didn't quite taste like pumpkin pie unfortunately but was fairly good.

Overall, I like Biscuits. It probably wouldn't always be my go-to spot but it is conveniently located and a solid place for breakfast. 

PS. Midwestern students get 10% off M-F. Get on that students!

My party of 6 last Sunday and called ahead to get a table. The table was not ready when we arrived. They were swamped.  I had the chicken Fajita omelet and it was delicious, but they forgot my pancakes. They seemed understaffed and overwhelmed. But all of my party seemed to enjoy the food and we did get a table in the corner, so it was not too loud. We did have to wait over 25 minutes for our food after ordering, but I know that is somewhat normal when you have a large table. Kudos to the staff as they tried to cover one another, which is something I appreciate.

We ate here for the first time yesterday...while the service was great, the food was mediocre. He ordered the specialty item which tasted okay, nothing to write home about. I had the cinnamon almond French toast, which didn't taste horrible but again, nothing to write home about, couldn't taste the cinnamon. In fact, I've made better French toast. I don't think we will be back.

Disappointed. I'd read the reviews and was expecting more, especially from a place called Biscuits Cafe where their motto is good food served as fast as we can.  The food was mediocre. Coffee was way too watered down. And the service was ridiculously slow.  Doubt there will be a return visit.

We were very excited to see Biscuits Cafe opening near us in Surprise but our first and most likely last visit today was very disappointing.  We arrived just before noon. They were busy but we got seated in less than 10 minutes. The main area was very cold with multiple ceiling fans going full speed. I was happy when they sat us near the roll up doors where it was warmer... Until they kicked on the AC and turned the fan on above us full speed. I will never understand why places do that as it makes your food cold so fast. We had to ask them to turn the fan off. It took forever to get our food.  I ordered mine and my sons eggs dry not runny and our bacon crisp and hashbrowns well done but my husband did not. His eggs came brown, his toast was not toasted and his bacon and hashbrowns were well done like mine but he didn't order them that way. They forgot his milk then delivered a small instead of a large and had to bring him another one.  The food was warm but not hot. I've never had tough pancakes until today.  They were dry and crisp on the edges and tough all over.  They tasted like pancakes that were cooked earlier and sat in a tray waiting to be served. We were harassed our whole meal by flies. Not a good experience.

I love the layout of Biscuits
I thought it was going to be a drab, ma and pa diner... But it is very hip and modern... The color scheme is really cute and the tables and chairs coordinate well... The chairs are pretty comfy too, their types of chairs usually aren't... 

The cashier was very helpful and knowledgable... She asked if we had been in before, and we told her that we hadn't... She gave us a run down of the menu as well as popular items and things that she liked... Today I got the corned beef hash... It's really all I get at breakfast joints... I also got a Decaf coffee... They have a beat coffee and soda bar... I think it is a great use of space... 
Their menu has some range to it, I thought it would just be breakfast but they have salads, burgers, and sandwiches..

Back to my meal... 
It is good :) 
I really like the corned beef and onions.
The hash browns are pretty standard, they're good

The biscuits are yum as well and they come with some sort of Apple strawberry jam

Also each meal comes with complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries... 

No way! Lol! I'll be here often!

My husband and I met a friend here for Sunday brunch.  There was a decent crowd, but we didn't have to wait long for a table.  The service was fast and efficient.  I enjoyed the coffee, but after perusing their menu, I kind of wish I had tried the cafe mocha since the coffee was nothing too special.  I ordered off of the "Keeping it Simple" section, where you basically get to choose three of the numerous options listed.  I did enjoy the sweet potato pancake, but as for everything else, it was pretty standard breakfast stuff.  My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy, which is their specialty.  He wasn't too impressed with it, perhaps because it was lacking in flavor.  Overall, we'd probably go back, but as far as brunch places go, this one was decent, but not very memorable.

Just spent $32 on 2 items & received the wrong item. On top of that, what we did receive correctly, was bland, greasy & unappetizing. Will Never ever use Door Dash, who is supposed to check the order or order from Biscuits. Bland bland bland. I'm going to stop by & give them some salt & pepper. Happy Mothers Day....ughhh
No complaints whatsoever.  Everything was great but I think my stomach yearns for smaller portions, cheaper prices and Grandma cooking in the back instead.

Read about this 4 star place in the paper this morning. Decided to give it a try for breakfast. Arrived at 10:15 waited 10 minutes to be seated. After another 15 minutes had to flag the manager as wait staff was walking past us but no one took our order.  It's now 11:15 no food yet and my coffee cup is empty. Not impressed will never be back regardless what the food actually tastes like. 

Food arrived, biscuit breakfast lived up to my sons expectations. Waitress  comped my drinks.
Holy moly his this place is always super busy and only open for breakfast and lunch which is bad in my book it seems like they be  losing a lot of customers
Very tasty breakfast. Got the Greek omelet. They served fresh strawberry jam for the toast. good size portion for the price. Will be back.

I was hoping for something a little better with the high prices and unique menu but not to be. I ordered the Almond crusted French Toast with sausage links and scrambled eggs. The French toast was great aside from topped with margarine and a tiny side of high fructose corn syrup. The sausage served was two burnt to death patties, not links, which were inedible and the eggs were more like an overcooked omelet with a deep golden brown crust on one side swimming in grease. It is a shame as the French toast would have been awesome with butter and a Maple Syrup for the $16.00 spent. I wondered how this place gets 1/2 bad and 1/2 fantastic reviews, now I understand the bad and won't waste any money in hopes of finding a good. No Russian Roulette for me.

I've been a couple of times.  Love the menu but food just doesn't have much flavor.  Also, there always seems to be a wait with empty tables.  It's the last time time I'm going. Besides the high prices it just doesn't seem like there are restaurant people managing it.

First time here and my expectations were exceeded.  The waffle with strawberries was delicious and not too sweet. I had three hearty pieces of bacon that were full of flavor and cooked to perfection. Scrambled eggs were light and fluffy!! I've not had such a perfectly cooked breakfast in a long time (except at home ) ;). Love this place !

My favorite breakfast place to eat!! So delicious, I usually gravitate towards the Country omelette. I also love the pancakes because they're super light and delicious. The service is great too, Yasmin is the best!!!

Nope, not at all what I expected. Mediocre at best.  Wish I could give it more stars but there is nothing to compliment. 

Our food was room temperature or cold. Who likes or wants cold potatoes or eggs. If our server had even bothered to ask, I would have mentioned the lack of heat. 

Our server was so friendly, but couldn't/didn't remember any requests we made. 

The interior is anything but comfortable. Feels like a fast food joint. 

Yes, we were disappointed. Expected and wanted it to be good.

Excellent waitress Amanda, very friendly and attentive. Prices are too high for the food. This is basically a diner on par with an IHOP, but they do professional to making fresh food, still prices are too high. My meal was so so, nothing I would return for. Place was clean and easy to find.

Service was pretty good, friendly people. However, I ordered the Florentine Benedict with red potatoes. The potatoes tasted reheated and kind of old, the hollandaise sauce was too sour and I was sick the remainder of my day. If I do go back, I would definitely order the cinnamon french toast because my friend ordered that and enjoyed it.

My son and I ate here for the first time.  The food was really good, great service and not an empty table in sight.  Only complaint was that our table was sticky  but it was taken care of immediately.  We will be going back !

Great service and atmosphere,  but the prices are on the high end and the food is so so at best. I got huevos rancheros and it was covered in some kind of chili. The eggs benedict is also slathered in sauce or gravy depending on which one you choose. I may try it again and get something else.... but probably not for these prices. The service and atmosphere are the reasons to come here.

My cousin and I stopped in at their Elliot Road location.  We were actually looking for another restaurant but couldn't find it so this was the back-up.  It was about 1:30 in the afternoon so we were about the only people in the place and they were in the process of closing for the day.  Still, the service was attentive, polite and professional.  Kind of felt like we were regular truckers on our way through Iowa.

Cousin had the pulled pork sandwich with cole slaw and I had a BLT with fries.  Both meals came with a huge, ice cold Dill pickle.  He said his meal was very tasty.  The only fault I could find with mine was the fries tasted a little bit like they'd been cooked in oil used for frying fish but it wasn't overpowering and a little malt vinegar and ketchup solved that problem.  

We each ordered iced tea and it came in a glass I swear was the size of a small jug.  No sooner had we downed about half of it when the waitress came by again with refills.  And the tea tasted like real tea too.

They had Oldies on the radio which added a bit to the country type ambiance of the place.  The menu I would describe as American comfort food right out of the Heartland.  The prices seemed a bit high until you see the size of the servings.  It was more than enough to eat.

This restaurant is in the same building that has hosted several others before it including a Denny's and a Chicago-something.  They feature a fish fry on Friday evenings, the only dinner time they are open.  I plan to try that sometime soon.  Oh, did I mention they have liver and onions?  A favorite of my wife and I and something you can't find everywhere.  That's on the bucket list too.  

UPDATE: When I originally wrote this review there were several restaurants named Biscuits but I found later they are not necessarily related.  This one is located on Elliott in front of the same strip mall that hosts the Tempe Cinema.  It has become my family favorite for breakfasts and does a great job at lunchtime too.  One of the only places where I have found liver and onions.  We have yet to attend the Friday Fish Fry but that is on my bucket list.

I arrived at 1:20pm for lunch was my first time there. Greeted right away seated a minute later and brought my coffee right away. Waitress was nice and took my order by 1:24 so I was excited. The menu said the patty melt was on rye and didn't mention that marbled fake rye but sure enough 29 minutes later that's what I got! Did I mention there were only three tables there besides me!       Patty melt wasn't that good it's really hard to find a good patty melt these days!

One of the better breakfast options in Surprise. 

The corned beef hash is delicious, and they make a great omelette here.

Service is friendly and my cup of coffee was refilled often.

I would definitely come back and try them for lunch.

Nestled into the corner of a small shopping center, Biscuit's Cafe can be easily missed if you're on the run and not really looking for a spot to sit and eat. But to those who know about it and those hungry enough to check it out are rewarded with large portions and good service.

On a sunny Friday morning, the wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast while visiting friends in the Chandler/Tempe Area. A quick Yelp search uncovered this little place nearby and decided to give it a try. The cafe is small enough to miss, but does have outdoor seating if needed and a decent sized dining room. 

The prices are fair and not over the top, with both breakfast and lunch offerings ranging in the 7-11 dollar range. For the amount of food that you receive, I'd say that it's a good deal. I had the meat lover's breakfast with pancakes and she had the corned beef hash with biscuits. The food was good, but nothing overly astonishing. The corned beef hash was obviously home made, which did make it special, but the meat to potato ratio seemed to be a bit meat heavy (which to some, wouldn't be a bad thing).

The service we received was attentive, and friendly, although a little sparse, having to flag down our server more than once to get some beverage refills. A manager also visited our table to see how we were doing.

Overall, it's a nice little place to have breakfast. The prices are decent and the atmosphere is great for what it is. Food is good, but average.

All I can say is wow. Extremely friendly staff and Amanda was my server. Very friendly and put me in a good mood and Not only was the staff awesome but the food was great. I got the eggs benedict Florentine and it was excellent. Highly recommend this place.

For being so close to home, this is a gem! I got the almond crusted French toast as well as one of the omelets with a biscuit. The French toast was to die for and had a great texture and flavor profile. The omelet had many ingredients and were all deliciously paired. One of the things that stood out to me more than anything was the raspberry jam. The biscuit with this name on it was my favorite part. I wish I could have the raspberry jam on hand at all times because it is that good! One of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots!

This place has a great breakfast menu & lots of choices. The bacon is so crispy and good! Their wheat bread is delicious and I believe made in house!! The service on the  patio was pretty slow for not being that busy..

When they first opened they were terrific.  My husband and I have been here at least 7 times, usually on a Sunday when they are horribly busy.  The last two times we were there the food left much to be desired.  I usually order the Joe's scramble, and the first time around it came out lukewarm, the bacon was not cooked properly and it just didn't taste good.  I figured it was a fluke or maybe the normal cook was sick or something.  We went last weekend and I ordered a biscuits omelete and my food was cold.
