This was amazing! We loved our server Brock!! He rocked! Lol. Food was so good and made it our new favorite breakfast place! I loved the walnut crusted French toast! Sooo good!! I posted pictures to prove!! Yum! And worth the extra $!!

Very disappointing. I had the biscuits and gravy plate. The biscuits were tiny and way too hard and the sausage was overlooked. Two tiny biscuits, two sausage patties, and two eggs for $10.50! That would be $4.99 at Denny's. My wife had the avocado Benedict and the hollandaise was not good, she couldn't eat more than a quarter of it. We love breakfast places and this had a lot of promise, but we won't be coming back.

I had to say that the existing restaurant Yelp reviews are not what I experienced.   It's been 30 days since they opened and it seems they may have pulled themselves together and resolved their issues brought up in the existing reviews. Veggie omelette was delicious and Caitlin our server was excellent.  She really provided the pleasant environment you look for at a restaurant.  Will be back for sure!

All I have to say is wow! This place is amazingly good, prices are reasonable and the environment is just so positive. Sam was our waitress and she was amazing, she made sure to have our food out fast and keep our drinks filled, she is truly a gem in this place. If your looking for a nice place to take your family for breakfast this would be the place.
This is my favorite place in the valley to goo for breakfast or brunch. Good is seasoned to perfection,  portions are large.  You will leave there very satisfied.

Heard a lot of hype about this place so I went to check it out. I will say the place itself is cool, inviting and freezing. The air is so cold I couldn't really stand it longer then I had too. Our server was nice, got our order in quickly but then at the end of our meal he was very adamant to get us out of there. He even went so far as to tell us he had to leave so we would pay, but then we were sitting there and 10 minutes later he was taking another table?? Yea that was weird and uncalled for. 

The food itself was good. I had the french toast combo, french toast was really good, eggs were average so nothing special, and sausage patties were gross I left them on the plate after trying them. My friend got the biscuits and gravy and she seemed happy with her food, but when I tried them again I was not super impressed by either the biscuits or gravy- I thought my french toast was better. So note to self- next time a place says they are known for something do not be so easily fooled.

 I do not go back to places that I rate less then 4 stars so as you can imagine I will not be back for anymore medicore food or strange servers.
Best breakfast around. A little pricey but huge potions . Staff is friendly , food is always hot and good. Sunday's there is always a wait but woth it.

Server was pleasant explained the menu.  Food was expensive...$17 tip included for one(Breakfast for Lunch)

Corned Beef Hash consisted of Stringy Corned beef, onions and a few large pieces of red potato, never seen it served in this manner. (Make my own after St. Pats)    Eggs over easy were perfect, toast and good Strawberry preserves.  The Hash Browns nice portion but the oil they were grilled on was on the  verge of turning.   Will have to think twice about going back.

It has a lot of potential and good food but service wasn't up to par. First, they let two guests bring their pet birds on the patio and let them walk around ON the table while they were eating breakfast dropping bird poo all over the table. Yuck. Second, it took our server forever to bring out our food. And i was dry on water before a runner brought our food out and wasn't able to get a refill until we saw our server next when she brought the bill. The bill had extra items on it that we didn't order so we requested that the lady ringing us up take the extra items off and she simply said only our server could change the bill. Ok... Well you would expect her to help us find the server but instead made us wander around the restaurant ourselves looking for her. They fixed it, the bill, no problem but all in all, the staff should be a bit more attentive. They were kind and polite but just a bit lazy. It could have been worse but could have been better. Food was good though so it's a shame that my fianc√© and myself won't be coming back for more :(
I love this place! The French toast is to die for, Ham Benedict is decent, the service is always fairly quick and the restaurant is clean. I'd definitely recommend going here!
SO GOOD Must get biscuits and strawberry jelly!!! Eggs benedict is really yummy also!

Came here when it opened and thought this place was stellar. Unfortunately it has lost some of its charm (and service quality) since then but I will probably return due to its proximity to Miswestern...a place where I spend most of my day. 

Things I've ordered and enjoyed:

Cinnamon french toast and chicken apple sausages- DELICIOUS french toast if you're a fan of cinnamon. and those sausages are legit!

Corned Beef sandwich with a side salad- HUGE sandwich, pretty good. The salad they gave was obviously old and wilted so I asked them to switch it out which they were nice about.

Corned beef hash and pancakes- the beef hash was chunky which was different from the mushy corned beef I'm usually used to lol. It was alright. Pancakes were standard too. 

Cons:

A bit pricey

SLOW service 


Overall a decent breakfast place, will return.

I like breakfast but never understood why simple and quick prep ingredients like it, can be charged so expensively. So I don't go out for it often. But this day was an exception. Was happy with BC's portions and more modest use of sugar in their sweet items. Service was friendly and quick. Got the "eggs your way" combo and was plenty for next day leftovers. Taste overall was average. Ham steak a bit dry and same with eggs. Husband's chicken fried steak came out piping hot which was a plus. Overall avg. but for the value (portion:quality:price) may be back when I'm in the mood for breakfast outing.

Came for breakfast and had the chorizo omelet and my girlfriend had the cinnamon roll French toast. Definitely would recommend both, maybe I'm weird for not thinking of it but they literally used a cinnamon roll they make in house! Eating and people watching all the waiters seemed very pleasant to be around and more than catered to everyone's needs. Shoutout to John(the super tall waiter) he was dope and extra friendly and always made sure we were okay. I also saw him taking care of a table next to us. As he brought the check and twice afterwards checked on them and offered boxes and cleaning as he went( as in-between johns visits they were trying to justify only tipping a few dollars on an estimated $50 dollar tab) so props to the whole crew for dealing with those kind of people I'm assuming they get a lot.(you know who you are, jerks)

As the service was a bit slow, the food made up for the lack of attentiveness of the male server.  
One of the better places off the strip to have breakfast

This place is AMAZING!

I found this place by accident when I went into what I thought was the side door for Dilly's Deli and got a super happy surprise.

Their portions are huge, and really reasonably priced.

Also, I like how every meal comes with a chocolate-covered strawberry. 

The staff and cooks are friendly and willing to accommodate dietary needs (I'm allergic to wheat).

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!

This was our first visit to Biscuits.  My husband ordered a Western Burger that was humongous! He could only eat half and had the remaining half for dinner. I ordered the California Club which was fantastic. I also could only eat half & saved the rest for later.  Service was great, servers were polite and made sure our coffee mugs were full.  We will be returning as this will be one of our go to's for late breakfast/ lunch outings!

I had the southwest scramble and a cinnamon roll.  Both were delicious! We also had really good service.  The building is new and has some sky lights and windows.  Very nice.  Too bad they aren't open late, there is a perfect space for a stage for live music or karaoke.

I've been here twice now for breakfast. The wait for a table usually isn't that long, however the wait for your food is. 

We definitely got two different experiences both times we went. I Ordered the biscuits corned beef hash with an over easy egg. The corned beef was extremely dry and my egg was not over easy. It was more over medium I want to say. It took about 30 minutes to get our food and they originally gave us someone else's food. 

On another note they have a very good country fried steak. That's probably the only thing that I've really enjoyed there and would order if I did come back.

This has to the worst breakfast place ever!!! The food was gross!! Although our service was good. First off the coffee was ok and there was no fresh cream only package cream, second we asked our server about the chicken fried steak. He said it was the best thing on menu. But it comes frozen!?!? After our food came we asked a few more questions because it didn't taste right. Everything they have and serve is FROZEN!!!!! Even the eggs are not real eggs! They come in a huge bag!!! My eggs Benedict I took back because the eggs and hollandaise was all watery!!! I don't get it. This place was packed?!?! We will never eat here again!!!! Waste of money!!! It only gets one star for our server!

They must have hired all new staff!! This morning staff was horrible !!!!! I was walked pass three times before anyone acknowledged me. The server was not friendly and acted as if she was offended she had to talk to me. This by far has been the worse service ever and I've been coming here since they've opened. I ended up not ordering and left with much disgust.

I visit here frequently today the service was less than desired. I decide to try something different today. I had the turkey veggie scramble. It was great the turkey was deli turkey I guess I  expected turkey sausage not deli meat. The potatoes and biscuits with the raspberry compote was delicious. Although the service was slow the food was hot when served. For that I have four stars instead of 3.

What a great family place to spend a breakfast at!  The owners are just wonderful and bend over backward to make sure your visit is perfect.  The wait staff is attentive and friendly. And the food... just down home GREAT!  I like the Corned Beef hash... But everything is good.  My cycling friends love coming here after a ride.
Great place staff is friendly price is average clean place enjoy coming 2 times a month at least with sister and they have a reward program

As far as breakfast joints go Biscuits is 5 stars. We visited here yesterday for the first time and we will soon be back. It was busy, very busy but the wait wasnt long at all, maybe 10/15 mins to be seated.  Our waitress (maybe Kathryn) was great and recommended their cinnamon roll to start off with and it was the best we have ever had! I had an omlett with fresh veggies and perfectly crispy hash browns along with delicious pancakes. I noticed a few tables beside us getting antsy. Asking about why the food didnt come out as fast as they were expecting. To those people i say" look around clearly they are busy, no they didnt forget. It takes time to cook that many plates of food. Patience is a virtue and life necessity, especially when dining out. If you dont have patience maybe stay home and cook your own food."
Thank you Biscuits we thoroughly enjoyed are meal, sevice and the coffe is good too!

Was out on vacation from California and decided to give this location a try. Let me just tell you there food was amazing. I got the 2 egg breakfast and it was a lot of food. Had a hard time finishing it. Overall there service was great if I am ever in town ill go there again.
The food was really amazing. I got the Veggie Head omelette that came with hash browns and pancakes... Which is a lot of food for a decent price. Great place for a lunch date and yummy food.
Healthy, hearty, wonderful go to breakfast place. They always hit he spot with their delicious jams and amazing biscuits and meat lover scrambles!
Very poor quality of food! Basically: it sucks. Any Waffle House serves better food than this joint! Don't go there. Waste of money

Came here for the first time and was pleasantly surprised with the portions of the food here! There was no wait when we walked in, everything was clean and neat.  Our server was very nice and helpful.  We ordered our food, it came out in a timely manner and was served hot.  

My scramble was good, lots of veggies which caused it to be a little watery.  The strawberry jam is homemade and SO yummy, I could eat it by the spoonful, the toast was perfect.  

The server took my scramble back to the kitchen to cook the water out and brought back the ENTIRE meal!  I was only expecting the scramble to come back, and when I asked she said, "that's how we do it here, we make things right."

The only reason I gave 4 star is because of the prices of the food.  The meal ran me about $60 for 2 adults and 2 kiddos.

Kudos to Biscuits Cafe for great service, good food and amazing portions.
Nothing special nothing bad decent breakfast food a step up from Denny's and ihop. Breakfast sausage was a bit dried out. I would eat again because it's conveniently located next to my job..

Nice place right around the corner from our home.Today we called in a breakfast we had the almond crusted French toast and the Ham & eggs and hash browns with biscuits and gravy. We brought the food home and it was just as good as eating it there only thing we missed were their delicious jam(jelly) thanks guys!

I am a little bit surprised to see that this place is not have more 5 star ratings. Time and time again we have gone and it has always been over the top outstanding. If you want the best corned beef brisket you've ever had, this is the place you want to try. Just about everything is made from scratch including their fruit spreads for the toast and biscuits. Time and time again we have gotten Melissa as our server and she has always been nothing short of delightful. You have to try this place.

We drove in from SD to visit family and we were told this was the spot for breakfast. I'm glad we did cause this spot was AMAZING!!! 
They are known for their cinnamon rolls and biscuits! This is solely a breakfast/brunch spot. They close pretty early and they were super packed for a Saturday morning. 
Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious and if we are ever back in AZ, we definitely will be returning to try more and more of their dishes. And of course that mouth watering cinnamon roll!! 
Again...I'm not sure why this place only had three and a half stars . This is definitely a 5 star joint!!!

One of our favorite breakfast places. Portions are large though service can be slow. Also had an issue with getting CRISPY bacon once but they are better now. Everyone is very friendly. Tables a bit close together but a neighborhood place and will be back.

The service was 5-star excellent by a very experienced server.  The food was also excellent.  I ordered an egg white veg. omelet.  It came with very generous sides of potatoes and something else, which I substituted for raw tomatoes since it was way too much food for one person to eat at one sitting.  My companion had a pancake/scrambled egg combo which was again...way too much food if one has a normal appetite.  For a big eater, this is a great place!  The manager was most definitely visible and "hands-on" in the visible kitchen.  If you are into a "breakfast/lunch/close at 2:30pm" kind of place, Biscuits Cafe should be on your to-do list.  Pretty, clean, and pretty good food.

The biscuits and gravy are great and the combo plate (eggs, ham or sausage, etc.) is a generous portion size. The coffee was not good at all, but the food well made up for that. Loved the atmosphere and "homey" decorations.

The atmosphere is good. I like the wall art. We had a friendly waitress. Great location. Adequate parking. The food, was just ok. I had an egg white and turkey scramble. There was not much flavor. My friend had an all meat omelet with not much meat and a lot of eggs! Again, Not a lot of flavor. I'm glad I tried it out but it won't be my first choice for breakfast in the future!

My wife and I came for breakfast for the first time. Overall pretty good. Our over medium eggs could've cooked a little longer but really that's my only negative feedback about the food. The bacon was delicious. I like crispy hash browns and they definitely were. 

Our server Brook was very good and did a nice job of up-selling by immediately offering a cinnamon roll to share. Whenever someone says they have something ranked #1 I'm always up for a taste test. It was delicious. Our food came out fast and hot. The server also brought out "recommended" jams for our toast. Nice job showing off the restaurant by the server. At the end she brought us 2 waters to go with lemon. Very nice! This is AZ it's hot out!

One recommendation would be to switch to squeeze bottle ketchup because you're going to have customers sticking potential dirty knives up inside the bottles when the ketchup doesn't come out. No I didn't do that ;) I just shook the hell out of it but who wants to do that? Nice job overall we'll be back!

Stopped in for the first time yesterday and I was extremely impressed. I live right down the street from Biscuits but I only noticed it a couple weeks ago. 
The menu was fairly extensive and had anything you could want as far as breakfast goes. I went with Joe's Scramble which came with a choice of toast, biscuits, or pancakes. I chose the biscuits (comes with 2) and all my food was very good. I'm not sure if the rest of the menu comes in such large portions but I wasn't even able to finish the whole meal. 
Everything was in the $7-10 price range; more than reasonable for the quality. I'd recommend this place to anyone, especially if you don't feel like waiting to be seated at one of the more crowded breakfast places in Tempe.

Our first trip to Biscuits.  Seemed expensive for breakfast, but then the portions were huge. Next time we would split a meal. Our server, Brook was excellent. The coffee was old or burnt. So split a meal and get water to drink.

I don't always make it to brunch because I like to stay up late and sleep-in even later but when I do, it's usually because I'm craving eggs benedict.  

I'm talking beautifully poached eggs, waiting to ooze out runny yolks at the gentle prick of a fork or knife, slathered generously with velvety smooth hollandaise sauce with just the right amount of citrus... yaaaaas!  That's what J-WoW likes!  Yes, it's bad for you.  We're talking about condensing all your daily recommended allotment for protein, fat [50+ grams], cholesterol [500+ mg], calories [1,000+], and salt into ONE SERVING.  Throw on a side of hash browns and a giant cinnamon roll to nibble on while waiting for your dish and its like, wow, what even?  But like I said, I'm not up for brunch usually and I certainly don't eat breakfast during my work days so why not?  It's Saturday.  Can I live?

So I came to Biscuits Cafe for my eggy indulgence.  While I positively drooled over their warm gooey cinnamon roll that was probably the size of my face, I was already fantasizing about sliding my knife across a gorgeous poached egg.  I wanted my knife to mar that perfection hidden behind hollandaise and spew its yolky guts all over my plate as I lick my knife clean and marvel at the gruesome display.  I swear we're talking about assassinating eggs, people.  What I got though were soft medium-boiled eggs and hollandaise sauce with no hint of lemon juice.  My heart was sad but it was still demolished.  Although I did trade half of one of my avocado eggs benedict for a few bites of Southern Delight scramble.  Dang.  That was some greasy egg, yo.

While I do think the quality and ingredients are decent at Biscuits, I don't think I'll be popping in to fulfill my eggs benedict craving.  Dat cinnamon bun doe.  Mmm!

I was really looking forward to having breakfast tomorrow at one of my favorite places with my family with the best server in town Kellie but her schedule changed without notice. A little bummed so i guess i have to find another place until she works on Sunday again.

I thought this was a great place to stop for breakfast. Price was comparable to other restaurant in the Phoenix area and the atmosphere was nice. Overall it was a good breakfast with a very impressive menu. We will go back for sure.

Being new to Arizona we are still finding great places. This is one of them. I've noticed it in my travels and on Tuesday for hubby's birthday breakfast we stopped in. I love the decor! It's a great atmosphere to enjoy a fantastic meal. 

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the waitress spoke to only me the entire time and only acknowledged my husband to take his order. Hmm.

Anyway, the food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. It's a nice place to get a tasty breakfast. I would come here over the pancake place a few feet away any day. I like the build your own option because I can select just enough.

On our way out we asked about the rewards club mentioned on the receipt. Kris, with a K, explained it, signed us up and when we told him it was Robert's Birthday he honored the $5 birthday treat! Now if that's not great customer service.

I enjoyed our first visit and will be back. Picture of my delicious plate coming up.

I went here with my dog because they had an outdoor patio.  It isn't set up very nicely for outdoors and they could use the heaters as well. 
The staff were very friendly and did take very good care of me and the pooch! They loved him and did visit a lot.

this restaurant is listed under gluten free. do not eat here. no gluten free menu or selections. they need to be removed from gluten free. very very pricey for a breakfast. no specials or discounts do not recomend

I have to say, I wanted to give this place only 2 stars because it really was "Meh" however; it has great potential so I think as they get into their groove everything will improve. The menu for one has a lot of selection for breakfast entrees. So you get your standard, traditional entrees and then the twist on the classics too. I almost gave in to the almond crusted french toast but at $10.59 I opted for the traditional french toast which only had one slice and 2 other items for $8.59. The interior could use some "freshening", it's pretty drab. I believe it was the actual owner that greeted and seated us (later he was talking to some patrons at another table) but he was mundane and not very friendly. Our waitress however; was very sweet and attentive. The prices seems a little high since they are just comparable to a Good Egg or maybe a step above Denny's. The food was mediocre but again, I'd like to try other items to get a better overall feel. We went about 10:30 on a Weds and it wasn't crowded but not dead either. This particular restaurant pad has been at least 4 other places that I know of so will see if this time next year if it's still thriving. But still, nice to have a decent breakfast place in Chandler that is not a chain.
The food seemed overcooked when we went. Unfortunately didn't leave an impression to go back again. Had high hopes since it's right by our house

I went here for the first time. What an awesome restaurant! I had the southwest delight with hash browns and biscuits. It was so delicious and filling. The service was great. What a friendly staff! Would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family.

Came in for the first time today. We had a party of 6; 3 adults and 3 children. Once we were seated it took awhile for someone to take our drink order. We ordered a cinnamon roll, oatmeal, chicken and sweet potato waffles, steak and eggs, corned beef hash, & 2 children's chocolate chip pancakes. The food was brought out in a reasonable time frame. That was a plus, especially when you got a hungry 1 year old! The cinnamon roll was nice and warm. The oatmeal wasn't anything fancy, but it came with biscuits which were alright. There was also milk, brown sugar, dried fruits and nuts for it. The chicken and waffles were good. However, I think it was just frozen chicken tenderloins. The steak was well done, though it should've been medium well. The corned beef hash needed more seasoning. The chocolate chip pancakes were huge for something off the kids menu! Now we know that a 9 year old and 5 year old can share 1 order. Overall, everything was good. The prices were fair considering the huge portions.

Name is misleading. In fact i would have given 3 stars if at least their biscuits didn't look and taste exactly like dinner rolls. They bring out a little bowl of strawberry jelly. Normally i don't do jelly but it was so bland it needed it. Was expecting a casual cozy atmosphere. Extra tiny tables and cheap chairs. More of a trendy downtown vibe. Everyone's polite and professional, but they sort of hover or buzz around. I imagine their boss tells them to hustle and compete to clean tables. Which is normally great right? Somehow it strikes of a frantic commission sales environment. Anyways.... Had corn beef hash breakfast. Plenty of corn beef but almost zero hash which made it more like the dinner corned beef not the breakfast. Disappointing. Side potatoes good but not great. Nothing really special or flavorful. Food was warm not hot despite arriving in 3 minutes. I think everything was precooked except my eggs. Ordered 2 pancakes as well. Nothing unique or great there either. Little packets of flavored instant creamer on the tables.

We are new to the area and found Biscuits on Yelp....in two visits they have exceeded expectations with great, friendly service and awesome food. Very busy at times but worth the wait. Portions are nice, eggs poached perfect, consider a share on the chicken fried...lol

Dismally Disappointing. Ordered a cinnamon roll--after seeing the example on a plate by the register & getting my hopes up--to munch on while we read the menu. It came fresh from the microwave, mushy and swimming in frosting--which was not how it was shown. When I asked if their were 2 types, the manager told yes, 1 with & 1 without frosting. Would have been nice if the server had explained instead of assumed. My breakfast had to be sent back. 15 minutes later husband is finishing his and we had to ask for the whereabouts of my meal. Whenitfinally arrived, it was obvious it had been sitting under the warmer for 15 minutes. We had to ask for drink refills and the check. Service was horrible. Food was meh. Whole experience was underwhelming.

Had breakfast here for first time. Hard to find parking but food was great. Portion is humongous, couldn't finish so took togo. Service is nice and fast. My waitress was Kathy. She was very nice and friendly.

Friendly staff, horrible bakery. I had the coffee crumb cake and a latte, my wife had the breakfast burrito. 

The latte tasted like those from a gas station, the kind that also makes hot chocolate.

The coffee cake had no flaver and the "crumb" on top had the consistency of century old sandstone.

The breakfast burrito was supposed to have bacon, but it looked more like bacon bits. . .or really old bacon that was broken into very small pieces. 

Really felt like a waste of money and time. I also did not like how dark the lighting was.

I had lunch before my one year olds Gymboree class and Biscuits is a nice spot in the plaza and more kid friendly than Zipps. The breakfast looked amazing . I was boring and ordered a soup and salad . The soup was Yankee Pot Roast which has down home cooking all over it ; it was hearty, full of yummy veggies . The salad was a little wilted and had chocolate chips in it and i assume that was by accident since there were three. Grossed me out so bad i couldn't eat it .  The food looked really good and might give it another try when i have a cheat day.

Coffee wasn't that good, very cheap tasting. The biscuits were dry and my weren't cooked to my order. The gravy was flavorless and bacon undercooked.
Maybe I had a bad chef that day but damn, was not worth it.

Great breakfast this Saturday morning. Over easy eggs cooked just right, crispy bacon, and golden brown has browns. My brother had eggs with a blue berry pancake and bacon. We both enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and the friendly servers. Perfect breakfast spot.

The food was amazing! The place a little busy, but it was Sunday. Friendly staff. Great place!

*****
Update: my mom, son and I had to wait more than 30 minutes to receive or food. The prorated tasted funny and I want able to eat them due to the weird taste. Distasted with the wait times.

Food was ok. There was a hair in my fruit bowl...I have Celiacs and needed gluten free options. When I asked our waitress for a gf menu, I got a very cavalier "No." When we asked about just gf options, again it was a "no. No options." Our waitress just seemed like she did not give an ounce of care. And naturally that really irritated me. She didn't offer any information or care to show us what things may be cross contaminated or if they added anything. So what I ordered was all at my own risk. And now I am not feeling well.
And after that it seemed like she had a bit of an attitude with us. 
Just not great customer service all around.
My husbands burger patties were also a bit dry. 
Don't think I'll be coming back.

Recently moved to surprise. Wanted a good go to breakfast place. And found it. I love their French toast. And really good bacon. It's not all thin and flimsy. Quick service and the price is reasonable for the amount of food you get.

I waited and watched for the place to open since it's right by a store I call on and sometimes I just want something besides fast food. I should have stuck with the fast food. I ordered BLT with avocado (paid extra for the avocado) and fries as a side. The "avocado " was two measly slices (not even half an avocado); the bacon was limp, the fries greasy and cold and the tomato was underripe. My bill was over $12.00 for $3.00 worth of edible food. The toast was okay. Never again. Spend your money elsewhere.

Little weary after seeing the initial stars on Yelp. But after ordering and getting the food it exceeded our expectations. Service was a little slow but coffee and water stayed full. Everyone in our party was happy with their meal and would for sure come back again.

My family and I have been here several times for breakfast.  We live fairly near by, but we would travel pretty far to enjoy a meal here.  Friendly service, great food and a big variety.  I especially love their homemade raspberry jam served with toast and biscuits.  I've had the country omelette with the gravy - wonderful!

Bad news the old man who ownes these restaurants does not care about the customer reviews. Upper management are a bunch  of kids who have no education on how to run a 17 restaurants. Spend your money at egg & jo or some place that is not ran by grandpas kids who are clueless. I was a regular customer who left because when a man who knew how to treat customers and his staff was let go because the owner was cheep I was done.
Always love having breakfast or brunch here. The food and service are very enjoyable and the staff is very friendly.

This place was actually not bad at all... I had gotten kind of scared before because of the low 3.5 star rating as well as looking at the pictures of the food other helpers had posted (I am a very visual person) but I happened to be by this place and I was stuck in that area and was hungry so I thought I would give it a try. We had chicken and waffles, eggs Benedict with ham & children's menu pancake with bacon and eggs. When i first looked at the pancake, I was a bit concerned, it looked a bit thick and doughy and imperfect... But when i tasted it, it was delicious! The bacon was good as well, thick and crispy! Definitely not the cheap kind. The waffles were delicious as well, light and crunchy, just the way I like it. The chicken fingers were good enough for the teenager. And also, the kids meal was a pretty good size for a kids meal. The eggs Benedict were ok as well. Service- good. Price range- around $10 per meal on average. Ambience- was so-so... Clean enough, but nothing fancy, could use a bit of improvement but definitely not a make or break type of deal. The drinks though- My iced tea was just so-so and needed more ice. So I guess overall they just need to improve on presentation and aesthetics. But my recommendation definitely is to give this place a try. You might just be delighted!

I had always wanted to eat here and got the chance today. The service was fine but the food was not great.  If you name your restaurant BISCUITS then they should be memorable.  These were perhaps the worst biscuit ive ever had. Hard dry..KFC biscuit are better! My ehgs were way undercooked and my bacon was cooked I think last week. Im disappointed and will nor be coming back. Nor should you go either..
Now this place is worth the drive.  Sunday morning a little busy, but that's what happens when its a good place.  We go after church.

These days this is my favorite GO TO Sunday breakfast!! There are many good things about this place.

1. Good service!! The staff is cheerful and accommodating.  I hate walking into a restaurant and not being acknowledged because the staff is too "busy" to say a quick welcome. RUDE!! But this place always greets and updates you on how long your wait would be.
2. GOOD food!! My fave on the menu is the Almond Crusted French Toast!! It's great to find a restaurant that adds something different to their menu. I love that it's not that rich but full of flavor.  AMAZING!! Last week I had the blueberry pancakes. NOM NOM!!
3.  Ample parking! The parking lot gets full but the turn around is great and I always find a spot.

Thank you Biscuits Cafe!! I can never get sick of you :)

Came here for breakfast with the intention of staying a few hours to study.  I had an omelette which was okay, but the  waiters kept coming by to see if I was okay after I had finished their food and was studying...even though there was hardly anyone else there.

I do not understand the great reviews of this place. If your namesake is "Biscuits", maybe you should do those exceptionally well? Or at least modestly well? The biscuits were small, terrible, expensive and slow to arrive. The rest of breakfast wasn't great either. The waitress was clueless to the menu items.

This restaurant was just opened up a week ago and it is already packed when I got here this morning. The restaurant is clean, organized and spacious. Service is as good as you are going to get since they are super busy. The crowd was super loud, I could barely hear our conversation.  Majority of the customers are elders and retired folks... (interesting). I don't know if I would bring my friends to hang out here. The receptionist area is so crowded and unorganized I did not even know who to speak with and get a table. It was chaotic. Neverthelsss, we got seated fairly quickly. 

The flavor of the food was VERY disappointing. I ordered a berry waffle with two eggs and sausages. The waffle was not all the way cooked. It was smushy and tasteless even after adding lots of syrup on it. Sausages were tasteless. I know I was eating waffles and sausages but yet I couldn't taste any of it. The gravy that my friend had isn't as good as other location neither. Overall, we are very disappointed in what we had. 

We did see the owner walking around saying hi to "selective tables". It would have been nice if he bothered to stop by and asked us how we are going instead of skipping us over....Him and I crossed eye contact once. His smile was so not genuine maybe it is better off that he didn't bother talking to us. 

Since it is their first week grand opening, we will come back here and try it again in a few weeks. Hopefully the food and the atmosphere will change on my our next visit.

Brought my husband and kids here for what was supposed to be a nice family breakfast. Average bland food with mediocre decor. Obviously understaffed for a weekend.  And who runs out of ice?!!  Really. 
Waited for 40 minutes to be seated (expected), waited another 45 minutes for the food (ridiculous). And by the time we got it, it was cold.  Not worth it!  Don't waste your time waiting here.

Good choice for a breakfast place that doesn't get as crowded as other places.  Not so trendy, maybe, or just because it's right next to LA Fitness and most people don't want to get caught stuffing their mouths right next to the gym?  The food is good and the portions are ginormous like other breakfast places.
I do enjoy their home-made jam (which they sell). The raspberry one was amazing.  
Has a patio, so that's good.
Me and my girl just had breakfast it was great got here close to closing time service was great. Will be back
